name: Gigino At Wagner Park
address: 20 Battery Pl, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Gourmet Italian food at reasonable prices. The service was exemplary. The sunset view over the Hudson was spectacular. We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner. Take some time to walk around the waterfront. This is NYC at its best!
Fast service. Nice staff. Food came quick. 10/10!

Food was incredibly good. Appetizers, Main Course, and Dessert. I've been all over Italy and preferred this place to anything that I've had there. Servings are not huge, but the quality of the food was the reason for that. Was very full after, not sure how to explain that, but I wasn't hungry at all even 8 hours later. Servers were very friendly. No wait at all to get in or to be served. Very generous with the appetizers.

This spot is my preferred one. I go to many restaurants but to this one I go the most. The crew is very welcoming and the food they cook is so fresh and tasty. I am always happy to have a decent dinner in this place. I highly recommend this place.
Fantastic place to have an Italian lunch/dinner overlooking the Hudson River, even with views to the Statue of Liberty. A must to if you're around the Financial Distric area.

name: Waves Cafe
address: New Amsterdam Pavilion Battery Park, Peter Minuit Plaza, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Cheap, no wait, you can eat whatever you bought in the park

name: The Oyster House at Pier A
address: 22 Battery Pl, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: This was a good place to hang out.  My crew had soups, old bay fries and tacos, all good. Half the restaurant had a great view of the NY harbor including the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. Service was casual. We had to order at the bar. Don’t know if it is so during peak times. We were there from 4-5.
Fantastic Venue, Amazing Service. I had a blast for that being my first time there. Very very clean.i will take more pics next time

Beautiful setting, stunning views of Lady Liberty, delicious food. Was here for a wedding reception and it was a blast! Just looked at the menu and was blown away by how reasonable the prices are. A great way to spend a night out, or a special occasion.
Kind of understaffed when we were here. Haddock was awesome but the clam bellies and chowder were just okay. A little overpriced for the quality.  But a good place to chill and drink.

name: Battery Park
reviews: Nice and tidy park. You can enjoy walking around or bench-sitting here. Relaxation. From here you can also take a ferry to the Statue of Liberty. Otherwise, you have a beautiful view on it from park. There are many outdoor shows in the park. As well as some monuments honoring soldiers and explorers.

Underrated and amazing spot in New York City. I've been to New York a million times as my family is from Brooklyn but I've never been to this park. It's beautiful, spacious, and kept clean. Nearby are pieces of the Berlin Wall, the raging bull statute, a viewpoint for the Statue of Liberty, and several beautifully made memorials for the Armed Forces. I highly recommend walking about this entire area but definitely make sure to wander through Battery Park. Castle Clinton, the immigrants statue, and several other sites are a must see.

I feel like this area should be updated.  As a tourist, it felt very run down and could use some love.  If it is the official place to view the statue, it didn't feel like it.  The monuments were impressive.

Beautiful park at the bottom tip of the island.. it's filled with tourists gawking at statue of liberty during the day and it's quietly peaceful and beautiful at night with all the vintage-style street lights overlooking the brightly lit statue of liberty. Definitely worth a visit for tourists and local alike.

I love this place.It's so beautiful if you see it at sunset. Battery Park is one of the most unforgettable places that I've been in NYC. I will definitely come back when I have a chance to go NYC again. It's a must go!!👍👍😭❤

name: Wagner Park
address: 20 Battery Pl, New York, NY 10280, USA
reviews: A beautiful park, albeit a little bit small. Definitely a nice place to sit for a while and collect your thoughts. Very close to the Holocaust remembrance museum, and a great place to reflect on what you learned there. Walking distance from the Staten Island ferry, this is certainly worth a little detour.

I had a walk along there, and I also did the ferry wheels cruise, it was so fun. Hell of a good time for me, I saw the statue of bridge, Brooklyn bridge and many more. Helicopter tour if anyone is interested. Plenty of people in the cruise, and a man there to tell you guys about the history of the city. Great time
Please don’t miss visiting this park. The view of the harbor is amazing. If you like the outdoors, I highly recommend this place to you. Sit down and just relax.

This place is my old stomping ground! The boat traffic and sunsets are amazing and breath-taking! If you are looking for a peaceful, tranquil, restful spot, this is your spot!  You can even see the  spectacular fireworks on holidays from this location! The park staff always pleasant and helpful! Clean bathrooms!
Nice place. Peaceful, great view of Statue of Liberty and more..

name: East Coast Memorial
address: Battery Park, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: East Coast Memorial is located in Battery Park at the southern tip of Manhattan. It is erected in memory of US soldiers fallen at sea during World War II. The memorial is solemn and spiritual in its simplicity. A beautiful site, surrounded by the sea, the skyscrapers and trees of Battery Park. Especially beautiful at sunset.
Very stoic and thought-inspiring. Good place to  sit for a while and just contemplate things.

This is a moving and very powerful Monument. The names of allthe  sailorsand  soldiers that died in the waters off the east coast during World War Two, are inscribed on the walls around a powerful eagle statue.
Great place to walk, a lot of shops nearby.

It was extremely enjoyable, although there was a heavy crowd at the nearby ferry to the Statue of Liberty, she herself was able to be seen from the memorial leaving beautiful sights in both directions and the opportunity to sit down and watch the waves or see the names of honored men and women in the memorial.

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
address: 2 Broadway FRNT 4, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: From the moment  you enter that restaurant  they give you a pleasant feeling. Very courteous team, it is a lovely restaurant to go out with your friends or with your date. delightful  meals, talented  chief cook and stuff, good  pay and nice  service. Warmly recommended.

I like this Chipotle because the food is always fresh and it tastes amazing! The food area and dining room is usually clean and at times messy. I would say that the bathroom needs to be cleaned more often. Other than that, the Margarita's are the bomb!!! The crew that works there are very well mannered and do their job.
I like their food, you can sample your own bowl/burrito. Sometimes it is too crowded but staff is fast. I think if you choose the right stuff you can almost call it healthy fast food

I love this location, the food is always top-notch and the staff is amazing, specially manager Alma. This is one of the best locations without a doubt. The food is always fresh, thus I'm a very satisfied customer.

Nice ambience and very tasty customisable rice bowls. Being a vegetarian it's difficult to find the good places to eat but in Chipotle you have an option to add veggie items as per your choice. Rates are very nominal and very from $8-$10 per bowl.

name: Central Market Grill
address: 4 South St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Outstanding service by Rosa and Pearla. Great food at reasonable price, and great beer specials.  It's like walking into cheers if you are a ferry regular.  Enjoy!
Good place to get a quick bite getting on or off the ferry to Staten Island.

Overpriced. Also I didn't like the food: I've ordered Cesar salad. 

1. It was supposed to be with dressing, however they've changed me additional for dressing.

2. Croutons was bad, it tastes like it was already expired, and it was kinda wet.

P.S. $2.50 for small Poland Spring bottle is ridiculous.
Prices are terrible
I need to know why they charge .39 for honey in tea?! Everyone doesn't use sugar or sweeteners.

name: The Dead Rabbit Grocery and Grog
address: 30 Water St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews:
Easily one of the best spots in New York. Went in a group of four and we all loved our food. Food was amazing, top notch. Cocktails were class, A1. We all loved our drinks and a nice cocktail menu besides the classics. 
We all got free Irish coffees before we left, they were beautiful. 
Highly recommend.

Went there on a Friday night and definitely a popular spot in the area! Pretty busy and cramped downstairs just like any pub at happy hour but once you get upstairs, it is an entire other story. Would absolutely recommend getting a table to really experience the Dead Rabbit. Fantastic service! Just going through the menu was an experience in itself with its graphic novel theme and the server was very knowledgeable and helpful whenever we had questions about their unique drinks. After we received our drinks and food, the waitress realized they needed our table and moved us to another which was no problem at all but then after it made our visit truly memorable. We were put, in my opinion, a better table and the service was very apologetic(even though it was no inconvenience to us). They gave us a round of their amazing Irish Coffees and some delicious bread pudding! Can not over state the service that we received and made me feel like I was back in Ireland. Can't wait to go again and try some more of their unique drink concoctions! Thank you for an awesome night Dead Rabbit!

A two story restaurant and bar. The first floor is an Irish bar with a large menu and plenty of drink options. It's the upstairs cocktail bar that makes this place for me. A changing menu of amazing cocktails. The staff are very helpful at finding the right drink for you. Definitely have the Irish coffee before you go

Fantastic Experience! Came into Town to Visit my sister with my parents and took them to the Parlour on the 2nd Floor. The level of service was impeccable, the food was amazing and the Cocktails were unreal. Lived up to the Hype. Highly Recommend! 

P.S.- For the food, I highly recommend the lamb chop pops. I could have eaten 8 of those in one sitting.

Such a cool place! Wanted to come for a long time and glad I finally made it. Came pretty early on a Saturday in November, maybe 5 pm, and it was already decently full. In the downstairs part it kind of reminds me of a fancier cocktail version of McSorley's with the old school decor and sawdust on the floor, but it's still really chill and not stuffy. There are two sides of the bar although there's more seating on the far side. We (3 of us) put our name down for a table and we luckily got one after 10-15 only which was nice because it was crowded enough to be uncomfortable standing if you didn't have a spot at the bar. Cocktails are inventive and fun and we didn't get food but it looked good.

We then went upstairs after putting our name down and not waiting that long. Upstairs has such a different vibe, and this was the dead rabbit I was expecting. It's darker, quiet, and there are tables / seats for everyone with no loiterers or unnecessary crowds. This is where the menu looks like a graphic novel / dark comic book and I just absolutely loved it!! I couldn't read the whole thing at the time, but it also appeared to be part of a series so I didn't have the background, but I loved it all the same. Pages and pages of different cocktails went with the story (I think?) and were arranged from lightest to booziest. They were excellent and I loved everything about it. They also give you a little starter drink served in a tiny teacup, love!

Then we went back downstairs after and met a few more people, and they got in no problem. Such a cool spot with two different vibes depending on what you're looking for, both awesome! Will be back if I'm in this neighborhood!

name: Flavors Cafe
address: 27 Whitehall St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Great place too buy food. Very clean. Good people.
One of the top places in the city to get everything from fresh salads to unique breakfast sandwiches to pasta meals made right in front of your eyes. The best!
Good food options but absolutely terrible WiFi. Under 1 Mbps! Do not come here if you intend on eating and working. Management knows the issue and refuses to do anything about it.
This taste amazing. Perfect for the cold weather.
Non pork menu. Nice variety of selections, clean, very pleasant staff. If they were to ever run out of anything, (they never do), it because their offerings are excelent!!

name: Bombay's
address: 60 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: This place is located at exact place which is near by Battery Park. After watching status of Liberty this is the best place to have food. The place has variety of food items in variety of cuisines. The taste of food items is very good. The staff is very polite and helpful. Loved the food here. Would like to recommend all who are visiting Battery Park or nearby areas.

It's a good place.  Convenient to Wall Street.  Often too busy to find a table between 12-2 pm so be prepared to eat back at your desk.  A little expensive for what you get.  I would go more often if they provided more value.

Bombay is an excellent restaurant. It came highly recommended by my boss and coworkers. The service is excellent; from the moment you walk in, you get a friendly welcome, all questions answered about the menu and my server brought over some extra surprises with the meal. He presented my beer bottle as if it were a bottle of fine wine. The food is fresh and delicious; great portions and servings. Would definitely recommend to anyone in search of good Indian cuisine.
Good place for meal. My favorite is chana bhatura.

Hard to notice this little joint while walking on pearl street, but once you are inside the service and food is possibly the best in the lower Manhattan area. Very reasonable rates. We got the nice crunchy pappads to start with. Ended up ordering Malabari fish curry and Chicken 65. The kingfisher beer was a great surprise too. It’s been so long since I had one. The service staff was very prompt. Checked in once in a while to see if everything was going well. The service was really fast too.  Overall great experience.

name: Shorty's
address: 62 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Great Philadelphia cheese steak sandwiches and perfectly made French fries that are served hot and crispy without being greasy. There is a good selection of quality beers, a well stocked bar, and friendly barmaids that are happy to help you pick something from the many choices on the menu and put together a sandwich or other order that is made with exactly what you want.  There are happy hour and late night specials and combos you can order. There are other options on the menu but you really should try the cheese steak sandwich. I recommend the Old Bay fries.

Great bar for after work. They have a really good rotating selection of craft beers. My only complaint is that the beer taps need to be cleaned ASAP. Have noticed a weird moldy/cleaner aftertaste on every beer I’ve had there every time I’ve gone. Have mentioned this to staff as well. Would be 5/5 if not for the aftertaste. Hope they fix soon and I can change rating.

It's upbeat bar at downtown location which gets dead after 9. So it's a good place if you have to spend time with bunch of colleagues. Service though might get cumbersome as the attenders sometimes hurry up as their shift ends. But overall of you don't care any of that and just be happy with drinks and friends that's the place which comes handy.

The lunch combo was on point. A cheese steak, fries (Italian) and beer for $15 bucks. I left Shorty's full and satisfied with my meal. The bar itself is a bit divey, but for Lunch, I wasn't looking for amazing ambiance. Shorty's delivered on exactly what I wanted.

Really good cheesesteaks and fries at an affordable price. I've been down to Philly a number of times and the prices here and down there are pretty much the same. The quality is very delicious, the meat is very well seasoned and you get a good amount of meat to bun. This isn't my first time at Shorty's and they will continue getting my business.

name: Burger King
address: 16 Beaver St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews:
It's good for a quick bite. The restaurant is downtown and there is a school near by, so around 12 you can't find an empty seat. I just buy and go back to my office to eat. Sometimes I get a seat when school is closed or if I eat early.
Service is good, staff is courteous, location is clean. Actually it was recently renovated after a fire that forced it to close for months.

It's not bad when it's not busy. The service is good and they have seating. It can just get very packed with everyone waiting for their food. There's not much condiments out so you'll have to ask for it behind the counter.
The menu and service were above my expectations. I really liked the atmosphere of this spot. Superb spot to take the family out for dinner.

This Burger King is great for everyone, tourists and city dwellers alike. Quick, fast and friendly staff makes it easier to get a quick tasty bite among the crowded restaurant scene downtown. Best of all, excellent prices like double cheeseburgers for 2 dollars etc. I would highly recommend this Burger King to everyone rich or poor.

I placed my order from the kiosk which limited my options for adding toppings (tacos) and selecting the fountain drink with my order. When my name was called, I asked to add a tomato to the taco and switch the coke that was provided to a lemonade. I wish I was able to name drop the person who helped me at the counter! He said "Have it your way!" and happily made the changes even with a lobby full of customers. It brightened my day, soothed my hangover.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
address: 90 Broad St G103, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Potbelly's food is always great and can't be beat. I was there a little bit before the lunch rush and I got my food prepared fairly quickly. Had to wait about 5 minutes before I could flag down a cashier to check me out despite there being an abundance of workers behind the work station.
Always one of the best in my list. Always service is good and crispy delicious sandwiches. Their chilly soup and chocolate malt are my all time favorites.  Love this place

Came here for lunch. An average experience overall. Tried the chicken tomato mozz because Potbelly was marketing it everywhere.....disappointed...very bland, no flavor and dry...vinegar added some flavor but not enough..maybe try add some type of sauce to this samdwich... also no fountain drinks..only bottled drinks... average experience
Nice place to quickly get nice custom sandwich

Nice fast food sandwich place, the servers were very pleasant and attentive as well as fast. I had a very tasty turkey on a multi grain small hero roll I also had lettuce, tomato, onions and mustard on it. I chose to eat it outside but there are an ample number of chairs and tables as well as high tables and chairs & also window counter seating.

name: NAYA
address: 1 New York Plaza, 1 FDR Dr, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews:
Nice Mediterranean counter-service place in  the basement of 1 NY Plaza. Delicious food,  and very economic. The bowl pictured was $12. You customize your own pita, bowl or salad, choosing between 5 different bases and 4 proteins and 2 vegetarian options. You then add as many as you want from almost 20 toppings, and like 5 dressings or sauces.
The food is surprisingly tasty and fresh. After 4 PM the place is empty. 
One star less because the seatings are a little uncomfortable for me. 
Worth visiting on repeat.
Delicious, filling meal filled with flavor. First time visitor and definitely a returning customer.

My favorite place to go quick Mediterranean eats! It's similar to Chipotle in the sense that you can choose what you want, but you can choose all of the toppings at no extra cost. The line usually extends out the door, but don't worry! It goes by relatively quickly.

Definitely get as many toppings as you can! They really make the meal worth it. I don't ask for olives or any of the spicy sauces on my bowl, but you can ask for the sauces on the side when you pay. Always say yes to the pita because why not? The bowls I order are around $11 and I would consider it a good price because they give you a lot of food. I typically eat my meal from Naya for lunch and dinner. Overall, highly recommend!
The best Mediterranean food in the City! Fast food at its finest. Definitely the definition of NY. And they have the best Baklava.
Super yummy, super nice staff. Great portions. We all loved it. Falafel 👍🏻

name: Cappone’s Salumeria
address: 1 New York Plaza, FDR Dr, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: I was very disappointed with my order. I got a chicken with mozzarella and balsamic sandwich. The bread was dry, the chicken was dry, the mozzarella was sub par and it was drenched with to much balsamic. Overall for the price of those sandwiches it's a huge rip off. The staff was not rude, rather indiffent and the store was not as organized as some of the other places in the area. I do not recommend.

Yes, it’s a little pricey but what do you expect in downtown NYC. The sandwiches are fresh and delicious! Thin sliced meats, tasty cheeses, high quality olive oil. Just a great sandwich that needs to be tried. Stop here at least once a month.

Hands down, the best Italian cold cut sandwiches in New York from the selection of breads to the fresh mozzarella to the delicious prosciutto, soppressata and capicola (gabagool to you real Italians).
This is my favorite lunch in all of Manhattan.
I love this place

The sandwiches are great, and so is the staff. The gentleman at the register was quick but friendly - it's like things happened quickly, but I didn't feel rushed.

Look for long lines during weekday lunch hours, but the fast and effective service makes things go pretty quickly.  Despite the long list of sandwiches (there seems to be something for everyone, including vegetarian or vegan options) the staff makes the sandwiches very efficiently. The drink selection is pretty good, with Hal's seltzer, Snapple, and other choices.  

Unfortunately, last time I took a sandwich to go they gave me the wrong sandwich - they put the wrong sandwich in the bag with my name on it which also had the correct sandwich name written on it). Despite this, I'll probably be back to get the Caponne (what I ordered last time, but did not get to try).

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
address: 1 New York Plaza, FDR Dr, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: The place is first-rate and broad, the meals was delicious and the prices were very economical. quickly, effective service and very friendly staff members. I recommend this place.
The place offers a fantastic variety of fresh food. I loved eating here. Employees are always super friendly, prices are fair and the place is always well organised.

I go with my wife to this restaurant many times a year! This is the best place to eat.  I visit this spot routinely. The meals are very good, the team is helpful and the prices are good. I enjoy going in this spot over a good dinner.
Amazing service!.  We had a large order for our office and hey took amazing care of us.  we got our order fresh on time and with zero hassle.
Very good experience, tasted great.

name: Antica
address: 8 Stone St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Excellent Italian food in the financial district.  Has a small bar and sit down dining.  The interior and ambiance is cozy.  Quick service and great food.  They even have some complimentary grappa for you to try.  Recommend.
I attended a work event here a few weeks ago. I was amazed by the elegant private room. Authentic, gourmet Italian food. I absolutely enjoyed my time here and will return soon.

We stayed in the Doubletree Hotel and so used the restaurant for our breakfast each morning and then also for 2 evening meals. Our experience was very mixed. The breakfast buffet was quite good and the food on an evening was very good. The service however varied depending on which staff were in and how busy it was. We booked a table for new years eve but when we went in we were made to feel very unwelcome and we were rushed out. That put us off completely and chose to eat at a restaurant down the street the following evening. Some staff hadn't got a clue what they were doing and so service was even comical at times.
Food is of course great. Their service is amazing excellent.
We hit a 'home run' eating lunch here.  Outstanding food.  Superlative and attentive service.

name: Yip's
address: 16 Beaver St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: I come to this special restaurant from time to time  as I like the ambiance that is outline this place. The personel is exceptionally cordial and professional. The service is extraordinarily fast. Also, the food they serve is perfect. I frequent more than once and I was always happy. The payment is decent. I highly suggest this place to to everybody.
Garlic shrimp over broccoli I highly recommend this dish.
Yips is a very affordable and tasty chinese fast food restaurant...serving both buffet and other dishes...it's been around for a very long time.
Great food hot or cold. Fresh food.  Clean place. My favorite is the baked mac and cheese. Strongly suggest

This is probably one of the least expensive "food by the pound" buffets you can visit in FiDi.  I'm basing this review solely on the basement buffet, I've never visited the upstairs restaurant.
The space is usually very clean and there are at least 3 cashiers available during the lunch rush hour to hurry you out of the place.  The food is typical chinese restaurant cuisine, but they also have a vast selection of steamed veggies and salad dishes for those who want to eat light.  There are food attendants on the floor most of the time so the food gets replenished on the regular.  They have seating upstairs so you can get your food, get on the elevator and eat in their upstairs dining area.

I suggest you look around the entire buffet before you begin filling up your container.  It'll help you make better decisions and spend less.  Highly recommend.

name: The GoGo Grill
address: 10-30 Canyon of Heroes, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: This food truck always has a line - for good reasons. Have tried their burger and kale salad - both were fantastic. Can't wait to try more items on their menu. Price is reasonable and service is always friendly. Go - you won't regret it.
Went during lunch time, around 1.30 pm. Ordered the veggie delight. The bread (english muffin) was hard and stale.
In a sea of processed food lunch spots, the Fidi welcomes this cart. They serve fresh, home cooked, healthy and tasty food. Not expensive either!!

Although small, this food truck makes a mean burger! The battery burger comes with a beef patty with either Swiss or cheddar cheese, lettuce, onions, pickles, and an aioli sauce on a homemade English muffin. I get it without the pickles and its delicious! I've also had the pulled pork sandwich (also served on their delicious English muffins) and have tried their falafel and both are great too! Even though there aren't a lot of people manning the truck the service is usually pretty quick. If you're near Bowling Green during the week this underrated food truck is definitely worth a stop. Make sure you have cash!
Try this amazing chicken salad

name: Panini Grill
address: 4 South St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Just be glad that there is coffee on your commute.

name: Fraunces Tavern
address: 54 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: The wait in line is what it is. BUT... def worth the wait. Food was amazing and the atmosphere was incredible. If it's your first time, I strongly recommend eating at the bar top.  The staff was very friendly and made sure that everyone had a great time. It made my first experience memorable. One note for first timers. What ever "spicy" level you think you like/can handle, try one level down and work your way up.  I can't wait to go a back.

The oldest bar in New York City is Fraunces Tavern. Located at 54 Pearl Street in New York City, this place is both a bar/restaurant and a museum, both honoring the tradition of taverns in New York City.

Fraunces Tavern played a prominent role in history before, during and after the American Revolution, serving as a headquarters for George Washington, a venue for peace negotiations with the British, and housing federal offices in the Early Republic.

Before the American Revolution, the building was one of the meeting places of the secret society, the Sons of Liberty.

This place is not to be missed. It can get packed but the tavern is a really great place to hang with friends for any occasion. And as previously mentioned, it’s one of the oldest bars in America!

A fine example of the rich history of New York City. This is where George Washington hung out and ultimately said farewell to his troops at the end of the American Revolution. Fascinating collection. Seems small at first glance but actually there is so much you could spend several hours here. An historical master class. Lovely, helpful staff. Highly recommended

Went for mid-afternoon drinks and some bar food, not really a meal as we were hopping around the many bars and pubs located in this part of town. We had a wonderful experience listening to some jazz and enjoying a charcuterie board and trying some craft beer. If you like beer and ones you've never heard of this is the place to try it. There are several rooms here to dine in but we were in the more "pub" style but we did walk through the other dining areas which are beautiful. Read up on the history, it's definitely worth it to make the experience that much better!

I go with my wife to this great restaurant often! This is the best place to pass a nice evening.  I visit this place many times. The cooking is fantastic, the workers are welcoming and the rates are fair. I like meeting in this spot for a nice supper.

name: Cafe 11
address: Lobby, 11 Broadway, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: WOW! To have everything in one place isn't easy!! I am a regular customer and the food is out of this world, Customer service is amazing, orders are always right! Lets not forget, at a very reasonable price!! Keep it Up #cafe11

This place is great. Kosher or not, you'll love it. Fast service, nice people, reasonable prices. You'll be out of there with your food before you know it. It is a little hidden in a building, but it's worth the mini adventure.
One of my main spots to grab something to eat. excellent location, well organised, and very good customer service. A must try!
The food is regularly well prepared and delightful, workers gives fantastic customer service. I loved how neat it is and ambience. Highly recommended.
Exceptional spot to get food when in a hurry. The service is prompt, rates are convenient, excellent ambience. I highly recommend this place

name: Subway
address: 28 Water St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Restroom are terrible

Great staff - one young man went out of his way to help us get a table set up and to accommodate our kids.  Didn't have to, but went out of his way - that and also to make a pizza out of flatbread that wasn't really on the menu.  You don't find people like this at subway restaurants, typically.  Really appreciated the attention and would always go back if in the area again.
Great place to eat good price for the value.
Very impressive and friendly staff. Handle busy and non-busy times with ease.
Good place to grab quick meal...

name: Dig
address: 80 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: The staffs are nice and food is delicious 😋. Bought 2 bowls with my friend and we will come back again!
The food is so fresh and delicious. Too bad it's so expensive. I'd eat here more often if it wasnt so expensive
Not the prettiest picture but it all tasted really good and healthy. Good for the price.
Absolutely love their food. When you go in and order they typically give you bigger portions. Service is provided with a smile!
Deliciously fresh food and very flavorful with very decent portion sizes. A lunch favorite amongst the office. Great for catering too.

name: Rockwell's
address: 105 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: I missed the bagel breakfast and the yummy quesadillas / philly cheese steak with jalapeños. Also the friendly smiles from all of you at all time. Pls stay safe, and take care. Emily

The food was goooooooood and the prices were reasonable. I fed three children and myself, with food to spare for less than $30 beans. They have a pretty cool dining area upstairs so we got to stay in after all.

The food here is amazing. I had the bacon, egg, and cheese on a sesame bagel. The prices are really great. I wouldn't recommend the coffee though. It was weak but I also acknowledge that I'm picky with coffee. They also had fresh fruit which is pretty great.

Found this place on Google map.  Both my husband and I had a fresh made sandwich 
 Both Sandwich's were amazing  and good value.  Would  I come back again sure would 
Would I recommend  yes it's not much to look at but the food is lovely

Stopped by while exploring lower Manhattan. Conveniently located just a stone's throw from Battery Park and Whitehall Ferry Terminal but also Wall St etc. The Gyros we had were delicious and reasonably priced but customer service could be better. It was, at least in my opinion, pretty blunt and not really helpful. Kind of typical for a cheaper end Manhattan food joint.

name: The Beer Garden
reviews: Is just a nice place
Good beer for affordable price.
Nice relaxed place for a drink or two on the evening, secluded and quite.

A very disappointing experience with the woman that served us at the beer garden - she was more interested in flirting with the man at the side bar than  getting our order correct -  we said no cheese on our hamburgers and she put cheese on one, we wanted raw  onions and she put grilled onions on our hamburgers and the bread was stale - she didn’t tell us our order was ready it was minus 10 experience-  note to self, lettuce many people know that I can in New York not to visit there  This place.

The woman with the reddish hair is mad rude she threw the change to my boyfriend and was barely responsive to our orders. It’s a good place to be outside but for customer service the old woman was mad rude smh do not recommend

name: Los tacos City Habanero
address: 63-43 Whitehall St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Delicious tacos for a good price.

Tacos were bigger than I expected with double tortilla, but they were good!  The red sauce had a good kick and the meat (I had steak and carnitas) was well seasoned and was cooked just right.  A little on the pricey side (for a taco truck) but worth it.  They even let you call and order ahead!

Bravo!! Best taco truck I've ever had. Their flavors are so rich and authentic. Wish they catered. You guys should definitely cater. Burrito Bowl was amazing. Can't wait to bring some friends to try. Chipotle and Q'doba do not and cannot compare. Fact
Cheap eats, great tacos!
Had a chicken taco. 5/5 would taco again.

name: Dunkin'
address: 4 Whitehall St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Staff could have been friendlier. Most seemed bored with their job. But I LOVE the new Red/Pink Velvet Signature Latte!

I ordered a bagel with cream cheese toasted and a medium coffee light and sweet. I opened my coffee it was dark so I asked for more cream. When I took my first bite, it was not toasted. Not a big deal. So I eventually go back. When I tell the server he's first response is "oh you took too long to eat it" what, how rude! They make me a new bagel. I see that the guy puts cream cheese on it but he doesn't spread evenly and it's only on half the bagel. I confront him he pretends to not understand and asks me if I want butter? I reply with just give me a knife I'll do it myself! Dunkin Donuts has a bad rep I dont know why I thought this one would be any different! When I finally look at the bagel its burnt. No surprise their. Rude service and because I asked him for a new bagel they burnt it. 👊🏽...👎🏽
On several occasions, they stopped in the middle of my order to take a white person’s order. No apologies or anything. They just start ignoring me until they’re finished. One star is too much.

Went in expecting to have a good customer service but it turned out to be very BAD... I ordered an ice latte coffee but they got it wrong twice. The lady in the register was really mean and arrogant. Never coming back again 🙄

Wonderful place, my favorite in all DD's. Very fast and kind service.Workers know your order. Professional and clean. Manager is very good especially the morning shift. Show a little respect and will get it back double from them.
A little kindness goes a long way . I love this place !

name: Rita's Italian Ice & Frozen Custard
address: 4 South Street LL, Space 206, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: I was just about to order when I watched the worker sneeze a juicy sneeze into her hand.... 😬
super leckere produkte
La glace italienne est bonne et très rafraîchissante, par contre je ne comprend pas le prix. 12$ pour deux... 16$ CAD.

name: Auntie Anne's
address: 4 South St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews:
Soooo yummy! These soft pretzels are so good. The shop is small but you can see them making the pretzels and baking them by hand. You get them warm and fresh. The prices are okay, not very cheap, but worth the quality.
Also, it's great to eat them while sitting in the Staten Island Ferry!

Tried for first time today! Very popular and trendy! Tasty and delicious! Good sauces, drinks & shakes!  No wonder there is always a line!  Back again Saturday ! Tried  the plain and pepperoni! Yummy for your tummy!
The pretzel wasn't unpleasant nor was it pleasant. I have to wonder how long it's been under the heat lamps.
Efficient staff good food
I just love these pretzels. OMG. They just need to have more things in stock at all times. Other than that, yummy!!!!

name: Subway
address: Terminal, 4 South St, Manhattan, NY 10004, USA

name: Sabi Sushi
address: 1 New York Plaza, 1 FDR Dr, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews:
Ordered chicken rice bowl. 
Just awful. 
The only decent item is the rice. 
Everything else tastes off, old, or odd.

Sabi Sushi at The Plaza Food Hall

Today I ordered the Caesar salad with grilled tuna for $14.50.  The salad was presented very simply with lettuce, 3 cherry tomatos, and sliced seared tuna.  The dressing is given on the side.  The dressing is strongly flavored with wasabi.  It will clear out your breathing passages! Overall a fine salad but as always with The Plaza, strongly 💪 overpriced.

I actually fairly enjoyed my sushi (Rock n Roll) and thought it was pretty good for take-out sushi. Maybe their sushi is just better. Very quick service and super casual. Will be on my list of places to get take-out sushi in the future
Great chicken terriyaki!
Ramen is decent in a fix, bahn mi is quite good if not authentic. Sushi is passable. A little too much all things for all people, but serviceable for a quick lunch.

name: Playa Bowls
address: 1 New York Plaza, 1 FDR Dr, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Staff were friendly but this is by no means a good substitute for lunch or dinner. The food is basically a massive desert. The natural sugar content is through the roof for the portion size and to be honest this would be great in a small cup for desert. Suggest sharing a bowl unless you want stomach cramps.
Quick service. Clean spot.

name: Gnoccheria - Wall St.
address: 100 Broad Street, 2nd Fl Entrance on Bridge Street b/t Broad St and, Whitehall St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Great service and tasty food. I can't wait for the rooftop to be ready ‼️

Great place for gnocchi. The pasta was decent, no wow factor. Service was great, waiter was attentive and and friendly. It was relatively empty when I went for lunch. Entrance was difficult to find as it is on the side of a building. I have tried to correct it on Google maps so it would not be a problem for future users
Great Gnocchi and tiramisu! The staff was friendly and attentive. Complimentary bread comes with the meals. The gnocchi for two is portioned to feed three. Tucked away but a great find.
A very ample and inviting space with a sleek rooftop. Their forte is Gnocchi we tried the pesto and were fabulous, the wines eclectic and delicious, must come back to try the cocktail😛.
Amazing staff and delicious food, very excited to have this in the neighborhood, delicious aperitivo (i.e. happy hour + snacks!)

name: Essen Fast Slow Food
address: 100 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Huge selection of items and the food here is mediocre to quite good.  The prices are also fair for the area.  It was an easy choice to go here with a group who wanted a bunch of different things or if you were not sure exactly what you wanted.  The reason I'm off this place for good is the staff.  The servers/preparers behind the counters are some of the nastiest folks you will ever meet!  If you go here, prepare to be ignored and talked down to.  Not only with this place NOT even try to make the customer happy, I'm convinced they have some twisted pool to see how many folks they can turn off to the join in a single day.  There are a ton of other food options in the area with staff who legitimately try to make the customer happy.  I'm mot tough to please and don't generally leave bad reviews and certainly don't base a bad review on a single experience.  The staff here needs to pursue careers as weather station monitors in Nome Alaska.  It suits their people skills better

Another win for the food for all app! I consider myself very lucky to be able to pick up a delicious, nutritious ample bowl of spicy pork, cabbage and rice for a fraction of the cost via the food for all app. The portions are really generous and the spicy is indeed spicy. I am here at off hours of 8 PM, even though this place is conveniently open 24 hours. It’s like I have the place to myself and the s
bowl is just one of the selections available at a discounted price. Thank you so much for joining the app, and for being part of not just the slow food movement but the stop-food-waste movement.
It is a nice space.  Very busy at lunch - it has the feeling of being stuck with cattle or being one of 10,000 chickens at a processing plant. Take your slop and eat it.  Incredibly overpriced.

Great chicken,cold drinks... the prices are high but I mean INFLATION right!!!!! So if your skeptical about trying chicken at a gas station don't be..... I'm a millionaire and this chicken is clean and good. Love it love it love it love it

Solid breakfast spot for a quick eat on the way to work. Good selection of hot bar items, especially for people with non-diary food preferences. Fruit seemed fresh. Good beverage selection. Service was friendly and fast. There’s a small eating area to watch the FiDi morning commuters bustle.

name: DJ's Breakfast Spot
address: 2-20 Stone St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews:
He makes the perfect breakfast. He is fun to talk too. He makes everything fresh and with a smile. Every morning I go there, I get my order in the way I wanted it and leave smiling. And his price is also affordable.

Keep up the great job brother.

This place is a hidden gem of the Financial District and is, in my opinion, the best breakfast cart in the area! 
With BaconEggandCheese's (yes one word) only costing $3, there's nowhere else that will give you such bang for your buck. The sandwiches are great and he doesn't skimp on egg or bacon. 

Also, it is open weekdays until 11 (11:30 if there's still business coming through)

Highly recommend this place which is why I wanted to post it up here on Google Maps!

DJ makes his food fresh and ready to order. His prices are unbeatable and the service always comes with a smile. His sandwiches are delicious and his coffee is exceptional.  He has the lowest prices in town and you are guaranteed to get your money’s worth. As long as he is there, I will be also.

DJ is a legend and serves fantastic breakfast food at really reasonable prices. Sausage, egg and cheese on a roll is an absolute treat! DJ is always really pleasant and is a genuinely nice guy. Can't recommend enough - a hidden gem and one of my highlights of New York since living here for almost 7 months.

I retired from my job in July and gotta tell you, I really miss this guy.  His was usually the first smile I saw everyday!  So kind and genuine.  One User called him a hidden gem in the Financial District.  This guy is light.  Shining so brightly that it can’t be hidden.  Give him a try for serious good food and human warmth!  Love & miss you babe.  I’ll get down there from a Westchester to see you.  -Bobby

name: Suno Sushi
address: 17 Battery Pl, New York, NY 10004, USA

name: Ramen Ramen
reviews: The place serves large dishes and for convenient rates. nice staff members. Will visit again.
Beautiful American Indian Museum that is free to the public, if there was more to see I would have given it more stars.

I celebrated my PhD yesterday in this excellent restaurant. I am glad to say that we enjoyed a astonishing evening and the restaurant was absolutely one of the reasons for this successful evening. The stuff  contributed in a gorgeous style, the cuisine was very good and my buddies were very  overjoyed. We shall absolutely return for more events. thanks very much.

My friend ordered popcorn chicken with French fries and the chicken came out dry, crusty, and smells horrible, it doesn’t look anything like the picture. Was very disappointing, and when we asked for a refund or replacement they said no in a very rude matter and walked away from us. Horrible service, and I was expecting more.
Fried cuttlefish ball is so delicious and easy to go.

name: Urban Lobster Shack - Downtown
address: 15 Stone St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Tried them at the Astoria street fair. Lobster roll was very good and the bun was delicious. BUT it was so small I finished it in 3 average sized bites. Offer a jumbo option or something. That was literally an appetizer sized portion.

name: Toro Loco
address: 15 Stone St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: This is a new, cozy and quaint restaurant. It's packed at lunch. Go after 1:30 pm, if you want to avoid the crowds. There's also an upstairs if you don't mind climbing the stairs. I heard that on the weekend, the ground floor is turned into a dance floor. So, go grab a bite. Have fun with friends, co-workers or family.

Nice atmosphere, friendly staff. They had a second floor which is where we sat and a bar upstairs as well. You can even sit by the windows but I did want a chair with back support. Bar tender was very courteous and helpful with questions.
Food was amazing! Definitely loved my tacos and enjoyed my drink as well!
Fun place & the DJ was awesome. Nice decor & atmosphere. Food and service were good.  Decent prices for NYC.

I've been going here for a few years now and I can't find a single thing to dislike. They always have delicious food, a good atmosphere, great drinks and most importantly for NYC, great prices. Great for food & drinks at any time!

PS: Get the guacamole that s**t HITS

Great restaurant. The staff are very attentive and friendly.  Great environment. The food is very good. I have tried their guacamole and the burrito, It was delicious. Highly recommend the house margarita. Omar makes amazing drinks. You can't go wrong with anything he recommends.

name: Latte Art
address: 15 Stone St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: The coffee was great. We missed this when we were in the area at the beginning of our trip. I was a little disappointed that we traveled down from Central Park before leaving to get a latte art but was told there is no art. On the plus side, the latte was awesome, even without art.
Yummy coffee here! I love that it’s a hole in the wall and the coffee is great quality. Please come support this business!

Cute little coffee shop. Stopped in the morning and grabbed an egg, cheese and ham empanada. Delicious! Soy latte was wonderful as well and not overpowering. I’m one that likes coffee with my cream and this was good!
Tiniest coffee shop there is. No seating, great menu and good coffee.
To go coffee and some food. The coffee is great!!

name: cafe plaza deli
reviews: This fabulous (and convenient) eatery is CLOSING FOR GOOD on Friday February 7, 2020. Another victim of rising rents and the replacement of restaurants / stores with residences! Sad but true in the Lower Manhattan area. For sure, it’s getting harder (and costlier) to find a decent breakfast and lunch establishment in the area. It surely isn’t like it once was.
I've been going to this deli for quite awhile now the workers are friendly, and they have great food, I love there korean foods!! but NOW they have BURRITO BOWLS!! and it taste so good!!
Always a great place for sandwiches and fresh hot and cold salid bar.  Reasonable prices and i am always able to find a seat during lunch time.
They got this really good Korean food.

Walking by on my way to work, I was pleasantly surprised to find this hole in the wall. For an off brand latte...their vanilla latte was delish! Toasted everything bagel with egg and cheese also very good.

name: Continental Express Halal Food
address: 2-12 Beaver St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Best and cleanest halal chicken and lamb around. Very nice guys run the show. Eat there 3x a week.

Love this cart - the price is right and the guys are really friendly.  I get the falafel platter here 2-3 times a week.  Pro-tip, if you go before noon, they'll still be baking the falafel, so it'll be fairly hard.  If you go after 12:30-1, the falafel has been soaking in the chickpea sauce stuff for a while and it's buttery soft.  Makes a huge difference.
Good food, nice people. One of my favorite places to grab a quick lunch
This restaurant costs less than other halal carts and thats why I like it. They use metal tins though which contain less food so stick to the wraps for 4 dollars.
Best cart in the city, best service and food with the lowest prices

name: Broadstone Bar & Kitchen
address: 88 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews:
We came here around 1PM on a Sunday with reservations for 7. We walked in, and were seated immediately in the upstairs eating area because there weren't that many customers at the time. 

The menu had both breakfast and lunch things since it was still brunch. The drinks were a little on the pricey side so we decided to stay away from those for a while. 

Since most of us were already so hungry and it was PM, we decided for a burger. We ordered a range from medium rare to well done. However, all of the burgers came to the table (6 in total) as a solid medium-well. However, the egg in mine and the avocado were able to moisten it up a bit. The fries were good as well. The only other dish that was ordered was some french toast which was WAY too sweet. 

Cute place, Food was Ok, Won't be back.

Great spot in the Battery Park / Financial District area to stop off, with drinks and plates to suit pretty much any appetite, palette, or budget. 

Plates ranging from the sub $15 range and up to around $25, with options for brunch, lunch, and of course, dinner. 

Nice location, setting, and friendly staff. A good calling point for local and tourist alike.

No they do not have an ocean view. The service is amazing over the top. Each employee greeted us and shook our hand like we are movie stars. We ordered the surf n turf with fillet Mignon  and shrimp. Small portions for sure and the food is just ok. Our drinks we had are very tasty coming from Seattle it's hard to compare fresh seafood to land lock areas the fillet was tiny but tasty

Had the garlic fries and a few rounds of Glen-12. I am happy with the price of the drinks. Though the fries were a bit steep, they sure were tasty.

The staff seemed happy about being there and eager to help.

Atmosphere was nice! Big, beautiful windows and phone chargers under the bar.

Friends and I had dinner here tonight. We had an issue with our food. Our server, Dana, was super accommodating and took care of our issue very quickly. The manager Ken ensured we were taken care of at the end. Thanks Dana & Ken!!

name: Indian Biryani House
reviews: Great food. These guys have reasonable prices and are quick/great with their packaging. My wide & I come here for our Indian cuisine fix!
Love this halal cart! The owners are always so friendly and the food is truly delicious. Plus, they have great sauces!

name: pokebab
address: 80 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: This is a great, fast option to-go and counter seating. Generous portion. Flavorful and not too saucy. You can build your own bowl or choose from one of their signature bowls. I recommend the onion crisps topping!

Fresh products, friendly staff, not overpriced. One of the best poke bowl I ever tried around the area. You might find a line between 12:30 pm - 1:30 pm Monday - Friday. I will suggest the Sushi burrito.

I just discovered Pokelab and it is fantastic. I got the ahi tuna poke bowl and it was the best lunch I had in a very long time. The have a large size which I prefer, it's flavors and ingredients are top notch. The service and staff are great and the store is very clean. I highly appreciate.

This is not your typical fast food: they take their time to put together a solid meal catered to your wants. The quality is consistently high - and the folks working there are genuinely positive. This contributes to a great overall experience.
Here eating the classic poké bowl which is so so super fresh, stellar!

name: Yip’s Gourmet Noodle Soup
address: 18 Beaver St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Upstairs is quick food. Large portions good prices and good taste. Family style seating. Order at counter and pay there. There is a larger buffet downstairs.

It’s very reasonably priced and located in a convenient place on the Beaver St and near the Charging Bull on the Broadway. A authentic Cantonese noodle soup restaurant. It has early & late lunch specials (10:30 AM~12:00 PM, 3:00 PM~5:00 PM Purchase Any Order or Noodle Soup $6.24)
I love this restaurant. The food is price reasonable and taste good. The service by the staff is awesome. My favorite food there is black pepper chicken on tue/ Thurs.
Love the food, especially curry chicken Thursday and the price is affordable.
Good food; good options; good prices

name: Limo Dispact Co
address: 62 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA

name: Rosen's Cafe LLC
reviews: Horrible! Second time I go in and for the second time they screw up my order. What pisses me off is that they are talking in spanish and I ask for my order in spanish and they still couldn't get it right twice. If I ask for exactly what someone else just received why in the hell would I receive anything different and if I ask for just a sandwich why would they take it upon themselves to add fries to my order, it's not like the fries are free. Won't be back!
Food is good, coffee not my first choice.

Rosen's at 2 Broadway is convenient for the people that work there, but not any more affordable than the other restaurants in the area.

From now on, I'll take feeling like a valued customer over convenience and continue to walk the extra block to Flavors from now on. Their prices are about the same or less and the quality of food and service is way better there, especially since they have more menu items and more toppings for your omelette. 

Today I went to Rosen's out of convenience and when I asked about my order I was addressed with "what?!" and a snark response which was not called for at all. This is the second time this has happened to me. They're too busy for good customer service or quality food. 

At Rosen's, everything is prepared on one grill which leaves my food tasting like every other food that has been or is being prepared. I had french toast today that tasted like bacon and sausage grease. The chefs don't change their gloves or clean the grill in between orders. If this bothers you as much as it bothers me, then express your dietary needs to staff at Flavors and they'll oblige. Flavors isn't as convenient as Rosen's, so its less busy, but that just means they're more likely to treat you with respect. The staff there also remembers just about everyone's order just by seeing their face which is an added touch.  

Hope this helps, 
Nathalie
Prices are aleast $2 more than if you go to another restaurant in the area
Entry is from 76 broad Street

name: Cafe Grumpy - Financial District
address: 20 Stone St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Sweet little coffee shop with great coffee and tasty pastries. The lattes were beautifully made with excellent coffee. I had the salted caramel doughnut which was delicious.

I miss Grumpy so much. They are so nice (funnily enough), they are helpful if you don't know what you want, and their quality is top notch. The matcha is made hand whisked on site. Their ingredients are fresh and everything comes out baller. However they are pricey because of this, and it is a bit of a wait. Worth it.
Coffee and service are pretty good, atmosphere is also nice. Coffee is more expensive than you would find at Starbucks and I didn’t see anything that looked unique for their shop specifically.
Best oat milk matcha latte + incredible turmeric almond milk latte. Delicious scones, too! Really good service and cute spot.
Must try the turmeric latte! Awesome place for coffee and quick bite.

name: Atlantic USA Inc
address: 17 State St # 2300, New York, NY 10004, USA

name: Waves cafe
reviews: nice place
Horrible service and way to expensive
Great!

name: Mili Kàpi
address: 1 Bowling Green, New York, NY 10004, USA

name: Wafels and Dinges
reviews: Omg. The best waffles I've ever had specially while driving.  Thank you so much.

name: Liberty Tunnel Cafe
address: 2 Washington St, New York, NY 10004, USA

name: Financial District Art Walk
address: 17 State St, New York, NY 10004, USA

name: Anglers' Club of New York
address: 101 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA

name: Bowling Green
address: Broadway &, Whitehall St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: I work a couple of blocks away! There’s always people around and the busyness I’d the #4 train makes it even better! Great place to guests from overseas since right there you have the Fighting Bull and close to historic landmarks and the Battery Park!

It’s a busy place with manny people moving around and it’s better to walk instead of using car. 
Manny people believe touching it is tradition and brings luck to them.
The tourists came to visit New York will definitely come here. 
To see and take a snap with Bull.

What a wonderful park that was.
There was a lot to see, and I didn’t get to see everything due to limited time.
I hope to travel there again and explore more.

There's so many dights to see. The Bull, The   American Indian Museum, The Ferry, Circle Line to see Statue of Liberty. There's a French Christmas Market going on right now from 12/6 till 12/22. Most of all I love Battery Park. It's a beautiful and quiet place to enjoy.

Not a good time to visit in the winter time. A bit too cold. This is New Yorks first park. Not central Park. Central Park is man made. A few steps from here you have various Museums and touristy places. 
As always ENJOY NEW YORK!

name: The Battery Urban Farm
address: State St &, Battery Pl, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Cool place. Just come and enjoy your sitting under the trees.))) And beautiful plants farm.

Quaint mid city farm in an unsuspecting place beginning stage in July it seems walk 2 fast or if a crowd of tourists whisk by u will surely miss & not even b the wiser lol but its refreshing 2 see this type of greenery in the city right here we need more of these type of things honestly & the food should b free 2 any1 that is hungry at anytime within reason..
Excellent eden in Manhattan and perfect educational farm for city youth

The Battery Urban Farm is an educational farm where students, residents, and visitors experience sustainable farming, enjoy tasting organic fresh foods, and learn environmental stewardship. The farm was developed in 2011 by The Battery Conservancy and now engages over 5000 students from over 100 schools and community volunteers who annually grow thousands of pounds of vegetables, fruits, herbs, grains, and flowers.
Great to see an urban farm so close to Wall Street and financial district.

name: Battery Garden
address: 10 Battery Pl, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Perfect place
it's garden

name: IPsoft Plaza
address: 17 State St, New York, NY 10004, USA

name: Beckett's Bar & Grill
address: 81 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: My husband and I went to NYC for a short vacay, Went to the bar on 12/30 and met the bartender James. This dude is awesome! The best bartender we ever met! He treated us like family. We had so much fun we came back the next night for the New Year's eve party. James remembered us by name!! Introduced us to all of his friends and made my husband and I feel welcomed! James and Jessica made sure we were good all night. Their fantastic customer service is 1 of the reasons why we'll come back to NYC! A chill and nice spot!

We came after 11pm and still were able to order real food! We had one burger and it was super delicious, however, fish and chips  wasn't good. I mean fries is perfect,  but fish is flavorless and not crunchy at all. 

There is great choise of beer and barman was able to recomend some local IPA, so we end up loving the beer and the place! 

Will definitely come back here!!!

Good pub food, attentive service and an extensive selection of drinks. Lots of screens all over the place which I find  distracting when you are having a conversation with other people but I realize that sports fans like this. The venue was able to accommodate a group of 11 people which is a plus.

Great place to watch a soccer game. Skip the downstairs tables and go upstairs. Prices are reasonable and service is super friendly. 
They have plenty of TVs all around. 
There is also an outside area where you can sit if you want to get away from the game atmosphere.

Overall, experience was eh. Service was bad, given the place was completely empty, waiting around for a glass of water just doesn’t make sense. Busser had to go find the waitress who was on her phone to tell her to get us a glass of water and take our order. Food was was fine. Waited 10 mins for them to change the channel to the game (again, the place was empty). Beer and wine are not priced on the menu. When we asked the waitress, she didn’t know the price either. 

If you’re looking for a mediocre sports pub, this is it. If you’re looking for an average serviced lunch or dinner, I do not recommend.

name: Delmonico's
address: 56 Beaver St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews:
A New York classic and must visit. Very well preserved as it was years ago. Staff are very attentive and polite. Restaurant is stunning.

Food is expensive but hands down best I have has for a while. Make sure to get the historic Alaska Pie dessert. Hard to articulate how awesome it is. ☺️☺️
Probably the best steak I’ve had in a long time. Pasta was awesome. Excellent wine pairing, and great service. Definitely worth the visit.

Great food and wine menu in a restaurant with a long history. It is a good spot for business dinners or an intimate night out. I'd recommend making reservations ahead of time. I don't recommend any sauces or butters for your steak. They are delicious as is.
Great service and absolutely amazing food. The cocktails are so well made and they have a great selection of drinks to choose from. Overall, just an fantastic eating experience.

This place was awesome! Starting with the main entrance, it looks simply amazing. The decor inside the restaurant is beautiful too. Service was impeccable, our waiter was very nice and patient ( we were a large group, so we really appreciated his patience). We all really enjoyed our steaks, loved the wine and liked the desserts too. We recommend their staple delmonico rib eye steak. From the sides, we really liked the mushrooms and the lobster mac and cheese. Creamed spinach was great too. Was very positively surprised by how great their classic baked Alaska was. Normally not a fan of it, but this place has a really good one. Wholeheartedly recommend dining here.

name: Harry's NYC
address: 1 Hanover Square, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Great place! We had a bottle of wine with cheese to start with. Both were divine. Had crab cake for appetizer. Also delicious! Had Filet Mignon with Lobster fried rice as main entree and let me say. By far one of the best steak I have ever eaten! Service was amazing!!! My cup was never empty. Attention to detail at its finest! Worth every penny!

Brunch here is my favorite in the city. Between reasonably priced food and upscale environment, Harry's has been my go-to for a fun brunch and has never disappointed. Unfortunately I don't live within walking distance anymore to get the champagne brunch regularly, but every visit to the city involves a meal here. Come to Harry's with a small group, big group, or alone for a quality meal. It's also good outside of brunch hours, obviously, with expertly-grilled steaks and a solid wine list. The bar space is large enough for standing situations over happy hour too.

Located close to Wall Street with a downstairs entrance. Our investment banker son had heard good things about Harry’s. So we went last night with him and had a delicious meal. I had the amazing branzino fish and the guys had the fantastic Wagyu burgers (they were rated very high). Service was excellent (we liked how they cleared all the plates at the same time too). Enjoyable evening.
Definitely glad I made reservations before coming because it was packed and for good reason. Their bottomless special was unbelievably worth it. Food was exceptional as well as the service. Nuff said
Best place on Stone Street for sheer quality and service. A must-visit sort of place, both worth seeing and worth going to see, especially if you value exquisite bar service. Very special!

name: Ulysses
address: 95 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: It is a cool place in the historical place in downtown. Cool decor, nice bar, friendly staff. Food is good for the most part. Bar food menu. Appetizers are ok, nothing really special, but main dishes are better. Good burger and short ribs. I would not recommend french onion soup, a little tart to my taste.

Great place in lower Manhattan! Great after work crowd. Summers out side are awesome. Food and drinks always hit the spot! Oh and the Staff! They are always great and make me and my friends feel like home.

Great staff. So friendly. Barman from Tipperary, rain on cobbles outside. Thought I was back in Dublin. We had Irish tapas. Sausage rolls, corned beef sliders, braised beef sliders. All excellent, the favorite being the beef. All washed down with Guinness.  Highly reccomend for food, staff, and atmosphere.

On recommendation from one of the people I met at the gym my friends and I went here. We were really impressed with the atmosphere and enjoyed the music being played. The barkeeps were super friendly. There was definitely a bit of an authentic Irish feel. We would totally have stayed longer if we didnt have other engagements.
I absolutely loved this Irish gem  in the middle of the financial district.  It's super authentic and has a dark worn wood feel.  I didn't eat, but the food looked pretty good...bar food for sure.

name: Stone Street Tavern
address: 52 Stone St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: My second go-to place on Stone Street in lower Manhattan. Great service at the bar, excellent selection of craft beers. Very attentive service.

Albeit expensive, I must admit that I very much enjoy the food. First of all, the benches outside is a big plus for the restaurant. The staff very friendly. The food is phenomenal and I love the jar that your drink is served into. The French fries seasoned! In my book, that was raised the bar to a higher level. To detress and relax from the office, go eat there for lunch. You will not regret it!
Nice discover. Great food and nice ambient. We had the main lobster, tuna sandwich and grilled chicken with pesto.

Tasty food in a great ambiance of a small tavern from the Financial District. It can be noisy (great place for drinking beer while watching sport events on screens) but you will find some tables to have quieter discussions. We ordered salads which were generous with lot of flavors. Staff is very friendly. Great time for a lunch (and probably evening and dinner)!

Good spot to get some few drinks after work. The food is pretty good here as well. My only negative experience is how they make their old fashion here. It's not that great and they put cherry instead of an orange peel and it comes in a small glass with tons of ice and charge 20 bucks for it. I get that it's FiDi and the prices are competitive and I don't mind the price if it's good but I was pretty disappointed. Other than that, overall my experience was good.

name: Mad Dog & Beans
address: 83 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Very friendly and attentive staff. They were great! Super clean restaurant with two floors. First floor has a bar and televisions as well as some tables. Second floor is largely tables. It's a great space for large parties. Plates come with large portions. Salsa and chips were yummy. Though pricey for guacamole, the cocktails were reasonable and delicious. I'd definitely go back.
One of my favorite Mexican spots downtown.  Great food and atmosphere.  The pork burrito bowl is amazing.
What you can expect from a decent Mexico restaurant. The place is quite noisy. A good place to hang out with friends on a Friday night.

I think I found my new favorite spot!
The server was so friendly and very attentive and thorough with our orders , we were in a group of seven for my goddaughter’s birthday. The music was nice and the food excellent,especially the guacamole and chips, definitely get the margarita tower it was not skimpy on the liquor.
LOVED IT!
Super fun place. Great bar and food. Music was fun. Nice place to hang out with friends

name: OBAO
address: 38 Water St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Exceptional food, helpful staff members, constantly  awesome atmosphere. They charge fair rates and the food quality is fantastic. Keep up the good work.
Good simple Thai food. Tad bit on the pricey side for the flavors. But probably about average price for FiDi. There isn't a lot of seating inside and can get crowded around lunch time.

After some of the reviews I had my doubts, but this place is amazing. Simple, well cooked, well seasoned Thai food made quickly. It really warmed me up on a cold night. The crispy spring rolls were stuffed with ground pork and had a satisfying crunch, the green curry was the perfect level of spice and went great with the brown rice. I really enjoyed my dinner here.
Good food, quick service. I got the lunch box. Thai ice tea is good too.
Pretty sure there were bugs in my pho. They were really nice about it and gave me a new bowl, and they said what I saw was black pepper. Aside from my experience, the food and service is great!

name: Financier Patisserie
address: 62 Stone Street,(BET MILL LANE AND, Hanover Square, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Service is great. Their  bread pudding is delicious with nice cup of tea. Nicely portioned. the ambiance  is very comfy. Moderately priced for the Area.

This is my number one choice for catering business lunches and dinners. They have a wide variety of selection whether it be wraps or sandwiches. Their pastries are d.e.l.i.c.i.o.u.s. Their catering manager, Kathleen Gallo, and Chef Richard provide Number One service. They're always available and happy to attend to our "all of a sudden" requests no matter the size. This is an exquisite choice. Thank you for the almost 20 years in the Financial District. Kudos!

I really wanted this place to be good. It’s such a cute café with a great location downtown. The atmosphere is really nice. But as soon as you enter there is a cold vibe from the staff. The service is hardly what one might cal “friendly.” 

The prices aren’t bad at first glance, but when the food comes you can’t help but to feel cheated. Portion sizes are small, and the presentation is bland. I ordered scrambled eggs as well as an egg white omelet. That’s literally all that I got. At least they’re honest. 

No seasoning. Bland. The egg whites were overcooked. It was hardly an omelette at all. Toast on the side. Perhaps it was buttered but I couldn’t tell... it was so dry. 

And the side salad was literally just a handful of greens. No additions, spices, flavor, or garnish whatsoever. 

I wish it had turned out better. But I probably won’t return. There are plenty of cafes in the city. This one has a great atmosphere. But if you’re looking for anything near flavorful food or decent service, your best head somewhere else. Once again I’m left regretting that I didn’t go to McDonald’s. At least they’re tasty and consistent.

Really cute shop! I went in for pastries for the holidays and I was surprised by how cute the yule log cake was.

I purchased a chocolate chip cookie, the tiny chocolate mousse cake, and the tiny modern yule log. The chocolate chip cookie is hard on the edges but soft towards the center. It can be a tad sweet, but I can see how people would like to order coffee or tea with it. The mousse cake is the perfect flavor of chocolate. It's not too sweet or too bitter and it's a strong chocolate flavor. The modern yule log is made from pistachios, chocolate, and I think cherry? It's cute because it has two tiny mushroom-shaped meringues on it which makes it look more "log-like". There were macaroon shells on the end of the logs and they were surprisingly really good. I would definitely go back for more cakes or macaroons.

I discovered that place while I was just working around the street after having a meeting with my friends . 
We were crossed the road and suddenly I read the name "FINANCIER PATISSERIE" with his beautiful green colors . We were attracted to the appetizing smell that came out of this bakery and decided to enter and discover the benefits that were there.  The diversity of products sold We had left so amazed that I had to decide to go there 3 days later to taste the "madeleines" cakes of the FRENCH savoir-faire.
Best place to enjoy French-cakes in #NYcity.

name: Haru Sushi
address: 1 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: This place is my favorite site.  Of all restaurants I know I like it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this restaurant. Whenever  I want to go to a superb lunch, this place comes right away to my mind. very good and all sorts of  food and a large menu.courteous staff members, and agreeable ambience. Also, the cost is decent. I suggest this restaurant with great pleasure.
Great place! Fabulous ambience, good food, and remarkable service. They serve very good hot sake.

We came to this restaurant for a meeting. we heard about this place from a lot of people.  Well, we were not disappointed. The staff members were extremely nice and we felt very good. The food was just great. We enjoyed every moment and we will definitely return to this restaurant. we highly recommend this place.

A reasonable menu mixing individual items and lunch specials.  Service was very prompt and attentive. I had the eel dish (unaju) which was attractively laid out on the dish but not especially flavorful

I was a little cautious about this place at first because of some reviews and because of its location next to Wall Street. I thought folks may have skewed reviews about what good sushi is. The reviews are right, this place is very good. I ordered the King Crab dumplings to start out which are served in the steam basket. They were delicious! You get to really just taste the sweet crab.

For my main course I had the sushi sashimi combo. Every single piece of fish was very fresh! Each one! The sashimi melted like butter! It also comes with an eel/cucumber hand roll. Best eel I've had, hands down! Couldn't believe how good it was.

The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because of the lighting. I like to see what I am eating and in my opinion, this place is a tad to dim for me. It would be great for a romantic date though! Atmosphere is chill and the wait staff are attentive and what I really liked is that they helped one another out to look out for one another. I would come here again.

name: Underdog
address: 55 Stone St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews:
Excellent bar food,  good cocktails and beer selection. 

Wings,  one of the best.  They split the sections so they are easy to eat and have more crisp area.  

Fried pickles and elote are good. 

Cauliflower was not quite as crispy as one hoped
Chicken sandwich and burgers are better than average. 
Good for a quick stop.
Great Pub. Excellent service. Great Beer Selection and Food Menu. My burger was perfect. Great atmosphere.

Second time being here and I'm still quite pleased. Don't recall what I had the first time but on this visit, Thug Rose was the choice given by our waiter and I'm so glad he did! I loved it! Sweet yet had a nice kick too it. The wings were great; loved how they were cut up but I wasn't a fan of the blue cheese.... it was whipped thin which posed a different flavor.
More than great! The food was delicious (recommended burger dog) and drinks f.e.devil dog 😊 good climate 😉 worth to go! 🤩

Nice place a good appetizers. Would have preferred the female bartender tone down her conversation and her language.  She talked over the music—and the conversation at our table— the entire time. Nice place, but our entire party was glad to get away from that annoyance.

name: No.1
address: 10 S William St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Very cute and quiet place.  Tucked away from mainstreet traffic. Excellent service delicious food. Had cold sesame noodles and shrimp fried rice.

We met with friends at this restaurant for dinner. This restaurant was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, it was a winning. The staff members welcomed us with a smile and we felt excellent. The meal was tasty. We had a great time and we will definitely return to this restaurant. we highly recommend this place.

Best Chinese food in the financial district. More expensive, but worth it. There are no lunch specials here but the combination plates serve a similar purpose to lunch specials found elsewhere. They have good vegan and vegetarian options which are recommended. Also, a good spice to their food. 

The seating area is also quite nice, as are the waitstaff. Check it out!

Omg! I had not had shrimps over angel-hair pasta since long time ago. The wanting for trying it again was there, but never had found a good Chinese restaurant until TODAY! I had the best meal of my life! So tasty, with a hint of spicy, friend eggs and the right amount of soy sauce! Can't complain at all!
