First time trying delivery today. Had eaten there once before a long time ago. Delivery was in under 30 minutes. I had the steamed Chicken and Mixed Vegetables with Garlic sauce on the side. You can order about a half dozen different sauces with this healthy meal. I had the sauce on the side. The food was cooked perfectly and arrived hot. Garlic sauce was average. Delivery man was pleasant.

name: Da Vinci
address: 44 Water St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: In New York for vacation and stopped in here for lunch. I could not be more pleased! The pizza was incredible, and the service was friendly and fast. I looooooved it. Thank you Da Vinci!!
Really good pizza, not burnt like some other places. Fast and friendly service, no frills. Please dont judge me for all my seasoning, I just cant help it. I want all of it.
Made a visit to NYC for work and found this place nearby. NY pizza in general is very good. This place was decently priced, near work and fast. Would definitely come here again.

Omg the worst Lasagna I've ever had in my entire life!!!  The meat tasted like it was frozen and was just heated up slightly before putting it together. The sauce was definitely from a can.  The Lasagna  was very greasy so it made the sauce watery, and to top it off the cheese was very thick where my husband and I had issues chewing it... and i was also choking on the cheese because of how thick it was.  Im sure if they tried harder it'll be better but it just wasn't there tonight....  and we paid like 9 per meal so i was a little ticked off about that. 😕😔🤨

Fyi they have food just sitting on the back counter its not covered at all.  Definitely a food safety hazard.

This is one of many more-or-less identical pizza slice places in New York. But because it was very close to where I was working once, I went here dozens of times or more, and I like it. The pizza is good, and they have quite a few varieties of both regular and square pizza. I’d usually get a couple of slices for lunch. The plain cheese and margherita slices are pretty good, and the grandma pizza squares are very good. Just thinking about it makes me hungry for more pizza!

The staff are very helpful and, like it says on the door, they have air conditioning!

name: Route 66 Smokehouse
address: 46 Stone St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: My go to place in lower Manhattan. We bike down from the Upper West Side and grab some Racer 5’s at the bar. Decent BBQ and typical pub food. Staff always remembers us and give us exceptional service. The tables on blocked off Stone Street are fun for a group of people.

I have to say. This place really impressed me. Not only do they have great food and drinks, they even have various video games that resonate with my time period. New York Cares actually chose this place to celebrate the achievement of the 2019 coat drive. I enjoyed myself so much that I almost don't want to leave here. It is very spacious in the upstairs bar area and there are many games that catered to all skill levels. Connect Four, the NES, pinball machines, the classic arcade section, you name it., they have it. I will recommend this place if you want to chill out after a long day of work or celebrate an achievement as mentioned above.
Love this joint. Lots for meat lovers (plus veg burger and salads). Great option in the financial district/near Ground Zero.

The service was 5 stars. The food was 6 stars. The mac & cheese is how grandma use to make it. Had the Kobe burger which was outstanding. There is nothing bad that you can say about this place. Throughly enjoyed my visit and definitely coming back.

We were there last night. The drinks (Basic Brah & Better Than Everyone) were excellent. The bartender, Jonathan suggested the perfect beers for us. The food was delicious; devilled eggs, sauteed kale and beef ribs. Jonathan proved to be an outstanding bartender. He was friendly and knowledgeable. We will definitely be back next year!  I can't recommend this place enough!

name: Luke's Lobster FiDi - Temporarily Closed
address: 26 S William St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Very fresh seafood and drinks at a reasonable price. Restaurant is not fancy but very relaxing. Staffs are nice and efficient too. Probably the best place for lobster in town. I came in on a Friday during happy hour, and it wasn’t too crowded.

Outstanding fresh tender Lobster Rolls made from only the lobster claws (Maine) makes this the best lobster roll in New York City. We take our 9/11 Museum staff here sometimes and it’s always a 5-star eating experience. Lobster rolls are chock full of tender perfectly cooked meat, drizzled with butter and served on a toasted Texas style roll. It doesn’t get better than this — highly recommended. Manager Travis is so passionate about the Luke’s Lobster franchise — he was a joy to listen to and shared all the details about the eco friendly and humane company. We love meeting people who are so passionate about what they do. A 5-Lobster Rating!. Enjoy!!
Perfect taste of Maine in NYC (I'm Maine born and raised). Casual environment, quick service and reasonably priced. Will return to Luke's every time I travel to Manhattan.

We ordered the trio; shrimp, crab and lobster. The lobster was delicious as well as the crab. The shrimp was too fishy to me. We also had the lobster bisque, that was delicious as well, could have more pieces of lobster in it, bit it was good. We also had the bottled Blueberry lemonade and that was very tart, would not get it again.  Location is great, but it is very small. There was no line this was right before lunch time. Staff was friendly. Prices weren't too bad.

The food was great and I loved how the  the bread was very soft. I had 5he Luke's trio which was good. I would recommend this place to any one that want a quick sea food bite for lunch or just to hang out with friends

name: Taste of Tokyo
address: 60 Beaver St, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews:
What a gem! Husband really wanted sushi and I didn't, but we both love Japanese/Chinese food. You are greeted with wet towels to wash you hands off before you eat, menu is extensive with great prices, good was phenomenal and came out fast, sake selection is amazing and very well priced, and then you are given a plate of honeydew to finish off your meal. 

Someone commented that the seats are torn, and they are, but the food and service compensate for it.
Gyoza was perfectly fried. Crazy tuna roll was amazing. Very cheap for the area and the quality. Will definitely be back.
Good sushi rolls, fast service, and reasonable prices.

The place is in a nice environment. The food is great. Fast service and very friendly and polite. All my coworkers usually eat there but this is my first and is not going to be last. Looking forward to going again soon. ❤🌟❤🌟❤🌟❤🌟❤🌟

Great little sushi spot.   Nice and clean spot, rarely crowded.   Food tastes great.   Dining in comes with app, salad, soup, and dessert.  My only real complaint is that I can't get the special to dine in.  But we order take out all the time too so and it's fast.

name: Kome Waza
address: 40 Water St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Omg, I have been craving a Poke bowl for months and today my sister treated me to Kome Waza and it was amazing. The seafood is fresh and the ginger sauce was delicious. I will definitely be back soon! Wish they were near my job uptown.
Got the tuna bowl with brown rice, seaweed, lettuce, sesame seeds and a few more things. It was delicious. The space is not terribly large but the service is fast and efficient. Definitely try it.
I go here all the time, it's good. But I got shafted with the portions of vegies. Kind of outrageous. They wanted more money. Kinda disappointed.
favorite spot around this part of town for quality lunch. seafood and ingredients are fresh and delicious. staff is usually friendly. not a lot of space for seating but just enough.
Great fresh fish, excellent side toppings (spring for the tobiko) and delicious sauces. Can't say enough good about this place. Just wish they had Lipton pureleafs.

name: Le Pain Quotidien
address: 85 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews:
The was an incredible breakfast, brunch option close to great sites. Michael was so hospitable and made sure that he shared some special tips as we made out way to the statue. 

The food was just as incredible! Taste, presentation and quality were all there.

We came here for breakfast and our server Michael was amazing!
Great food, coffee and company. 
He was a great tour guide and happily shared with us all the places to go see and his favorite hidden gems.
Will definitely be back

Decent food, but nothing special. Okay service, but wouldn't call good. This place has the potential to be so much more. Huge space, very conveniently located but not a lot of effort given by staff or management. The massive dining room is a plus because you can always find a table to eat at or work from. They also have convenient outlets around for charging. I do think their coffee is on the better side and some of the pastries. I just really wish their entrees and sides were better. I will probably continue to frequent from time to time because of convenience and it's "safe" but still on the disappointing side.

Great food and fabulous atmosphere! Our server Lance made the experience even better with his attentiveness and menu suggestions. He was sensitive to my food allergies and steered me towards options that suited my allergies. Wonderful place. Everyone must go and request Lance as their server!
Good option good place to change the classic breakfast menu. But i wont say its awesome its just good.

name: Ambizza Cafe
address: 20-26 Old Slip, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: Amazing value, generous portions, higher quality than anyone else in the area.  I have worked in this neighborhood for over 5 years and tried almost every cart in the area.  This is my favorite.  They are so friendly and always remember how I like my order.   Look at the amazing quality lamb kabobs.  Nobody else in lower Manhattan has this high quality lamb- this is real, not that meat loaf stuff everyone else has. Their chicken is also excellent.
Huge, delicious lunch platter for $8! Includes chicken kebab over rice, salad, fries, falafel, pita and soda. The lady is always very kind and warm. Food and experience can't be beat.

You cant beat this Food Truck. The price for the lunch special is unbelievable for downtown Manhattan. The food is very tasty. The service is great the lady treats everyone great and always has a smile.
One of the best places in the downtown area for the cost and quality of the breakfast and lunch being served.
Friendly service, great food, very fair prices.  Great way to start the day!

name: Adrienne's Pizzabar
address: 54 Stone St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: I came here few days ago and I have to tell you that this is the best pizza I’ve ever had. The price might be a little upscale but it’s definitely worth it. Flavor is amazing, I shared two pies with my friends and we are planning on going back once quarantine ends. (2020 for y’all). I saved some for later, it tasted as if it was made fresh. I’ve never had this experience with pizza. Cheesy perfect, sauce perfect, crust amazing. I had a wonderful experience.

I went to this place for lunch two days in a row. Solid pizza with quality tomato sauce. I just love their sauce.  It tastes fresh and delicious. I now want to try them for dinner.  Adding basil as a topping is a must!

My favorite pizzeria in NY. If you have enough people, definitely try the old fashion pizza with customized toppings. My favorite is definitely sun dried tomatoes. But their regular 12" is still good! Would definitely come back.

Great area for a quick bite and for social drinks. Our visit was good, and we choose to sit outside on the old brick road. Many other eateries around as well that share the dinning area (Picnic Tables and benches). But the family voted for pizza. The only issue we had was the pizza came to us burnt. You can tell our server knew it as well and was waiting to see if we would say something. Of course we sent it back as I have boys who will not eat burnt food or the Mrs. The new one that came out was perfect. The fresh crushed tomato sauce really brought out the flavor of the pizza. Overall it was a great experience for our trip in NYC.
Decent pizza, nice location. We sat at a communal folding table in the middle of a cobblestone street out front and covered by a tent. It was an enjoyable lunch.

name: Hph Hospitality Group
address: 93 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: A fantastic company to work for. Like all companies they have their issues but an overall  positive experience.
Great place, Saturday night very Lively. Awesome bar oh, fantastic Mexican food, great margaritas
Terrible company
Bien

name: Underground Pizza
address: 3 Hanover Square #2615, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Very well kept and welcoming restaurant. They offer large portions and for fair rates. I liked the meals very much and the staff members were very friendly and chatty. Will definitely recommend this restaurant.
Great pizza at affordable prices. Awesome for out of towners.
The good pizza lunch and dinner is great thanks  for your recommendation always and the crew great job. i recommend this place great food and environment. I love it!
My favorite pizza in the area, at good prices. We also regularly order pies from them, and they are always consistently delicious. Good stuff, guys!
Delicious pizza, reasonably priced, and room th o sit down inside.  We had a half pepperoni/half sausage pie and it was enough food for 2 adults and 5 children.

name: Hale and Hearty
address: 55 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: I remember how we used to go to Hale and Hearty, that is, my co-workers and I for soup and salad during the winter months. One of my co-workers went so much as using this place as her healthy food place. She did lose some weight. The variety of soup did it for me. That split pea soup....Try it. Yes, I got the piece of bread. I couldn't resist.

My first time buying a salad and was very disappointed, who ever made it, made it with no love or care at all..they throw one big piece of chicken right in the middle of very soggy lettuces. I always love the soups and will continue to buy the soup and sandwich. The salad on the other hand I'll go elsewhere.y

The food here is very good. The salads are made fresh in front of you. Everything is very light but very filling. I was pleasantly surprised. The staff here is very very nice. It is definitely one of the best salads I have honestly ever eaten in my life. I would definitely suggest that you look up the menu before you go in. The line moves fast and if you are not sure what you want by the time you get up to the counter then you are going to be having issues.. Wish they had a location up by me.
Nice place. Staff are friendly, salads are good especially when u get to prepare ur own salads
Coconut Shrimp and Mango lime Chicken Salad....yummy!!!

name: 11 Hanover Greek
address: 11 Hanover Square, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: Solid food with good balance of flavor and awesome cocktails.  Only issue was that seafood pasta had fantastic tiger prawn, but salty clams, tiny mussels and soggy fettuccini.  Personally, I think spaghetti or angel hair would have been better.  But overall, pretty good. Will definitely go back for the tiger prawns and Greek salad.

excellent restaurant and a good addition to the area. comfortable airy seating. welcoming, attentive service. quality fresh food and very tasty. generous portions. everything we ordered was very good including the complimentary bread with creamy garlic cheese sauce. nice cocktails and wine.
My brother and I had the prix fixe lunch and were very happy with our meals. The atmosphere is very nice and the food was excellent. We will definitely eat here again.

Perfect! It’s the only way to describe this dining experience! We were so impressed by everything: the service, wine, atmosphere, menu and of course the food - wow! We shared several of the starters and one main and it was more than enough between three people. Complimentary bread but please make sure you order the octopus, lamb, spreads... actually - just order everything! And also make sure you get dessert also - it is life changing

From the door to when we left we had stellar service, the manager, Robert our server we were loving it! We also had our mothers with us and Robert was so patient .. we had the off menu items because they sounded amazing ...they tasted even better

name: Terrace Fish & Chips
address: 77 Pearl St #2613, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: This tiny busy shop knows how to do it right. They have a good variety of fried and  grilled seafood served up efficiently. I had the special of the day, fried breaded flounder and french fries and a soda, while my friend chose the healthier grilled fish with salad. My fish and chips was fresh, crispy, and moist without being oily. My friend's dish was also fresh. With the variety of neighboring cuisines available, we were looking for a place to sit. Terrace squeezed in a counter around 2 edges with 6-8 stools that 4 or 5 could sit at comfortably.

A different kind of fast food restaurant because they solely specialize in fried and grilled fish, shrimp and seafood all tasty and well prepared with side dishes and sauces.  My only disappointment was not being able to eat it there since I took order to go. Their menu is very diverse and reasonably priced.
Place is awesome. Just tried it today for the first time. Got the flounder and shrimp platter with fries. BEST Fish and Chips I ever had. Def earned a spot on the weekly lunch rotation !

I frequent this unique place often because I like the good air that is unique to this place. The personel is exceptionally welcoming and professional. The service is remarkablywonderfully efficient. Needless to say, the food you eat is magnificent. I came more than once and I was never disappointed. The pay is modest. I recommend this restaurant to my friends and family.

Terrace is a useful fast source of fish and chips in the Financial District.  Most people get their food,  typically lunch, to go.  Indoor seating is limited.  In warm months you can enjoy your meal on nearby outdoor tables, benches and walls.  The fish is tasty.  French fries (chips) are acceptable.   Portions are large.  You finish happy and satisfied.

name: Dunkin'
address: 33 Beaver St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: I like locations that has seatings, where I can sit and enjoy my latte while creating content.  This was a good location and the latte came out perfect.
Fast service, very nice staff. Is the only store I recommend.
Good location - fast and efficient.  Take out on app works well.  A little difficult sometimes with unruly young students who go to school in the area is the big drawback.

I usually like Dunkin Donuts, but not this location. Their coffee never comes as I ordered it. I ask for a little milk and one sugar. I get very light and very sweet. Worse, the customer service is atrocious. They will only attempt to fix the problem once and it rarely comes out much better. The place only reason the place stays in business is because of its location.
This is the worst dunkin in the area. Slow and employees do not care, especially the woman who is always working there.

name: New Golden Chopsticks
address: 77 Pearl St #3, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Big selection and some things are surprisingly good! Friendly staff and great lunch deal! Added to the weekly lunch roster

Great greasy Chinese food. Exactly what you think you're getting, and exactly what you want when you want this kind of food. The buffet is good and well varied, and has a good discount after the main rush. The place itself is kind of cramped, but there is seating outside and good views. I'd recommend it for a good cheap lunch.
I eat in this spot a lot since I work nearby. I have to say the customer service is always great and they keep the place clean at all times. Rates are fair and they serve sizeable portions.

Surprisingly good food.  We got to low Manhattan early and was going to get pizza but since we had pizza planned for lunch, we decided to get something different.  And the food was actually very good at low price.  Owner was very nice too.

Its a small and clean chinese restaurant near to stone street. There are great options in the buffet which is undoubtedly value for money. I generally take pork fried rice as a base. Variety of chicken, shrimp, veggies, pork and beef are also available.

Staff is quick and friendly. I am giving full rating for the combination of price-quantity-taste.

name: All American Deli
address: 42 Water St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Great staff, very good breakfast sandwiches. We really enjoyed eating there. Would visit that place again when in NYC :-) Thanks

Good affordable breakfast place. I stumbled upon All American Deli when I was walking from my hotel Club Quarters at 52 Williams st, and looking for a good place to have some coffee and bagels (when you are in New York you got to try them). So I ordered an Egg and Cheese Bagel for 3.5$ and a small cappuccino for $2.5

Inexpensive, delicious food. Friendly staff. Large portions to keep you on your feet. Excellent muffins made in house. I had the corned beef hash and two egg combo, it's $6.25, and the most expensive thing on the breakfast menu.
They make great sandwiches at a fair price
Customer service is great. Food is awesome.

name: Wall & Water
address: 75 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: Went with a group in early December (2012) and found Wall & Water with a smaller than usual dinner menu due to Hurricane Sandy.  All of the food that was available was amazing however, the steak I got was perfectly cooked and delicious.  It was also a treat to view the work going on in the open kitchen and with a Savored discount the entire experience was definitely reasonable.

The Veal Cheeks was one of the best meals I've had in years.  Absolutely wonderful piece of meat.  Had a great meal in a quiet setting (it was a Sunday) with family, and hope to come back to sample more of their offerings.
Good business lunch restaurant. The place can be a bit loud but the food is good and not excessively expensive for the area. The Mac and cheese is a staple.
Rip-off.  Food is nothing special.

Посредственный ресторан при замечательной гостинице.
Яйца бенедикт почему то не дали. Цены выше среднего. Обслуживание не очень. Отказались пересадить к окну при пустом зале, мол, все места у окна заняты. Но за все время что мы там сидели никто в ресторан так и не пришел.

name: Pranzo Pizza & Pasta
address: 44 Water St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: It was a good pizza shop in the wall street area. High priced but the service and the food are worth the extra cost i like that they have all types of slices and pies. They also have the pasta and meat section all types of pasta and chicken shrimp and egg plant. You can make your own combination platter.
A good variety of pizza. Generous on the toppings. Pizza is soft and fluffy and at the same time crispy.
Their pizza is the best. If you like thin crust that is crispy, you will love their pizza. Highly recommend the mushroom pizza. I go there everytime I am in that area.
Awesome NY pizza in a cool no frills hole in the wall.

Best pizza and pasta in the Water St. area. We have ordered pies for meetings and parties in the past and it's always excellent. As pizza is my favorite food, I'm picky about where to go so Pranzo is my first choice for NYC style pizza.

name: Justino's Pizza
address: 77 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Absolutely LOVED this place!! The pizza was off the charts! Tucked away in the Financial District. We were looking for another location and popped up on this wonderful little gem!  I had the broccoli and chicken pizza. The crust was just the right amount of crunchy.  I HIGHLY recommend it!
Crispy bottom, delicious flavoring, not soggy, but with plenty of moisture and ingredients on top oh, perfect

You won’t regret eating this pizza. The environment is quintessential New York, and the pies are among the best of the best.

Also, the name is pretty good if I do say so myself.
Best slice I've ever had. Kids also agreed, best slice they have ever had. We'll be back!
Had the barbecue chicken pizza, it had a good smoky flavor.

name: Oaxaca Taqueria
address: 87 Beaver St, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: Amazing. Sizable portions with agreeable prices, especially for Manhattan. Mole sauce was excellent on the chicken enchiladas. Rice and beans were exceptional. Workers were all super friendly. Fast service.

I meet friends in this great restaurant many times a year! This is my favorite place to eat.  I visit this place many times. The food is just great, the staff is helpful and the rates are fair. I like going in this spot over a decent meal.

Me and my co-workers love Oaxaca Taqueria. Great tacos, food is good. Unlimited hot sauces. Their Horchata is good and they have Jarritos (tradicional Mexican soda). 3 tacos, rice and frijoles for $11.95 (You cannot go wrong!). Staff is really friendly and helpful. Location is clean. You can order online! Not overpriced!
Tacos could’ve been better if the corn tortilla was hotter.
Amazing Mexican food. Great prices. Totally delicious. Ask for the fish tacos that are not on the menu.

name: Bingo Deli
address: 77 Pearl St #6, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: This idea my go-to deli, especially for breakfast.  The food is good and served quickly. The best part about the deli is the friendly cashier with excellent customer service. She is the reason that I will bypass the restaurant conveniently located in my building to walk outside in the cold, rain,  or oppressive heat. Needless to say,  I recommend this place.
One of the best Deli's in the area. Love the Grilled Chicken California club sandwich. Service can be slow during lunch hours but it is worth the wait! Prices are decent also.

You know when you've had a bad day, and only good food can provide solace? Yeah. It was a bad day. Luckily Bingo Deli's provided the perfect solace and even made me feel better about it. The Taylor ham sandwich was a life saver. The pork, bacon (somehow I got extra on my sandwich? Loved the surprise though) and egg combo was amazing!

Every time I fly out of New York, NY we make a stop here -- it is bar none the best burger joint I have ever been too. I always get the special and have yet to be disappointed. My fiancé ordered a salad, which was the first salad I've tried in almost a dozen trips, and it was awesome. The one knock of the place is its size, which didn't use to be an issue until the last time we went and there was a long line the second they opened. Thankfully you can eat at the bar next door as long as you don't mind relatively loud music.Bingo Deli

This was a regular lunch spot of mine when I worked in the city.  Decided to stop by here for lunch with the kids while on vacation.  The Chicken Delight sandwich is just as tasty as I remembered.  Great sandwiches, fast service and good prices.

name: Hanover Gourmet Deli
address: 3 Hanover Square #3, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Welcoming and friendly atmosphere. The gentleman who checked me out provided me with all neccessary utensils, anticipating my needs after getting back to my room with my yogurt and pastry. I greatly appreciate the service of the establishment. Thank you!

Not gonna lie one of the best deli’s in the downtown wall st area. It’s the best spot for breakfast and lunch during the week and weekends. The burger here is amazingly delicious. And surprisingly one of the only spots open on Sunday witch is a must for me. All in all I come here all the time and would recomend to anyone who like good clean food!👍👍

No problems I love my meal that I just wish I had another chicken burger. Good to eat it when you have the munchies. My meal had coleslaw with sesame seeds, crispy chicken blended with sweet soy sauce I think but damn is so good. You won't regret it Hanover Gourmet Deli

If you haven't ate a burger here you haven't lived. One of the best cheeseburgers in the Bay Area. I love the plain cheeseburger, medium well. My partner loves the fancy burger that has the blueberry sauce with bacon and blue cheese. The scampi garlic fries also super bomb. You can go sit at the bar next door and they will come deliver the food to you. You could enjoy the burger with any adult beverage of your choice if you eat at the bar. Love that concept. There is a backyard patio spot if you do decide to eat at the bar and there aren't enough indoor seats. Kinda pricy as you have to order each item separate (fries, burger, drink). Very worth it. Juicy meat and something about the bun they use, Hanover Gourmet Deli !
Best food in lower manhattan.

name: PIZZA ETALIA
address: 20 Beaver St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: I had a great dining experience here. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The pizza is so good. This is my go-to spot when I visit New York. Good prices and great quality.

I specifically chose sausage pepper and onion roll because it does not have cheese in the description. Cheese was an option for additional purchase. Instead I received the order with cheese. They said they tried to contact me but I didn’t receive any voicemail or missed messages. Sigh... now I have to order something else.
Excellent NYC pizza.  Mind blowing amount of different pizzas on offer! The sausage pizza and the chicken alfredo pizza were phenomenal.

NY pizza at its best. Got there just before close and they happily served me. Didn’t even rush me out so I could sit and enjoy my slice before jumping back on my CitiBike. Great pizza- did a standard sausage slice; then an off the wall one- chicken broccoli. Both were great in their own way!
This spot is worth a try. They have large portions for fair rates. Always neat and with awesome atmosphere. Will come visit again.

name: King David Tacos
address: Coenties Slip, New York, NY 10005, USA

name: Springbone Kitchen
address: 74 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews:
Rich bone broth in a variety of tasty combinations ranging from only broth to hearty soup.
The menu also has bowls and breakfasts.
It would be helpful if nutritional info was available for menu items beyond just the broths.

I ordered Springbone through the Food For All app (half priced meals at the end of the day to eliminate food waste) and I thought it was great! The staff was super conversational and friendly and I loved the unique beverages they had, like CBD sparkling water and Kombucha. The bowl itself was delicious too I would definitely go back.

Went here to get the immunity broth when I felt like I was coming down with something. Great tasting broth and I felt so invigorated afterwards.

Staff was very nice and quick with making it for me. There wasn’t a line so I must’ve been in and out in a minute, very efficient.

This is my go-to place for bone broth. Its the only place I've found near FiDi that serves it unfortunately but I'm glad they popped up. My favorite are just the bone broths but some times the add-ins are good too. I've seen crowds waiting around in there so I can understand some complaints about it being slow at times.
Great bone!

name: Sky55 bar and grill
address: 55 Water St, New York, NY 10041, USA
reviews: It was ok. I had a burger and the it was really good damn near high end. The fried potatoes were too starchy. I could tell they were not blanched.  Had a decent whiskey sour.
The best drinks out there. The staff is great and the food is great. Nice place to spend a Friday night out. If you like it my review please check the thumbs up.
Had a specialty watermelon cocktail which did not taste good... and service in the beginning was terrible...i was my own waitress... nice ambiance.

Bar food better than average. especially chicken sandwiches. Place is a bit tricky to find. Look for escalators coming to sidewalks. Outside of the bar, on the back there is a terrace with nice view of waterfront.
Terrific spot, great drinks, accommodating bartenders and reasonable prices

name: The Schnitzi Truck
address: 59-75 Water St, New York, NY 10005, USA

name: Leo's Bagels
address: 3 Hanover Square, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews:
A love letter to a bagel, and the weirdest Yelp review I've ever written--

Dear Everything-Bagel-with-Whitefish-Salad-Wild-Sockeye-Salmon-Lettuce-and-Tomato, 

I love you. 

I honestly didn't know what to expect. People rave about New York bagels: "You have to get one!" But which one and from where?!

Fortunately, you were waiting for me at Leo's Bagels, a bagel shop just conveniently close enough for me to walk to from my post-interview location. 

(I didn't even know Leo's Bagels was a happening kind of place until I saw the line out the door and a lady forcing her children to take a photo with the sign!)

You were listed on a special menu, written by hand, on a big butcher paper roll. I was tempted by everything you contained--I'm a glutton (it's probably why I always go for an "Everything" bagel).  

Then, everything happened so fast. I ordered you (along with a cinnamon-raisin bagel with strawberry cream cheese). The man worked quickly and efficiently. No time for niceties, but I didn't care. 
Finally, you and your sweet, sister-bagel were handed to me in a brown paper bag. I stepped outside, triumphantly, but also worried--where would I consume you? 

Just a block down and around the corner I found the spot. There were all the other people happily enjoying their special bagel orders. Love in the air. Crumbs on their coats. Cream cheese on their chins. It was ~magical. 
Unwrapping you was a delight. Seeing your exposed halves absolutely stuffed with layers of whitefish, salmon, tomato, and lettuce...it was inspiring. I held your toasty, seed crusted, bagel exterior with both hands, opened wide, and took a bite. 

And it was everything. There was nothing to complain about. There was just flavor and crunch and creaminess and goodness to experience. It didn't take long for me to finish. 

I can't wait to have you again. 

-Merly
---------------------
Thank you Leo's Bagels for making my first NYC bagel experience so awesome. Also, that cinnamon-raisin bagel with strawberry cream cheese was amazing. They're so generous with the cream cheese and the bagels are toasted beautifully. (I love that they're chewy on the inside and crispy on the outside.) 

The only thing I'm concerned about, is that if I ever move to NYC, Leo's Bagels is probably going to contribute to my needing to be air-lifted out of my house some day.

Went early morning when they opened. Line was reasonable and moved quickly. Staff was friendly and helpful. I got a beagle sandwich with Smoked salmon and it was good. Also got a regular beagle with plain cream cheese also very good. I would recommend this place and eat there again.

Breakfast with a "friend" in the Queen Elizabeth II Park several steps away from Leo's. I asked for the soup of the day but was told they don't have any at this location.  Is there another location of Leo's? The everything bagel was crisp on the outside and chewy inside, perfection. Yes, Russ and Daughter's cream cheese is better but Leo's is right around the corner. Stop in to Leonidas by the park for a coffee, it's incredible. The line moves very quickly, don't be put off by it.

First place we stopped for breakfast when getting into town for vacation. Bagel breakfast sandwiches were really good. It was really busy but the line went really fast. No room to eat there, but that seems to be the norm. I would recommend this Place to anyone looking for a good quick bite to eat.

Orders are consistently incorrect and the staff is rude. Don't even think about ordering for delivery unless you like big fees and waiting 120 minutes. As others have said, the bagels are good but bagels are good at every deli corner in NYC. Don't waste your time or money here.

name: Insomnia Cookies
address: 76 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews:
We were hankering for some late night dessert after checking into our hotel, and Yelp said this was the closest place that was open near us. Great! We love ice cream sandwiches.

Place smelled amazing when we walked in -- fresh baked cookies, warm sugar, and wafts of chocolate. There's a huge fridge of milk in case you'd like to have some with the cookies. At the time of our visit (1:45AM), the store only had a few flavors from their full range offered, but we were more than happy to order two ice cream sandwiches: one deluxe and one regular.

Delicious, gooey goodness. Milk and cookies has long since lost its crown to ice cream, and I wouldn't have it any other way. The cookies are well made, not too dense but also not too crumbly. The ice cream is creamy, melty, and seeps into the cookies when they do. It's a perfect late night snack, afternoon dessert, and celebratory bite to eat.

The staff is super enthusiastic despite the late hour of our visit, so props to the midnight crew! Y'all are killing it, and we see + appreciate that energy. Keep it up!
There’s a good reason the line is always out the door! ...Always freshly baked and chocolate chip cookies are always the perfect cheat 🙊

Insomnia cookies ! Great place and delicious cookies! Definitely a go to spot whenever You’re around! Friendly inviting staff, small area with limited seating and it may get crowded but it’s worth the wait!

*HEALTH RISK* 

Came into the store and was ignored by (presumably) female manager who was listening to music. More helpful staff member came out from the back of the kitchen to greet me and offer service. Started ordering however became distracted by female manager arguing with another employee. Also noticed no safety equipment being used i.e. masks, gloves, arguing over my open cookie box - at this point I decided to cancel the order and leave. 

Used to enjoy this shop but simply one too many rude encounters to continue patronage here. Concern if low staff standards will contribute to wider health risks of their customers.

We've experienced Insomnia in a few places across the nation. Frankly they're not very well known - I don't think they put a lot of money into marketing - but that just qualifies them as a "best kept secret". We've always walked in after finding them accidentally somewhere, but fresh-baked still-warm cookies delivered to your door (almost) anytime? YES PLEASE.

name: Financier Patisserie
address: 4 NY Plaza, 115 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: My go-to pastry mini-chain in NY for years. Well made pastries at good prices. Fast efficient service.

name: Claudia's Coffee Shop
address: 125 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: We get perfect coffee in here.
Best Coffee ever☕️

One of the things I miss about working in the FiDi. o frills - but how can you beat somewhere where you can find a cappuccino for $1.75?!? You aren't going to find that at any Starbucks or Dunkin' Donuts or Starbucks, that's for sure. The ladies who work here are super nice. They even gave out free planners at Christmas.

name: 787 Coffee
address: 66 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: Calling all coffee lovers- I recently had the pleasure of trying this new coffee shop and i enjoyed it wholeheartedly. This is their newer location in the Financial district. This is a dope coffee spot. First of all, they grow and roast their own coffee! That’s pretty cool! Also, they have rum infused coffee beans. Have you heard of anything cooler? The staff is beyond friendly, and knowledgeable. Their coffee is amazing, the brownies, the almond danish is OMG amazing! Give this place a try!

This place feels like Home away from home.... best coffee I’ll ever taste. Lovely people and atmosphere. The owners Brandon and Sam are the most wonderful people you would ever meet. If you love coffee this is the place you are looking for.

787 on pearl is a must stop! The best coffee I have had in a while. I would try the rum infused coffee and pastries on the side. In the financial district, a absolute hidden gem. The owner is so nice and employees are coffee brewing stars. Every thing is in house and you can truly tell that it is by the quality. Need a quite cozy place for a quick break to recharge from your hectic day? You found the place!!

The employees are so genuine and make some amazing coffee. They have offers for people who are local (aka work near by) which shows how much they care about their neighbors. I suggest getting something to go or to stay in their cute/spacious place.

This cafe has outstanding customer service. Everyone who works here is incredibly friendly and helpful. Staff checked in regularly to make sure we had enough water and assisted us when they noticed we needed outlets for work. They were incredibly open to answering questions. Unfortunately, I did not know they served empanadas, or I would have gladly eaten here instead.

name: Black Fox
address: 85 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA

name: Souvlaki Gr Truck
address: 26-20 Old Slip, New York, NY 10005, USA

name: Periscope Coffee On Pearl Street
address: 2 Hanover Square, Corner of Hanover &, Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: I saw this Periscope Coffee station for the first time on Tuesday, February 11, but was not able to make a purchase until today, Friday, February 14, 2020.  And I AM in love with Periscope Coffee!  The barista who made my coffee had a great, light-hearted personality.  All of the people who love and adore me would love if I had this guy's chill personality; truth be told, so do I!  I AM almost never in this part of Manhattan, but was so happy to stop for a coffee at this location earlier today.

A cute little coffee cart in Fidi! The barista is super friendly and hospitable. He definitely has a good sense of humor too! It's a great place to get quick coffee to-go. They accept apple pay!!! I'm always relieved to not have to dig into my bag to find my wallet. 
All in all, great service and good coffee. I got an iced oat cortado with a dark chocolate flavor shot. I usually like to taste the bitterness of the espresso in my coffee which was slightly missing. It could've been overpowered with the chocolate. Regardless, it was delicious and I would love to stop by and try something new the next time I am around! 

Update - this place has become my favorite coffee spot in FiDi! I tried it a couple more times and fell in love. I would like to revise my previous review and comment that with the latte, the espresso and dark chocolate was completely balanced! 

P.S. - the sun wasn't very cooperative in the pictures I took, sorry about the quality!
Best coffee in the area. I come here regularly and don’t consider anywhere else!  A must go to.
10/11/19 The barista has such a bright and welcoming personality! The Pumpkin pie (flavored) coffee is a HIT! Glad to have the truck close to my job, a great coffee makes the work day better.
Love the coffee here and Jared is fantastic.  I am obsessed and now they have their Secret Menu!

name: Bluestone Lane Water Street Coffee Shop
address: 90 Water St, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: Definetly worth stopping into. The cutest little environment, and the drinks are delicious. I get a large iced chai ($4) and I love it. There are a few downtown, and the prices are great!  Like really good!!
Delicious breakfast coming from sweet hands .. loved it 🌸❤
Nice avocado toast. Poor service.
I got the iced latte. It was DELICIOUS!  Friendly service and good atmosphere! Cute place will def. go back!

After many different coffee shops around the city I finally found the perfect shop!

Upon entering you can tell from the aroma that the beans have been properly roasted. I ordered a long black (basically an americano), my wife got a latte and our son got a hot chocolate. All of them were wonderful. I will definitely be back.

name: Open Market Cafe
address: 15 William St, New York, NY 10005, USA

name: Ferry House Cafe
reviews: Coffee and desserts are awesome, service is good :)
I love copy 😍 😊
James is a great barman!!
Unprecedented bar

name: OpticCoffee.com
address: 99 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA

name: IssueLab
address: 32 Old Slip 24th floor, New York, NY 10005, USA

name: BLUE CIRCLE
address: 95 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA

name: New York Vietnam Veterans Memorial Plaza
address: 55 Water St, New York, NY 10041, USA
reviews: Looks great during the holidays. In the summer time is a great place to sit down take a minute and relax maybe eat lunch or  late snack because it's nice cool wind.
Wide open space that is thoughtfully done. Nice area to sit and reflect on the service and giving of others.
It's a very memorable place and that's why we have to keep that place clean. When you get there it smells bad and there are cigarettes  there lying around. Let's have some respect

It is a place of reflection, but sorely lacking in it up keep. 
I remember when the soldiers came back from this war and we're ridiculed spit on and called baby killers. And most were just boys doing what their country asked them to do .

My experience at The NY Vietnam Veterans Memorial was a solemn yet wonderful find. I ventured downtown and ended up here, didn't know this memorial existed. 
I stopped by en route to work and seized  the moment to take in, respect and honor those who so valiantly fought and served this country. 
 There are various structures that identify the veterans, there's background history and much more... vistas of the Hudson, parallel views of the Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges, The portal to The Staten Island Ferry, etc. Definitely reccomend.

name: Coenties Slip
address: &, Water St &, Coenties Slip, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: If I ever am coming from the Lower East Side to the Staten Island Ferry on Whitehall St, which is a commute I often take on a at least weekly basis, sometimes in the past and really anytime in the present and future if I am on the M15 local or SBS-M15 select bus services Southwest route en route South Ferry Terminal, if the bus looks like it may not make the next scheduled ferry service to Staten island by the time the bus gets to the Fulton St Seaport bus stop, what I'll usually do is get off at the Wall St bus stop, and hang out at this park called Coenties Slip. It is a beautiful area with plenty of seating and is perfect for killing or wasting a good 5 to 25 minutes before or until the Staten Island Ferry on Staten island bound side is ready to board.
Nice hangout to lounge when weather permits.
Nice small park.
Nice place to enjoy the outdoors during lunch hour
Plenty of restaurants and outdoor seating around this paved park.

name: Elevated Acre
address: 55 Water St, New York, NY 10041, USA
reviews: What a view! There was no one else when I was there, I even bought a food from a food truck nearby and ate there, great lunch with a great view. You can see the helicopter tours as well. Nice spot to relax for a while (The stair is right next to Chase building)

Cute little oasis in between all the skyscrapers! You get brilliant views of the city and a place to chill and gather your thoughts while watching helicopters land and take off near by. You can also bring some snack or food with you and sit and enjoy the views.

This park is a hidden gem! I knew I had to visit this place after looking at the pictures. The views from here are amazing. This is a great place to click some nice photos of Brooklyn. There are tables here which makes it a good spot to relax and enjoy a takeout. There were few people at the park during my visit. It's best to wear a jacket because the winds that blow are cold. This park is not open 24hrs. From May 1 to Sep 30, the park is open from 7 AM to 10 PM. From Oct 1 to April 30, they are open from 8 AM to 8 PM. This is a nice place to check out when you're near Wall Street.
It's a beautiful place where you can find a moment of zen. I love the green & cityscape
This park feels top secret. It’s awesome. If you work in FiDi I would definitely check this place out!

name: The Queen Elizabeth II Garden
address: 11 Hanover Square #12, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: Gorgeous walking paths and architecture through the entire whole park. Trees and plants are labeled in order to actually learn a thing or two when you walk around. Wednesdays the lands pass is free therefore i have not been in to the conservatory but just walking on was very relaxing. Employees was also very helpful.
Nice and shady with lots of bench space. Not very big, but a pretty little park.
Comforting, calm space when I visited
Nice spot to sit and eat a bagel.
Great location when visiting the City. I heart NYC

name: Public Garden Space
address: 27 Old Slip, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: As others have said this little spot is a hidden gem. Awesome views of Brooklyn and manhattan Bridge
One of my favorite spots in all of Manhattan.  Kind of a hidden gem, this place becomes deserted at sunset, and the gentle slope of the park is beyond surreal.  A truly incredible urban park.
Pretty cool hidden gem!!!

Ce petit parc est situé au dessus du parking du gratte-ciel 55 Water Street. Vous pouvez y accédez par la South Street, ou se trouve un long escalier. Une fois à l'étage, vous pouvez profiter de ce petit parc verdoyant ainsi que de la vue sur l'East River et Brooklyn. L'entrée est gratuite.

name: Old Slip Park
address: Water Street & Old Slip, Water St, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: Great Park to sit and eat your lunch. Lots of food-trucks nearby. Every day different trucks with diverse food choices!

Lots of benches. Not much of a park. Lots of food trucks nearby.

These narrow slips used to be shipping ships running all the way to the river during old NY's shipping days. These have since been filled up and turned into parks and public places.

Good place to relax and grab a bite. There are food trucks near this park that offer a variety of food. There's enough space and benches for large groups. Even though my visit was during summer, the winds were cold. Make sure to wear a jacket.
Some benches trees, and food trucks around lunch time.
Good place with too many food trucks

name: South Street dog park
address: 56-50 South St, New York, NY 10043, USA

name: Coenties Slip
address: Financial District, New York, NY 10004, USA

name: Jiannetto's Pizza Truck
address: 90 Front St, New York, NY 10043, USA
reviews: I've had tuna all over the world and this by far is the best poke there is. They also have amazing smoothies and fruit bowls. I wish this was all over the country, definitely one of the best places to stop by if you're visiting or just want a healthy meal.

Love the grandma slices from this truck. I used to get these often when I worked downtown, but I saw them on my campus on LI today and had to get them. The slices are as fresh, hot, and tasty as I remembered it to me.

If you love pizza, you'll love Jiannetto's Pizza Truck!
Not cheap. I got the Green Goliath. My bowl tasted like water... but the toppings were good. Next time I'll go with the poke instead.
All are great but I'm a sucker for vodka slices and theirs is the best I've had.
Just go here, it's so good and I grew up with Italian food. Best meatball Parm and only $7.50

name: Lunch 4 Learning
address: 110 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA

name: Fuku
address: 110 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: There is an absolute draw to the food. Far very far from fast food but it's quick and yummy. Sauces make the ultimate topper on whatever your eating. They try to change it up here and there but stick to their staple fried chicken and cheese bread, off the charts good. Try the juice drinks real nice flavor.

Best chicken tenders I've ever had. Very juicy and the right amount of breading. The loaded fries were really tasty. The jalapeno dust on the fries was definitely spicier than I anticipated but very good

Delicious juicy crispy chicken. It was the first time I'd had such a huge piece of fried chicken breast that was both juicy and tasty. 

Amazing!

Loses 1 star for sticky seats 🤢

It was good! Between average-great. Not that impressive in first trial- maybe next time..but the wait line is pretty long and not sure if it was worth waiting. Chicken was defintely crispy and juicy, but bit salty in my opinion. Too much pepper! Maybe they rushed making it but fries had too much jalapeño powder and it was not evenly seasoned...

i really love this place!  It serves by far the best chicken burger on the planet.

Keep up the amazing work!

❤️🙏🏻

name: Westville
address: 110 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: Absolutely fantastic!!! California Benedict is amazing who would've thought salad greens go so well with eggs... lol

We arrived at this restaurant for a meeting. we heard about this place from quite a few people.  Well, it was very successful. The crew were extremely nice and we had an excellent feeling. The food was just great. We loved this restaurant a lot and we shall definitely come back again. Recommended.

Had lunch today at this place. My experience was very positive. Staff was very accommodating. The food was good, and the service was fast. I ordered the veggie soup and the grilled chicken platter and a soft drink for which I paid less than what I thought the cost would be.

You can sit inside at the bar or a table and outside on the sidewalk tables where I sat, and it was nice and comfortable with a Wall Street view.

This place always has such great, and fresh food! LOVE their yucca fries!! Their arugula salad with breaded chicken is also fantastic with just enough lemon and oil! The price is perhaps a tad high, but still plenty worth it. I’ve been here before and the burgers, Mac and cheese, sweet potato fries, chicken tenders, corn on the cob, fish and chips, and ALL their market sides are absolutely delicious.

Good food, reasonable prices, kind waitresses... the setting lacks intimacy for a date-dinner, but the location is easily reached. Plenty of vegetarian and vegan options. The peanut mousse is heavenly, not too much sugar. About 14-20 $ / dinner plate, 4-6 $ per dessert, well worth it.

name: Harajuku Japanese Crepe & Sushi
address: 20-26 Old Slip, New York, NY 10005, USA

name: Industry Kitchen
address: 70 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA
reviews: Wonderful restaurant!  The food is just amazing. You gotta try the rib eye. It's enough for 2-3 people and delicious. Furthermore the place is really nice, with a beautiful view of the Brooklyn Bridge. And there is also a very nice bar next to the restaurant witch I really loved. I strongly recommend!
Amazing place to dine in, very romantic with an amazing view. The food was delicious but the service needs to be improved! Reasonable prices as well!

We came for brunch on Sunday, the food was great, good views over the water and nice cocktails. As Brits visiting New York I have to say, we’ve been surprised by the quality of the service, to date it’s been pretty poor. However industry kitchen has been the exception, the waitresses were really friendly, greeted us with a smile (which has been unusual throughout the rest of our trip) and were very attentive. We’d definitely come back!

The industrial eggs Benedict taste great, but the size was quite small. The drinks are overpriced, and they served our $14 red wine in plastic glasses... weird. The ingredients of the signature pizzas are ridiculous for me. With that being said: the views are amazing (if that is what is the most important...) In summary: I don't think is worth the money unless you really don't care about eating.
The meal was delicious and the atmosphere was very laid back. Great date spot! I’d suggest wearing business casual or something along those lines.

name: Frankie Goes To Bollywood
address: 180 Maiden Ln, New York, NY 10038, USA
reviews:
This is a fancy looking place just beside SoHo square. Small place, cool ambience and the food tastes good. The level of spice is close to something you find in an authentic Indian restaurant. 

The biggest issue is the portion size. The cost for a wrap or rice bowl is close to $12 and the portion size is incredibly small. Classic Manhattan gluten free/vegan overpriced food.
Great new option with interesting flavors. This place has reading comprehension issues: they throw in unnecessary plastic cutlery even if the order says otherwise.
The chicken tikka wrap was amazing! Saag paneer was good too, and spicy but I especially loved the chicken tikka.
My favourite flavor is the oka.

Overpriced! Over 11$! You can get more food and better for that price.
I've ordered the Tikka sandwich, which came in a small wrap (barely longer than a pen)
Flavors are ok, perhaps too spicy for this dish (and I appreciate spice)

name: Shwarma House Indian Food Truck
reviews: The menu and service were ahead of my expectations. I really liked the atmosphere of this place. Great place to take my family out for dinner.
Awesome food. The chicken Tikka over fragrant rice is out of he world. Ask the server to add extra green chutney. Goes well with the Tikka.

This is by far the best platter I have ever had, and I have had them all. Halal Guys can’t touch this gem.

I got my orders special and they always were on point. Here’s how I ordered it.

Seasoned basmati rice, extra meat which I asked them to do well done and crispy on the griddle, then he would shake on some seasoning 🧂, white sauce, hot sauce,  green chutney, then he topped it off with pickled minced jalapeños and then sprinkled some crispy fried onions on it. Lettuce, onions, cucumbers and tomatoes would be on the side. Top off with a cold soda to wash it down. Too bad there are no beds to nap on afterwards.

When the lockdown it over and NYC opens back up, I and goin to take a day off work to go here....
The food is constantly fresh and yummy, employees hands out good service. I loved how neat it is and mood. Will come visit again.
Absolutely a place worth visiting, the food is great and well prepared, the prices are reasonable and it is constantly well organized here. Keep up the good work.

name: AC Lounge
address: 151 Maiden Ln, New York, NY 10038, USA
reviews: Let’s start off with the good. Great and cute spot, the service is great, the drinks are great... I loved the old fashioned on draft. It was delicious. It is on the expensive side, not sure if it was with it. We tried to order churros but the frier wasn’t working. Definitely not a spot to grab a cheap drink.
Great Old Fashioned

name: Neapolitan Express
address: Water St &, Old Slip, New York, NY 10005, USA

name: Luckyim Thai
address: Hanover Square, New York, NY 10004, USA
reviews: I really love their food. I always get awesome service here. The place is always clean and the cashiers are always super nice. Will visit here again.
Great food truck. All the food is hot, delicious, and made to order. I caught them on 46th st. and will definitely get lunch from them again in the future.
One of my preferred spots to grab something to eat. convenient location, well kept, and good customer service. I highly recommend them!
This was amazing Thai food at a ridiculously amazing price.  Further, the service was also great. Overall the best Thai place I've been to! Definitely recommend!!!!!
Used to be good but now the quality is low bad, ordered  Pad Thai with Chicken and the chicken is hard to eat, end up everything go to my trash and wasting my time and money.

name: Adel's Halal Food
address: 145 Front St, New York, NY 10038, USA
reviews: Adel's is a step above the rest. I usually get the chicken over spicy rice and he'll throw in eggplant and a falafel ball. Dudes are super friendly and know my usual order. Better flavor than Halal guys by far
One of my fav places to get chicken over rice and better than halal guys any given day
Really good street food! The falafel are the best I've had from a cart. Even the rice is incredibly fragrant and delicious. Everything's a steal at $5. Keep it coming, guys!
This is a hidden gem in FIDI. Guys are always friendly, food is and tasty. For 5$ you get a huge plate of meet, salad and rice.
Wow.  This is no joke.  One of best chicken rice in FiDi.

name: Genco Futures Inc
address: 110 Wall St #25, New York, NY 10005, USA

name: Parks Dog Run
address: FDR Dr, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: Beautiful little dog park that is neglected by the city, almost never cleaned, water hoses are taken away in the winter In order not to freeze, but the park is situated under the FDR so it’s really clean.During the summertime the city says they clean it once a day, but they don’t.
Nicely maintained dog run. Needs some upkeep and repairs however. Only run around that doesn't have 2 parts.... One for large dogs and one for small pups.
This place was awesome. Large and super clean park.
It's super cute.
Need a consistent cleaning schedule.

name: Dog Park East River Esplanade South
address: South, E River Esplanade, New York, NY 10016, USA
reviews: Amazing place to come and bring you furry K9 friend for a much needed walk. Your dog can interact with other wonderful dog owners here, as well as their K9 friends. This place is also perfect for a romantic walk along the waterfront. It provides a wonderful view of the two bridges. Not Two Bridges the neighborhood, but the two bridges of the area, the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges. As well as a wonderful view of the East River and DUMBO Brooklyn (Downtown).
From out of town and preferred this dog park to the fish bridge dog park, felt like there was a little more space to run around and a little more for my dog to interact with.

The dog park is fine. All dogs are playful here and behaved. Just a warm reminder, if you see a lady and tell you she is the manager of the dog park , IGNORE HER. This is a public dog park owned by NYC gov, there is nothing such as a “manager”. I met that lady twice and one time she just yelled at me said she was the manager, she doesn’t want to see me and my dog here anymore. A VERY RUDE AND AGGRESSIVE “manager”? I have been going to this dog park for almost a year, everything is nice here besides the “manager” lady. My friends : you are all welcome to walk your dog and let them play here, nobody is legal to kick you out! 

(Btw, if that lady see my post, next time when ya yelled at me, I am going to call the local police, you are very rude and racist )
Good park, wish there was some pebbles so dogs wouldn’t slip on the concrete.
Clean, running water from hoses to clean up or refill the dog bowls, a bridge a house, great place to let your dog run and play.

name: Manahatta Park
address: Front St &, Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA

name: The Fulton
address: 89 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA
reviews:
Menu has moderate selection, excellent views
Service was better than expected. 
Food was good,  but could use a bit more delicate touch on the fish. 
We had the cod,  which was a bit overcooked and
The fish stew which had excellent broth but fish that was over.  
Would repeat

Pier 17 has really come back with a vigor. The Fulton offers incredible views, quaint atmosphere, and delicious food. My only complaint is that he service didn’t match the price or the atmosphere are servers weren’t very attentive. I would still recommend The Fulton for date nights, celebrations, or as a nice place to grab dinner with friends.

The Fulton is an amazing seafood destination! The first time I went, I had the salmon. I honestly think their salmon is the best I’ve ever had. The herb-crust is unbelievable. When I came back again I convinced most of my party to also get the salmon and they loved it too. The mussels are good and so is the shrimp cocktail but the standout appetizer is the soft shell crab - it is phenomenal. And don’t miss the strawberry dessert!

Spectacular view.  Beautiful restaurant and great food.  If you can get it sit on the second floor. The view can’t be matched. The seafood is delicious. The sword fish is lightly crusted and moist. Shrimp are flavorful. Nothing but good things to say.

One of the best meals I’ve had in a quite a while. I absolutely love seafood, and if you do to this place is for you. An absolutely spectacular room with views of both bridges and the water. Lovely and cozy warm lighting and a super friendly and cool waitstaff. The lobster dish, which comes with a hefty price tag, is so well worth it and delicious it blew my mind. Just go!

name: Terraza Hotel 1
reviews: Cannot speak for the food, but if the drinks are any indication, not a good bar. My guess is folks are here for the view (which is spectacular), but the drinks are watered down, (or if beer) lukewarm and served in plastic ware. Staff was nice enough, but anything more than "gram-worthy" views is what you're looking for, look elsewhere.

name: Brooklyn Bridge Park
reviews: Well, there's no shortage of words to describe this absolute beast of a monument. Contrary to the pictures everyone posts from up on it, I'm opting to post pictures from night below and around it. Be it romantic, memorable, jaw dropping, be it anything Brooklyn bridge delivers. I'll let the professionals and the photogenics post pictures from up top, while I'll give those who prefer aesthetics a view of what they could click. Banger of a place and if you're up for it, you could even dip your feet or hands in the chilling waters at night. This is the place to be at!

Probably the largest park in Brooklyn; it has everything with basketball courts on one pier and a turf soccer field on another. You can even access it from two ferry stops. A great place to just chill by the water with fantastic, up-close views of lower Manhattan! Time-Out Market is so close on the North side of the park with great food options.

Amazing view of the Manhattan, especially at nights! The park is open till 9/10 pm and has a bunch of sport activities that one can engage. It's the perfect spot for any occasion, especially on warm nights. If you come by car, just know that you will have to pay $2 for every hour spent at the designated parking area. It only accepts cards, no cash. This also has a great view of both Brooklyn and Manhattan bridge and if you walk a bit further, there are picnic tables as well as benches along the park.

Love this park. Almost always over crowded and hectic but still nice to hangout with the kids, take a walk through, and enjoy the scenery. Wish the few stops with food and drinks weren't extremely expensive but that's gentrified Dumbo for you. Still would recommend.

Beautiful park worth exploring. It's great to see the iconic bridge up close. I wish we had time to walk/jog across but the drive is beautiful too. You can feel the energy change as you cross into Manhattan. The park itself is wide open offering the best skyline views imaginable. This park a selfie backdrop moment waiting to happen! There's also a museum and lots of restaurants and shops nearby.

name: Harbor View Lawn
reviews: Probably the best place to enjoy the skyline, a treat for photographers.
We went there for a movie with the view and liked it! They had everything well organized and maintained.
Nice place to view the water. Off in the distance you can see the statue of liberty. And rite beside you the bridge.
Beautiful place for a walk!
Good

name: Park
address: Brooklyn Bridge Park Greenway, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: Great place to fly a kite

Little charming park.
*****
It's a park
nice place

name: Ann's Warehouse
reviews: I didn't get to see a show, but there was an interesting gallery set up.

name: Pier 1 Salt Marsh
reviews:
Nice, clean, and peaceful. Stunning views of the water and of the city.
*****

name: Old Pier 1
reviews: This is a beautiful little spot you want to remain as it is with not too many people knowing about it, a hidden gem! Such a great view of Manhattan and not too many people around usually so you can enjoy it peacefully! Was here around 2am in November for around an hour and a half and didn't see a single soul! Bliss!!!
Such an underrated place for the view of NYC skyline. Less crowded and dozens of seagulls flying around you. Beautiful evenings have to revolve around this place, hands down

This old pier on Brooklyn Bridge Park was abandoned however the pillars are still visible and above the water. Outstanding place for sunset pics of Manhattan. Space for tripods is limited so come like an hour before sunset to get a spot. This hidden corner is like 20 mins walk from Brooklyn Bridge. Highly recommended!!
Great place to spend a delightful evening and get some great shots of the skyline

One of every photographer's dream shooting spot in if there are in New York. Here you will have a New York City Skyline view on lower manhattan side. 

Tip: To avoid hassle get here early before golden hours for best spot to shoot, this will give you enough time to scout for best composition. Many photographers visit this place during evening hours.

#PhotographyNYC #ShootingLocationNYC #ShootingSpotNYC

name: Brooklyn Bridge Park Outdoor Ping Pong Tables by POPP
reviews: Okurrrrt

name: The River Café
reviews:
We had a gift card for this restaurant and booked a table via a third party seating app, which didn't mention anything about the dress code. Turns out our smart casual attire on the day we showed up wasn't good enough to get us in. The receptionists didn't turn us away, but offered a selection of coats to complete our attire. We walked inside and were instantly treated like pariah by the head wait staff. When we asked to be moved to a table by the window, he smugly refused, because it's only for 'appropriately dressed' guests. That really ruined it for us. We were so looking forward to a dinner with a view.

The rest of the wait staff were pleasant and attentive, and the food was delicious, though not exceptional. We ended our meal with a surprise treat they gave us in celebration of our anniversary. After the hefty value in our gift card was applied to the bill, we still had to pay almost $300.

Pretty sure we won't be back. We're not the dress-to-the-nines type, and in fact shun the pretentiousness of it all. I understand that they can set and enforce all the rules they want and appreciate the gesture of the receptionists to make us look 'presentable'. But if you're a restaurant that calls yourself a 'cafe' and is housed in an average-looking boat without any historic or cultural significance, that specific rule really sounds ridiculous.

Photo is of their signature dessert, the Chocolate Brooklyn Bridge! Delicious!
Came at the end of a delicious vegetarian fixed price meal. Expensive for the vegetarian meal however. Beautiful location, we were relocated to a table overlooking the bridge. Service was absolutely amazing, a must go to restaurant!!

Located in iconic and picturesque Dumbo, Brooklyn, The River Cafe has all of the makings of a truly upper class dining experience. They require reservations months in advance and formal dining attire. The staff were all pleasant and the service is top notch. Food was on par with most up scale restaurants. Though the overall ambience, service, and presentation was impressive, it's still  very difficult to justify the $$$$$ price tag

I celebrated my birthday today in this great restaurant. I am glad to say that we passed a enjoyable evening and the restaurant was evidently one of the reasons for the fruitful event. The stuff  helped in a splendid style, the cooking was yummy and my friends were so  happy. We shall no dout return for more joyful events. Thank you very much.

I had a fantastic experience here! First of all, the ambiance is incredible. When we first got the the dining room, there was a wait to be seated, so we decided to go to the outdoor space they had on the water. We took pictures there with Manhattan in the background, which I would certainly recommend doing. Eventually, we were seated and brought a complimentary appetizer to hold us over until our first course arrived. I ended up having the buffalo ravioli as my first course, and it turned out great! The mushrooms that were paired with the ravioli were really good as well. For my main course, I had the steak. Lucky for me, the steak was 12 oz. which is huge, and it was also cooked perfectly and tasted great. I would definitely recommend the steak to anyone who plans on coming here. For my dessert I had the chocolate cake, and my friend had the guava goat cheese cheesecake. As much as I loved the cake, and the Brooklyn Bridge that came with it, I think I favored the guava cheesecake. Overall, the service was pretty good, too. If you do end up going, I’d recommend taking pictures in the garden out front, as well as on their “dock;” they won’t let you down! As a side note, I must mention that they do have a jacket requirement for the gentlemen in the dining room. If you forget to bring one, I believe they will loan you one for the night though.

name: Juliana's
address: 19 Old Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: Cute decor. Pretty delicious pizza. Decent prices. Quick turn around. Our main waiter, not at all attentive...the other young server helping him out, very involved..so it balanced out on par. Don't know if I have to go back here again, but not sorry that I visited once.

I'm no New York style pizza expert but this was an awesome first experience. I had a Margherita pizza which was made in a matter of minutes and came out to me bubbling! I was fortunate enough to sit at the bar and watch the team assemble and fire the pizza in the coal fired oven. It looked pretty legit to me. As far as the taste goes it was simple, rustic and delicious. The sauce was lightly spread around between the slices of mozzarella, sprinkled with oregano and topped with fresh basil. The crust was thin but still had a good chew. It reminds me of pizza in Italy except, I hate to admit it, better.

The pizza was good. The line was long and although we really liked the food I think we had similar quality with less of a wait. Would recommend but only if you have some extra time. Family style pizza.

Stumbled upon Juliana’s after noticing the famous Grimaldi’s was closed by 1:30pm.  I’m glad we did as it was possibly the best Pizza I’ve ever eaten!!! It had a crispy base and the perfect amount of sauce, cheese and peppers.  The restaurant was warm and the servers were friendly.  My only critique is the tiny coke shooters that you get when ordering a beverage..  Everything else was world class!👌

Best Pizza EVER. The freshest, I could eat the whole pizza and feel light as a feather! Not greasy, and just wholesome. The chefs greeted us outside the restaurant and we were seated. Beautiful atmosphere and hospitality. 10/10 would recommend over other places definitely!!!

name: Ferry Market
address: 20 Old Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: This man has reinvented the hot dog !!! Amazing explosion of favors in you're mouth , Well worth the price whatever he's charging . I haven't been there in a while but I've yet to eat anything there that I didn't like . Come hungry sample all . Well worth you braking your diet for . A+
Food is decent but unremarkable for the price.   Service is very attentive however and friendly.

name: Jack the Horse Tavern
reviews: The Oyster Room is a fave for happy hour. Best old fashioned drinks. Nice and strong and for cheap. Nice food as well. We usually get the fries and a friend bought the Mac and cheese. Amazing.  It's a small room. Come early.

Jack the Horse Tavern is an old North Heights standby, but somehow we had never gotten ourselves there. Last night, we finally went, and found it to be quite good. The staff was very friendly, and the dishes ranged from good to better than that. Particular standouts were the Berkshire pork chop, the risotto, and the sweet potato pie.  We'll be back.
I highly recommend their brunch. Their hours are a bit limited, they open at 5pm on weekdays, but their brunch starts relatively early on Sundays and the food is always on point.
Long time favourite. Love everything about this spot. The mashed potatos are ridiculous as well as the trout salad as well as their oyster bar around the corner

Limited but great  menu for meat eaters and vegetarians alike. Really nice atmosphere, can have a conversation over meal. Wheel chair accessible and they were very accommodating in finding the best table for us.

name: 7 Old Fulton
address: 7 Old Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: Interesting place! The steak was perfect, the spaghetti with meatballs not so good but overall everything was fine.

Very bad experience. Menu says steak with French fries and vegetables but the server told us they don't have that but he will fixe it just for us ,well you just trying to take "fake" give us extra sir service , same goes for my lamb shank that was pretty good. We ordered medium steak but we got chewy well done with one piece of every vegetable, wine wasn't good at all. Also for appetizers we ordered crab cakes and it was a disaster,frozen boxed ONE Crab cake,with huge pieces of lettuce. Never going back,this is a beautiful place with potential to be good if managed right but most important is Food ,it has to be good!

Worst service I have ever experienced. We were gonna order drinks and Dessert after our main dish but we got thrown out of the restaurant because new guests have been waiting. So when I refused to pay an overpriced tip I was told to be grateful to be allowed to eat here and that there are not my slaves. So ridiculous.
I've never seen anything so brazen. We were really upset..

The best service and amazing food!! My husband ordered pasta and  it was fantastic. I ordered fish it was delicious. The best service and food for a nice lunch or dinner. It was our anniversary and we had a great time.
Very good service 👍, food is excellent, very flavored, good portions

name: GRAN ELÉCTRICA
reviews: Great Tacos and a lovely portico where you can relax and enjoy their wide variety of drinks. Would definitely recommend for a lazy summer afternoon.

Been waiting to try this place after seeing some decent reviews. This is definitely a bit of a tourist trap the prices are astronomical given the portions. Good vibe inside which is redeeming. Margarita was overly sweet. Wouldn’t rush back here unless the patio was open.

A great Mexican restaurant for brunch in the Brooklyn bridge area, a very nice patio setting. The brunch menu has a bit of everything and it would satisfy your desires for authentic Mexican flavors. Their variety of margaritas is just wonderful, staff is friendly and helpful. A real Mexican treat in the heart of Brooklyn.

We loved this small restaurant! The trendy vibe was in line with the DUMBO neighborhood, and the tin ceiling was amazing. There is a small bar, then two dining areas, both of which have lots of natural light. The interior is modern, and the wallpaper is themed, and continues even into the bathroom hand dryer (love the inclusive bathrooms!) . The food was good, and I really wish I'd gotten the ceviche (next table had it and said it was excellent).  We'll be back to try more!

The food was tasty but not worth the price tag, I paid $14 for tacos and $12 for empanadas when it really should've been $4 lower for both - you're more paying for atmosphere than anything else, but experience was average overall

name: Luke's Lobster Brooklyn Bridge Park
