reviews: After a long walk in NY me and my wife were hungry and found Luke's by accident. I was in doubt because lobster rolls are usually pricey but not at Luke's, so we gave it a chance and surprise! They are really good for the price. Fresh lobster and bun. Great place for a quick snack!

Could be considered a little expensive but it is one of those very unique and rather special ‘New York’ experiences that is worth the price. The food is nice and the menu although limited is very appropriate for what the place stands for. I went in winter when the few seats inside the restaurant were a sanctuary from the cold and the warm food was like manna to my freezing, weary soul. A delicious meal followed by a walk around the area for some iconic views of the city is quite priceless in my humble opinion. Definitely recommended.

I visited this place because of the fantastic view of the Brooklyn Bridge and it was not disappointing. But the lobster roll was everything I imagined it would be; so soft and buttery. Just wow. I try to visit different sites each time I visit NYC, but I will be returning to Luke's Lobster every visit no doubt. Thanks for existing!

I had a lobster and crab roll. The rolls are a tad pricey but I must admit they were delicious. I would definitely eat at this location again when I’m in town. Customer service was outstanding. I highly recommend this location.

We ordered their winter special Lobster Combo (lobster Mac & cheese) and Luke’s Trio (with clam chowder)....and it made our taste buds dance. 

Price is what you would expect for fresh quality seafood in a lovely location with spectacular views of the Brooklyn Bridge. The gentleman who served us today was top-notch. Definitely hard to beat their awesome customer service. Thanks for the Kodak moment ;)

name: Noodle Pudding
reviews: Great Italian food and service. We had a large party and the staff was very accommodating. I had the lasagna which was excellent, and a very good portion. My wife had the eggplant ravioli which she raved about. It a busy restaurant, so reservations are suggested.

Great and easy to access neighborhood restaurant serving up homey rustic Italian classics. Fairly straightforward and approachable food and wine menu. Service is hospitable and all staff are very attentive. Food is well executed and delicious, and much comparable to a typical family-style Italian restaurant.

Antonio, the chef-owner, does a fabulous job ensuring each delectable dish is done right. 
Be aware it is cash only. It is a very popular place so either arrive early 5-6:00 PM or be prepared to wait. 
Everything I have eaten here has been very tasty. There is a good wine list but the house red wine is fine and very inexpensive at $5 a glass or $15 for a bottle.
They make their own pasta. Whole wheat or gluten free pasta can be ordered for a small extra charge.
The only negative is that it tends to get noisy.

Great location with a vibrant environment and amazing food. This has a very friendly, cozy energy with prompt service. Expect a wait during peak hours but there’s a bar to savor a drink before getting seated. Solid wine selection. Great for solo dining to large groups.

We finally made it here for dinner after living in a Dumbo for 3 years. Loved it. The wait staff are awesome, vibe is classic Italian, and the food was super good. The seafood risotto was the best risotto I’ve ever had.

name: Lizzmonade
address: Brooklyn Bridge, Bridge Park Drive, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: Lemonade was the perfect addition to a stroll along the park on a hot summers day! Mango iced tea + Strawberry/pineapple/mint tizzy.
Loved the refreshing drink. Little overpriced for lemonades. Worth a try!
Delicious beverages. Expensive but its your only choice at the park. Still worth it but I think everyone needs a heads up.
Great views, but unfortunately we came late, so the bar was closed.
Sit back and have a beer whilst relaxing in a beach chair and sinking your toes into the sand. Slightly overpriced beers and short pool season, ergo the 4 stars.

name: Shake Shack
address: 1 Old Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: Good Burgers. Prices seemed to be decent for NYC. I didn't like the fries though that much. I was in Shake Shack near Brooklyn Bridge. I'd recommend eating in nearby Time Out Market instead for a bigger variety of food.

I celebrated my birthday today in this great restaurant. happy to tell that we had a marvelous evening and the place was clearly the reason for the happy event. The stuff  collaborated in a gorgeous style, the meals were appetizing and my guests were so  overjoyed. We shall surely return for more celebrations. thanks very much.

First time to eat the Shack shack! There is no place to eat in the restaurant. So we take out to the park to enjoy the burger. It’s so delicious! The beef burger is really juicy!! And the strawberry milkshakes is also great!!!!
I personally love Shake Shack and all its variety. I have always received good service. French fries are one of my favorites. If you go to the US you should try these highly recommended burger.
I love this Shake Shack! Its right by the Brooklyn Bridge. The only issue is the parking but if you are patient you will definitely find one!

name: Ignazio's
reviews: Most definitely the best pizza I’ve had in my entire life! We were walking by and the owner stopped us, he said come in and taste the best pizza in town! We were very skeptical, but went in anyway. We sat at the bar I had a delicious glass of wine for $11 and ordered a slice of pizza. That was the best pizza I have ever, ever had! A simple margarita pizza no frills but just all the taste.
Their pizza and chicken wrap are great! They have a bar inside. The ambience is cozy. They’re cash only. The view from here is amazing, ofc.

We were playing tourists in our own city when my fiance said he had to get a picture of this place cause his name is Ignazio too.  I said let's go in and eat.   We sat right away.  Simple menu.  Got a simple pizza.  Simple is always the best.   When we left we had a nice conversation with the owner.  They're from the same neighborhood in brooklyn go figure.  We will be back.

My wife and I had been meaning to stop by this place many times but something would always come up. Glad that we finally made it in. The service was fantastic. Great to see that the servers weren't stressed and still friendly, considering the place was pretty busy. We've been to many pizzerias here in NYC and this is instantly my wife's favorite pizza. I myself am more of a "mom n pop" pizza type but this was certainly some great gourmet pizza. The garlic bread was EXCEPTIONAL, as was the meatball hero. Gonna make sure to stop by here more often when we're in the neighborhood.
The staff and management were wonderful. The pizza was great! Very nice place.

name: Grimaldi's Pizzeria
reviews: A great no frills, sit down pizza restaurant. My girlfriend and I we're visiting the city and and trekked down after hearing good things from an old boss back home. Was not disappointed. Makes a great date spot, it looked like we were one of three dates there at the restaurant! Just remember to bring cash.

Delicious brick oven pizza! After a long day of walking and sight seeing it was the best place to end the night at. We got the 16" pizza half pepperoni and half cheese. Super yummy and fresh! Would definitely recommend. Prices very reasonable.

Good place to eat a pizza near the Brooklyn bridge. 
Also nice views to the bridge from second floor. Good quality, huge pizzas, very nice staff and reasonable prices. 
The pepperoni pizza we ordered was delicious. 
Definitely a must go in NYC.
Famous for a reason. Pizza is great and service is outstanding. The line looks longer than it is; it moves by fast. Recommend if you want an "authentic" Dumbo experience.

Such delicious pizza!!! My brother lived in New York City for years, and suggested that we go here. We were lucky to get in with little to no wait. The pizza was such a perfect meal to eat before walking around for hours. I would highly recommend this place to all! ♥️🥰

name: Miso
reviews: Pretty standard sushi / Japanese food spot. Small menu, for non-sushi items, but decent selection of sushi rolls. The staff was also very pleasant. It’s a very low-key and non-pretentious spot nestled in the middle of DUMBO.
Really cold sushi. Pad thai noodles was too saucy. Large hot sake just filled 4 cups. Hope you are lucky if you visit here and get out healthy.

This restaurant is my first choice restaurant.  Of all restaurants I know I love it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to that place. when  I feel like having a fair lunchon, this restaurant comes straight to my head. extremely good and   food and a large list of dishes.helpful staff, and pleasant ambience. Also important, the pay is fair. I sent my friends to this spot with great pleasure.
Awesome. Awesome Volcano roll, Samurai roll, Salmon avocado roll (sushis) and (less) spicey seafood soup! First time and best experience. Recommended 😊💖

Didn't let my pregnant wife to the bathroom!
My wife asked to use the bathroom as a non customer. They didn't let her go even she's pregnant and clearly mentioned this!

name: Tutt Heights
reviews: Delicious food for a very affordable price. We loved the lentil soup and the Mediterranean dishes. Great location and atmosphere. We will come back!

The food here is delicious! I especially love the freshly baked pita! The chicken plate and mixed salads are two of my favorites. I never feel guilty after eating here. There are so many healthy options.

Everyone working in this restaurant was so kind and polite. The food was very good and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. When we went for lunch, it wasn't crowded at all, which was a nice change of pace. Highly recommend if you're looking for a nice Brooklyn restaurant away from all the noise.
Tasty food! Good portions and affordable prices. Pita was warm and very good. The meet has great spices. Recommend!
Best lamb chops I've ever had. Great staff. Owner was very hospitable and welcoming. Will come back next time I'm back in NY.

name: SUGARCANE raw bar grill
reviews: Really nice place to hangout with large group of people. They have really good sharing plates. Awesome sushi and others tapas like snacks to go with tasty cocktails. They have really good happy hour.  I’ve never been here for dinner but lunch and brunch menus are great! It’s also really spacious comparing to other places in neighborhood or NYC in general.

The good: service is good and attentive, food presentation is good, duck fried rice was tasty.
The bad: seating (at least for the row of tables with seating for two) is very cramped, the beef short rib was burnt to a crisp, and the crispy rice sushi was less tasty-crunchy-crispy and more left-overnight-on-the-counter crispy.
Overall, I expected a far better experience for the price paid. I can enjoy the same quality food and ambiance for 2/3 the price elsewhere.

A perfect place for sushi and drinks near the water. The strawberry basil cocktail is one of the best I've had, and the sushi was fresh and tasteful and so good. We ordered an assortment of dishes for the table and shared them all. Noteworthy are the chefs choice sushimi, goat cheese croquettes, crunchy tuna roll, and the Alaska king crab roll. All so good.

Good menu, raw bar was excellent. Service could have been a bit more informed. We had made reservations, still waited 20 minutes. Overall recommend the place and is in a great area for walking around before/after meal.

We  visited a couple of weeks ago. Party of 12!!! We had a great time. The ambiance and customer service was very good. We. the customers,.. were the best of the best!!!The food was delicious!! OMG!! the Duck and waffle with duck egg The appetizers was very good and filling. Erica did a great job!!! The bartender was very good as well. One of your workers assisted us in taking a few pics for us after dinner. Thank you, very courteous and attentive. I recommend and cant wait to come back!!!!

name: Plums
address: 14 Old Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: Fantastic vibes and super personal service. The meals were crisp and delightful. Will easily recommend this spot to my friends. Reasonable prices and large portions. Keep it up.
Norwegian Salmon with Cuscus. Looks pretty and delicious!
I highly recommend this place. The food is amazing and they have happy hour menu for drinks. The sangria is really good! The view (Brooklyn bridge) is also outstanding, especially during sunset.

Was so peacefully and quiet during the 3 on time on this Friday Valentine's that just passed . Food delicious just superb. Servers so cheerful and welcoming. Definitely posting on facebook telling my friends and I'm going back as well !

An amazing experience, from the moment my family and I   walked through the door to the moment we left. The appetizers were outstanding, the main dishes were all delicious and the desserts were out of this world. All of the staff members were attentive and polite. Would 10000% recommend this beautiful restaurant in this beautiful area to anyone.

name: Fulton Burger
address: 17 Old Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 10038, USA

name: The Oyster Room
address: 38 Cranberry St, Brooklyn Heights, NY 11201, USA

name: Avocaderia
reviews: Excellent location in Dumbo,the  menu is diverse,especially because it is made with avocado. I am from Mexico and I can completely recommend you to visit this place. Great job guys!
Food was delicious. Amazing staff.
Top! Best avocado restaurant in town, cozy atmosphere and great people! A must stop!
I visit Avocaderia every time I happen to be in NY: it's my fav place in town for quick lunches/breaks! Both healthy and tasty, the avo burger and avo toast are def a must try!
The best avo toast ever!

name: Mr Taka
reviews: SO good. I’ve tried a lot of ramen spots from around the world, including Japan, and Mr Taka Ramen ranks very, very high on my list. It almost dethrones my favorite ramen restaurant because it is that good. Also, it’s reasonably priced compared to the other vendors at Time Out Market. A win-win eat!

This was the most disappointing bowls of ramen I’ve ever had. I ordered the black garlic tonkotsu spicy with an egg. The broth was bland, it was t spicy at all, the egg was over cooked and cold, 1 piece of pork, and way too much filler ingredients. The bowl was so full of the filler ingredients (mushrooms,sesame seeds, sprouts etc) you could hardly get any broth. They served it with a regular spoon, so that didn’t help. And it wasn’t hot! I prefer my food pipping hot it was warm. For $20 it is not worth it
Decent ramen but bit expensive to try in timeout market.

name: Fish Cheeks
reviews: Located inside Timeout market. Clean and flavorful food but quantity is bit less for $ paid
$22 shrimp pad thai not worth it, have had much better at several thai places around the city like Pam Real Thai, Esanation, Wondee Siam, etc.

name: Little Ada
reviews: Pretty good! Had the Chicken Shawarma, which came very fresh and quick. Although I have to say that I ate shawarma more aromatic and niftier, it was a very nice lunch for a very reasonable 16$.
We got the chicken shawarma and it was fantastic. Portions were big for a reasonable price. Def going back.
Best hummus I’ve ever hade. The market is an amazing vibe. The staff was super friendly and helpful!

What a disappointment. Humus does not taste the way is supposed to ! Tabule comes with cilantro ( is this a latin tabule ? ) Please ro no try the humus cauliflower because God knows why it is sweet !! Disgusting 🤢🤮  waste of money

I ordered sabich and still am unsure of what I was served. Horribly spiced with missing ingredients for a dish that is certainly not what it’s supposed to be. Plus, everything was served very cold. Don’t waste your money- if you want Israeli food go to Breads Bakery stand next door.

name: Bklyn Wild
reviews: The quesadillas was very delicious! I have been vegan for about 2 months. The cheese was so good. I really thought I was eating cheese from a cow. It was soft and gooey like “real” cheese.
Great vegan food. Lots of spice and flavor.
The only vegan place in Time Out Market. Quite pricey and could be better.
Vegan chorizo mac and cheese. SO GOOD!!!

name: Juliana's
reviews: 30mins to bake a pizza and remember they don’t have drinks, only pizza (their own words)
Pizza deliciosa. Fecha cedo, umas 20:30 já avisaram que não iam mais receber pedidos.

Es un lugar muy bonito y acogedor. Las pizzas están muy ricas. Buen servicio.
Es un poco caro, pero en la línea normal de los precios de Nueva York

name: Loco Coco
reviews: Awesome service, GREAT food and such a FUN vibe! This smoothie and smoothie bowl cafe is located inside Timeout Market. I ordered my smoothie bowl in a pineapple! It was perfect for sharing and so refreshing for the summer. The place is also 100% vegan. Everything was fresh! Will most definitely come back soon!

Very rude staff. I asked for no banana in my parfait. When I saw him adding banana, I said, "Excuse me, I asked for no banana. I'm allergic." He rudely replied and said, "That should've been the first thing you told me." I canceled my order immediately so I can't comment on the food. I understand I have food allergies and I need to make sure I keep myself safe, but considering this place is known for making random combinations, it should be expected to leave a random fruit out here and there without being scolded. Don't take this the wrong way but...screw this place.
The green smoothie we ordered was refreshing and tasted great
It's Friday 6pm and came from Queens to Dumbo just to try an açai bowl and it's CLOSED!!!

name: Almondine Bakery
reviews: Small bakery with great selection of pastries and cakes. We ordered salmon and broccoli quiche, which was yummy. Eclair was ok, I tried better ones. Strawberry cake was delicious. I would definitely recommend this place to my friends.

Absolutely love this place. They have hands down the best chocolate croissants in the city-the only ones that taste exactly like the ones in France. The staff is awesome, and anything you buy there is homemade that day. Highly recommend

I was really disappointed with this place (its overrated). Very tiny inside, dim and uncozy. I tried 3 different dessert options and everything was too sweet and taste not fresh. Quality of cappuccino is so so. Will I recommend this place? No, definitely not. Maybe if you walking in Brooklyn Promenade btw two famous bridges in summer time - you can grab something with yourself, but not dessert please - overpriced for no reason.

Fresh baked pastries and sandwiches. I really liked the pastries are not greasy or too sweet. We had quiche (excellent) and chocolate croissant (hint of chocolate). 
Very comfortable atmosphere and reasonable to sit down and relax.
Everything is simply superb. Refined. First class. 2 thumbs up.

name: Alice's Tea Cup To Go
reviews:
Interior design: 10/10
Customer service: 10/10
Food: 5
Price: 7
 
Absolutely love the interior design, very chill vibe in there with the lighting and the furnitures. Friendly staff. The food at the place is not all that though. They could make it tastier. Had scones and a chicken sandwich. The vegan chocolate scone was my favorite. The sandwich was very; very dry. For the flavor of the food price should go a little lower. Would recommend to go check it out at least once.

Please like the review if it was helpful 😁

Cute place to relax for a bit if you’re lucky enough to get a seat! Decent coffee, nice tea selections! 
Food and baked goods not as extensive as Alice’s marvelous branches in the city; still yummy and interesting! 
Love their strawberry jam and home~made clotted cream!
Super cute place. We happened upon in walking from the metro to Brooklyn Bridge. Super fast. Good pastries. Love the vibe.
Wonderful coffee, wonderful cakes. Find it and you won't be disappointed. As an added bonus the streets around Alice's are a joy if you are not from the US. Take pics. Drink coffee. Walk. X

This adorable little café on a corner in northern Brooklyn Heights is so perfect on this rainy Sunday. Via the foodforall app, I picked up two tasty scones with cream and jam, and I only paid fraction of the original price. I feel especially lucky about the sweet deal because the app is running a Halloween special, where if you make a purchase of sweet items, you get five dollars credit. So in my world, this means that I’m actually getting paid to eat. One of them is vegan, which makes it even better.

name: Butler
reviews: Excellent food, great fast service, warm & gorgeous coffee drinks on a super cold day! We were lucky to snag a hightop table for 7 people. Highly recommend stopping here for breakfast or a snack while seeing some of the sights in Brooklyn!

Discovered that this place is donating 100% of profits from the sale of their flat whites to Australian bushfire relief. Thank you so much from 2 grateful Australians!
Oh and the coffee was great too!

Update: thanks for the explanation! Good to know, we'll be back in that case.
Original review: Please tell me why your oatmeal is not gluten free? Gluten free options are extremely limited for breakfast, please fix this.
Nice service. The place looks beautiful. My  acai bowl was pretty good and it had fresh fruit added on top.

Cozy, cute atmosphere. Visited from Ontario Canada and was so pleased with the food and drink! Loved my oat latte. I'll be back for a toque soon!! (The girl at the cash was so confused by my question of how much the toques were until she realized that they call them beanies, haha.)

name: Breads Bagelry
reviews: They forgot my order, I had to go back after seeing other people getting the order. Also the Pizza bagel was very basic. Tomato, cheese and 4 olives. Could do much better. Not the tastier for the price paid!
Took 15 minutes for a plain bagel with cream cheese. And it's not that good.

name: Breads Bakery
reviews: My goodness. I bought a little apple strudel in this place, got charged more than $10 (price wasn't displayed) and the thing was dry and tasted burnt. I don't often write negative reviews, but frankly this is a rip-off. Don't go there! Prices are three times what they ought to be.

Their Chocolate Babka can make you slap yourself. Beyond delectable❗Trader Joe's is cheap & very good. However, Breads Bakery, higher priced, 20 X better quality, taste, texture... So, worth every cent😎
The Oats cookies was delicious!
Leckerer Kaffee, aber preislich über dem Standard

name: Jacques Torres
reviews: Very delicious hot chocolate and a well made cafe latte as well. The chocolate cookies and short bread are amazing. Great taste and so many things to see in the store. The server was very friendly and helpful explaining what was available and tempting us with more goodies. A highly enjoyable experience.
Great little shop full of chocolate creations, from hot/iced cocoa drinks, to cookies, to ice cream.  Right near the Brooklyn Bridge and Park and several other niche stores.

I love this place, their ice cream and the location for enjoying a nice cup of coffee with a chocolate treat. But sadly, they have stopped making their pure chocolate cookie, a sad decision for us who were fans. Their chocolate chip cookie is still good but not the same experience. We still  Hope to visit again next time in NYC and find New surprises...
Hot Chocolate taste good! But I’d recommend to get the small one since the large is way to much. It doesn’t seem to be so large but the chocolate is really thick!
Best hot chocolate! It is usually not too busy even though it is in a very touristic area. Their ice cream is pretty good too. A must visit in the winter if you are around.

name: Truman Capote's House
reviews: The designs were very interesting.  Kitchen was my favorite.  Was alot smaller than I expected
Don't expect anything special. A nice house in Brooklyn

Lol. Capote never owned this house, it was owned by Oliver Smith, a well known broadway set designer that once lived in and was influenced by “The February House”, a queer home for artists that was once located at 7 Middagh street. (It is no coincidence that Truman Capote was also gay). Smith rented out many rooms to aspiring queer artists. Capote is said to have written both “Breakfast at Tiffany’s” and “In Cold Blood” while staying at the house.
great neighborhood

Truman Capote's House est un site historique où vécu pendant 10 ans Capote Truman. C'est un écrivain américain et auteur de romans, de nouvelles, de reportages, de portraits, de récits de voyages, de souvenirs d'enfance, ainsi que de deux adaptations théâtrales et de deux scénarios de films.

name: Empire Fulton Ferry Park
reviews: This is one of my favorite places in the world. It's so gorgeous I proposed to my wife here. The view of the Manhattan Bridge, Manhattan Bridge and Manhattan skyline is incredible. Amazing photo opportunities

Beautiful place to take photographs. Nice place for picnic. Magnificent views of skyline.The Empire–Fulton Ferry section of the park is 4.5 acres (1.8 ha) of waterfront parkland that is directly adjacent to Main Street to the west. It connects to Pier 1 to the south. This part of the park was formerly a state park, but was incorporated into Brooklyn Bridge Park. It contains a lawn with picnic areas, as well as a promenade facing the East River.[150] Two Civil-War era structures, the Tobacco Warehouse and Empire Stores, are also located on the site; both are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

Great place to check out the new York City skyline either day or big. Great shots of the bridge after exploring the restaurants or shops in the area.. Make sure to allow enough time to find parking because it can definitely take many passes around before you can get something. Recommended for spending time at water or to take pics of the skyline

Excellent for capturing beautiful pictures of the Brooklyn bridge! And surrounding areas. 

Very nice view of the river and the luxurious building in NYC. 

Nice to go for a walk or sit down and relax especially if you’ve just had something to eat or if you have just walked over the Brooklyn bridge

More pictures like this on Instagram search: Thishan.rv

I love it here! So much to do and see. I’m a photographer and I never get tired to photographing this place. It’s great to get everything “New York” here. Street shots, NY skyline shots, shots of the bridges, the parks, it’s just full of life! Always a good time hanging out there for sure!

name: Hillside Dog Park
reviews:
SUCH HILL
MUCH PICNIC TABLE
MANY DOGGO

this park is a gem! i currently count at least FIFTY doggos here and it doesn’t even begin to feel full. it’s next to a highway so meh but it’s also on a hill so the view of the park is perfect from anywhere. there’s even a teeny tiny corral on the side i guess if a pup needs a time out? anyways, a+ this park is great worth the trek out here.

A great dog park but don't go when the dog walkers are there on weekdays. 
One walker tried to hit my dog for sniffing one of the (more than 10) dogs that she and her group had with them. Another (from another company) was almost physically aggressive with an owner because the walker wasn't paying attention to the dog she had with her and the owner's dogs barked at it. 
Other than a few non-regulars, most of the owners are responsible, close the gates properly, and keep an eye on their dogs. The amount of space is great and there're a lot of interesting plants and trees to entertain your dog. In the summer it's really nice.

We take our 13 pound dog from the LES over on the weekends and we have been happy thus far. It’s a nice, open dog park right off the bridge. The times we’ve been there, there were around 10+ dogs, all of whom have been friendly and there is enough space for all the dogs to run around freely. It’s located on a hill by a highway entrance, and two local roads so parking is challenging, but nice park given the location. We will be back!

Big space with benches under old tries. All kinds of dogs. Soil covered with wood chips makes your shoes stained in all kinds of weather,so just be ready and don't wear fancy shows. I liked the atmosphere.

Decently large dog park with seating areas and a water fountain for dog owners and a great deal of room for your loved one to run around and socialize with other dogs, with many on the weekend especially but not getting the feeling of too overcrowded. Seemed a little drab in terms of quality overall but other than that quite convenient in terms of place being nearby to the subways and ferry

name: Brooklyn Bridge Park - Pier 1
reviews:
It’s one of my favorite place to see a great downtown night view. Highly recommend go summer night season. Fall is also okay. Otherwise it’s very cold because of the wind. 
If you think you have so much stressed or looking for chill and relax. Come feel the wind of summer.

Perfect Skyline view!
A good place to be w/ his girlfriend, enjoy the view and take a deep breath! It is unbelievable just to watch the little boats in the front with the amazing buildings in the back! Wear a jacket it's getting windy here.
I love a visit to Brooklyn Bridge park.  The skyline view is amazing at any time of day.  Come early to miss hoards of people but it's good any time.  Absolutely serene and beautiful, easy to get to.
Cool spot for pictures with the Brooklyn bridge and the NYC skyline. Recommend stopping by here. Got a few good restaurants nearby as well.

Take the ferry, embark on your park adventure or have some food, ice cream or lemonade here. You really can't go wrong. It's beautiful...walk for a few minutes and you'll be treated to one of the rotating photographic exhibits.  A gem of the city.

name: Squibb Park
reviews: Very nice park for kids
Great place for kids to ride their bikes or roller skate. The bridge to Brooklyn Bridge Park is an ideal short cut from Brooklyn Heights.
Why is it taking so long to re-open the pedestrian bridge?
It's fine for skating at. Plenty of flat ground
Was a great day ,my children loved the tennis,would love to see other free activities as that.

name: Dog Run
reviews: Good one for 🐕
Huge dog park

name: Poplar Street Community Garden
reviews: This is a small members-only community garden. It's a nice green shield from the BQE. There are a limited number of plots so you need to get on the waitlist. The only complaint I have is that they sometimes dump their waste haphazardly on the street.
Place is so full!
lots of GREEN!

name: Fruit Street Sitting Area
reviews: Nice place, nice to sit there and enjoy the view.

I think it’s funny how I’ve been on the Promenade countless times, and I just stumbled on this serene little spot recently. I was walking two dogs, and they led me here, and it was a relaxing spot to catch our breath!

I've been catching short periods of peace on these tree shaded benches for decades. The view of the Manhattan skyline at dusk and a  very gentle sea (bay) breeze encourages quiet contemplation. And pretty good people watching!
World class view
Great views of the Manhattan skyline!

name: The Max Family Garden
address: 3-99 New Dock St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: Apparently the place to take romantic photos. It’s true that each of the wall windows were taken by mostly Asian “photographers” taking photos of their girlfriends. Otherwise it’s just a bring wall. Don’t spend there much time and continue along the river to see more places.
A very nice little garden with some chairs and tables with plenty of shade. It's well kept and usually quiet even when the area is crowded.
Beautiful little spot tucked away from everything else. It's kind of secluded so its unlikely that you would see too many people there making it a perfect spot for quiet/intimate meetings

Cute place next to the theater and close to the water. Has walking paths and places to sit. 

There is a fair amount of foot traffic so it's not super quiet
The nice small garden for your short relax. It's not too crowded.

name: Anchorage Plaza
reviews: Cool place to visit. Makes for a few awesome photo opportunities around the area too.
Drive thru on my way home from work. It's much better and developed than it looked in the 80's & 90's. Would be nice to enjoy, if I could afford to live here!
Great little spot to see the hustle and bustle going on in downtown Brooklyn
Amazing sights and views around to feast your eyes on.
It's hard to choose where to go. You got the water taxi. You got the brooklyn bridge or the park itself by the water with a bridge. With the city and river as a perfect picture selfie place.

name: Superfine
reviews: This one of the coolest places I have been too. They usually have some funky band playing and the atmosphere is great. The food is good too. The weird thing is I always end up sitting at the same spot at the bar. The other thing is that it is just up the street from one of the best views in the world.
Great spot in Dumbo for food and cocktails. Urban, character and good music. Will certainly be back on our return to Brooklyn.
Took my husband to this place to celebrate his birthday. The food and drinks are great. The waiter is so nice and gave my husband a lemon pie for his birthday. So kind.
We had a really nice brunch here. I ordered the enchiladas suizas and they were delicious. The service was great.
Very tasty restaurant. I usually hate fries but their fries were delicious. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone

name: Atrium DUMBO
reviews: Thank you so much for the personalization, attentiveness, and care put into my Easter dinner delivery. Everything was delicious. Looking forward to visiting once your doors re-open. Until then, be well. ❤️  - Paige

The service was exceptional. The food was excellent. The menu was limited and the menu that they have online was not accurate. The one person in our group who has food restrictions had difficulty finding something. She was counting on the offerings on their brunch menu online being what was offered in the restaurant. They were not.

Is a very nice restaurant with a romantic ambient. Dani, the server just came to NY from Boston. Welcome her to NY. Very pleasant and courteous service provided from every host there. Nice food. Very satisfied and glad my BF chose there to celebrate my birthday!!
took over an hour for my burger to come out and even then my order was wrong. flavor was average. not worth the money or wait.

I was on the whole30 and this restaurant had great options for my diet! Definitely get the duck, it's juicy and smokey. Tastes amazing! The potato wedge is classic and wholesome. Seafood platter is delicious! The ambiance and service was top notch. Cant wait to come back again!

name: Henry Street Ale House
reviews: This restaurant is my number one site.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to this restaurant. Whenever  I I need a superb dinner, this restaurant comes straight to my head. excellent and   food and a large menu.great crew, and good atmosphere. In addition to that, the cost is reasonable. I tell about this restaurant with pleasure.

The vibe of the place seems really friendly and lively. The waitress Sonia was so nice, I missed the "bacon" in the chicken sandwich and just asked for it to takeaway (I'd just give it to someone who needs meal). However, she offered for me to have another without the swine. She was also friendly herself. Tip her well if you visit. ! Also, definitely visit because the food is great and the alcohol is strong. !
Its a cool mid sized bar. Great spot for a craft beer after walking the Brooklyn Bridge. Jerry makes you feel comfortable and knowledgeable about the beers.

Came to this pub after a leisurely walk around Brooklyn. The food was reasonable although didn't come quite as described. I'd asked for a side salad to go with my french onion soup. The server wasn't sure if he could accommodate (which seemed strange, considering other orders came with side salads) but said he'd try. I never did get the side salad, or any further explanation, it just went ignored. We thought that would be fine regardless, since the Fish and Chips is noted to come with a salad on their menu, so that's what my husband ordered. However, it didn't come with a salad either. It didn't make or break the experience, but I've been elsewhere in the city where the customer service + food was a better overall so likely wouldn't return.
Great craft beers. Chill atmosphere and staff. Some of the best food I've ever had at a bar.

name: AlMar
reviews:
Great breakfast place that i found via yelp.  Had the cloud egg and it was awesome and  a fluffed egg white like I have never seen.

For dinner it's Italian good bit I have not tried it.

Stopped here for a quick beer, but seems to be an amazing spot. Their tomato bruschetta is out of this world, simple yet perfect! We also had their catskill pilsner and draft IPA. Beware that paying in cash will save you the 4% surcharge, but the place is pretty upfront about it.

Had a great experience at AlMar. The ambience is super intimate and service is excellent. The crostini’s and pasta were great but portions could have been a little bigger. Will definitely be visiting again!
Came here on a Sunday around 3pm and got seated right away. The shrimp salad on the specials was delicious! My friends also enjoyed their meals.

Not recommend to go if you're starving. It's a busy restaurant, you have to wait much longer than you thought. Egg in a Cloud is a small meal, and the spinach tasted horrible. But the other food we ordered, like the Almar, Classico, Old Fashion Breakfast were all great. If you pay by credit card, it takes extra 4%, and they don't allow you to separate checks.

name: Front Street Pizza
reviews: Classic Brooklyn style pizza! And free wifi! The pizza was really good you could tell it was a family owned business they are doing an excellent job! Would recommend. Only complaint would be to add some vegan menu options. Or some more salads.

After walking the Brooklyn Bridge on our last day in New York, was absolutely miserable weather. Got some great photos and loved Brooklyn cobbled streets. Was so happy to be there, despite the feral weather we loved the experience especially loved the Front Street Pizza!!!  Best pizza slice ever!!  There is something about the base that is awesome.  Australia needs to get on board with NYC technique.
We ran in here on a whim and were fully satisfied! I feel like for such a popular tourist area, the prices weren’t overly marked up. Got the gluten-free crust and it tasted delicious!

Don't go to any tourist attraction trap non-sense. Go to this pizzeria for the real authentic New York style pizza. The guys up front are really cool and the quality of pizza is great. My favorite and the Taco Pizza

Iconic spot, in DUMBO. We went here on our first night and had our first pizza 'by the slice' - we then revisited on our 4th day ... and returned for more pizza. We had a lot of pizza during our stay in New York, and this was joint best with Joe's. Great pizza. Great value.

name: Asya Indian Restaurant
address: 46 Henry St, Brooklyn Heights, NY 11201, USA
reviews: Nice restaurant, tasty food, typical Indian food, staff very nice and welcoming. They know which test you want, owner is very polite and down to earth. You will 50% discount when eat during lunch time between 11am to 3pm (no condition apply).
The food here was really nice and great customer service.  It was 5 of us.  Happy hour ended at 7 but they still gave us three deal after 7.  We had a great time.

Going against all the negative reviews, I still decided to go there. And I wasn't disappointed with the food!

My family and I were absolutely delighted by the food. The food tasted very authentic and great. This is coming from an Indian family so I can vouch for authentic flavors. 

However, the reason I am choosing to give this place a 4 star and not 5 is because of poor service from the waiting staff and restaurant's facility itself. 

1 of the 2 waiters who was serving us was rude in his approach and didn't really care to see if we were taken of or not. 

On top of that, the section of the restaurant where we were seated was freezing. It was a very cold night! We asked them to turn up the heating 3 times and then they turned it up, but that wasn't permanent as they turned it back down 15 mins later. 

If it wasn't for the taste of the food, I would rate this a 1 star.
Great food, great vibe, delicious food from appetizers to entrees. Great staff, great atmosphere, really cool look and just moments from the bk bridge 0park for a nice walk.
I go here very often after only becoming aware by a random referral. I first became aware 3 months ago and have probably been here 20X. The food and service are amazing!

name: Archway Cafe
reviews: I like the cozy feeling in the restaurant. Super chill vibe (I think because of the interior design). Me and my friend we're in there chatting for about 2h and 30min. Usually hate iced tea but the server recommend the pomegranate iced tea and it was heaven (you have to add your own sugar which is nice cause sometimes restaurants can add a bit too much sugar). It was super refreshing in a super hot day. Definitely a must try item. I had the rotisserie chicken sandwich and it was absolutely delicious. The bread was nicely toasted on the outside. I like the service here. They were friendly and didn't seem rushed. Price of the foods are easy on your wallet. 10/10 I recommend this spot to anyone. Decent priced food, delicious food, friendly employees.... What more can you ask for?

I like the cozy feeling in the restaurant. Super chill vibe (I think because of the interior design). Me and my friend we're in there chatting for about 2h and 30min. Usually hate iced tea but the server recommend the pomegranate iced tea and it was heaven (you have to add your own sugar which is nice cause sometimes restaurants can add a bit too much sugar). It was super refreshing in a super hot day. Definitely a must try item. I had the rotisserie chicken sandwich and it was absolutely delicious. The bread was nicely toasted on the outside. I like the service here. They were friendly and didn't seem rushed. Price of the foods are easy on your wallet. 10/10 I recommend this spot to anyone. Decent priced food, delicious food, friendly employees.... What more can you ask for?

We were out and about early on a Sunday morning and this was one of the few places that were open. The vibe seemed like it would be nice but coffee and food were nothing spectacular. The baked eggs were not what I was expecting at all, and seemed overcooked.

Overwhelmed and understaffed for the crowd that comes along with a beautiful spring Sunday at the nearby Brooklyn Flea. Food was mediocre. Service was nonexistent. It took a long time to place my order and in the mean time, I simply wasn’t acknowledged. No one asked how my meal was or if they could get me anything. My finished cup of water sat empty instead of refilled. They also don’t have WiFi for customers, so don’t swing by on a weekday hoping to work.
BEST smoked salmon sandwich/salad in the Big Apple, hands down! $13 (egg +$2) will get you half a pound (!) of lox with in fact 2 eggs of choice. Simply perfect!

name: Bevacco
reviews: Dropped in with family after a long day of museums and shopping. We had a great time -wonderful food, super service and terrific atmosphere! Highly recommend it-
Here for late lunch. I rarely review anything. But had the lentil soup and eggplant parmigiana which were marvelous. Although service was “leisurely” deserved 5 stars for the food.
One of the highlights of our NYC trip to find this small, clean, and friendly resturant.  Food was well prepared.  Had a great experience.

It's loud in here. I wonder sometimes how restaurants choose the finishings to the room. This place is very raucous and I have to think it was intentional. If you are looking for a quiet place, this place is not it. 

However, if you're looking for a place in Brooklyn Heights where you can get reasonably priced, well executed and tasty food which to me is not that common in Brooklyn Heights this is a good spot. we had the sausage pizza, the fried calamari, the grilled asparagus, and the Beet and grapefruit salad. The service was swift, the food came out fast. 

It's a shame about the Acoustics because it's too loud for me. But it's a good restaurant.
Always delicious. Plays good jazz. Awesome neighborhood place

name: Westville
reviews: Been here twice over the past year. The food was great each time. My Southwestern Bowl was fantastic and very filling (though a little hot sauce gave it a needed kick). My wife had a California Eggs Benedict that she loved, and my son was pleased with his Buttermilk Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict, too. All the staff was very nice as well.

Grabbed lunch here on my move-in day and it was the perfect place to refuel for the rest of in packing. Our food was delicious, service was great, and the atmosphere was just right. Will definitely be back here many more times! If they have the butternut squash soup, definitely get it before they run out — yum!

Great area dining with outside seating in separate porch and patio.  Porch was a little noisy.  Food was ok i had, shrimp rice special.  Friend had the cod but had to send it back as it was too salty.  Service was good.  I would not be adverse to trying it again.

Lovely restaurant, great food (plenty of vegetarian and vegan options) and fair prices. Kind and efficient waitresses, too. And a delicious pecan pie... an absolute must-do. About 12-14 $ per plate for lunch, well worth it.

I had my friend visiting me for a couple of days and had to find a place that offers vegan/vegetarian options (my friend is vegetarian). we were not disappointed and even pleasantly surprised with a variety. Everything is delicious, food looks good too. The staff is friendly. Def a great spot to visit.

name: sweetgreen
reviews: This is my favorite sweetgreen in the city so far. It is very spacious with lots of tables and chairs. The lighting that comes in is quite pretty! Staff are typically friendly and helpful. There is a bathroom here. I like the minimal decoration. Definitely try the warm bowl it is my favorite thing on the menu! Also if you order through the app it is very quick!
Affordable and nice salads! Quick service, clean enough and plugs to charge your phone! Also fresh tap water ♥

The restaurant was so nasty garbage every where. The tables very disgusted 
Employees were so rude. Especially to another customer when ask to clean the table. 
Music playing so loud in the back.
 The worst service I have ever seen.  I'm so glad I took my money some where else.

We were lucky to have good experience with the staff 🤷‍♂️ I read other people’s reviews before coming and was slightly worried. 

We loved our salads. Fresh veggies, delicious dressings. The grilled chicken is very delicious too. 

Highly recommend “sweetgreen” for a healthy lunch.
Great bowls.. I ordered a customized bowl with fish. Meat and veggies both were fresh and they have some really interesting dressing. Loved the spicy cashew dressing.

name: Juice Press
address: EQUINOX DUMBO, 117 Front St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: Best place in New York if you are vegan and love smoothies and healthy foods

The guy at the counter was very rude, I asked him about my order and seemed very annoyed when simply asking if there was an ingredient added in my drink. I would give them one star but my drink was made well. Poor customer service
This place is are really good, super great quality And I recommend people to go here. The staff are very nice and knowledgeable about their products

Friendly and helpful customer service. 

I recently moved to an office in the neighborhood and was suffering from a sore throat and stuffy nose. I ran into Juice Press and said I need help, some sort of cold buster, and one of the cashiers/attendants suggested three options for me and noted his top pick. He was really knowledgeable about the ingredients and their effects. I purchased the recommended "Ginger Fireball" and an hour later, could not be more pleased. It is helping in the way he described. 

Great product, great experience. 

Thank you, Juice press.

I highly recommend a visit if you're in the mood for a juice, shot, or smoothie - weather it be for health, medicinal or enjoyment purposes. The flavor combinations seem excellent and the quality is great. As a Juice Generation regular, I must say that Juice Press surpassed my expectations and I will definitely be going back.
Good stuff. Expect to pay for it though.

name: Ramen Bar
reviews: Literally some of the best food I have ever tasted in my life. The pork, OH MY GOD THE PORK, WAS THE MOST TENDER, JUICY, FALL OFF THE BONE PORK I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. My friends and I literally just went here on a whim and I'm so glad we did. Definitely one of the better decisions of my life.
Outstanding. This place has always been good. But recently they’ve gotten even better. I eat a lot of ramen - check it out.
I really enjoy this place - nice atmosphere and always good food. The ramen is delicious! Great spot for evening dinner if you’re around the area.
Excellent food! Super fresh and tasty. Nice enviorment! Loved it will be back
Cash only. Very decent bowl of ramen, I also liked gyoza that they serve.  They are a bit pricey, but given the location and the fact that they are in a tourist area it makes sense.

name: Bread & Spread
reviews:
Small shop serving yummy sandwiches!  Friendly staff, cosy ambience. 

I went there at around 3:30pm on Sunday and only regular coffee is available.
Love the place and would recommend it to anyone. Recently placed an order for my staff and it came within 30 minutes. They loved the sandwiches and would place another another soon!

Wonderful sandwich spot! There’s limited seating which encourages you to eat outside and enjoy the Brooklyn views.

The menu is carefully crafted to provide the best selected options. I’ve had their Porchetta—a classic that’ll never let you down. As for the Beef Short Rib, it reminds me of a hearty thanksgiving meal in a sandwich :)

My taste buds have died and gone to heaven. This is the best sandwich I have ever had. I had the pork belly sandwich and couldn’t ask for anything better. The pork melts in your mouth, perfectly seasoned with coriander. Amazing. Next time I come back to New York, this place will see me, even if I have to commute across the city.
The guys there were so nice. They took care of me and my coworker and accommodated us. He made us exactly what we wanted. The sandwich was yummy.

name: dumboLUV
reviews: A brand new fresh menu every Saturday evening. Can’t say enough about the food or location - it’s a cozy wine bar with a friendly staff, but having the pop up surprise menu means you never know what to expect but you know it’ll be awesome.
delicious, high quality local ingredients such a cute spot!

name: CUPER
reviews: last night was the first time we visited this fine restaurant. But It is definitely not the last time. We had great time with the generous service, with the exceptional  meal and wine and with the honest price. We will surely go back there in a short time.
I prefer this venue very much. there is a happy mood. The kitcen is superb. the service is powerful and the crew is polite. The pay is decent. I warmly recommend.

This site is my preferable restaurant.  Of all restaurants I know I prefere it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to visit this restaurant. everytime  I want to go to a good meal, this restaurant comes instantly to my mind. splendid and   food and a large menu.great crew, and good mood. In addition to that, the cost is decent. I tell about this spot with no doubt.

This restaurant is my number one place.  Of all restaurants I know I like it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to visit this restaurant. everytime  I feel like having a good supper, this place comes right away to my mind. extremely good and many types of  food and a large menu.helpful staff members, and agreeable vibes. And very important, the tariff is good. I tell about this place with no hesitation.
I constantly come by purchasing some food here. I loved the quick service and well prepared food. They never disappoint.

name: Mulberry & Vine
address: 55 Prospect Street B/t, Adams & Pearl, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews:
A little pricey for the amount of food you get, even by Dumbo’s standards. Thus, the 4 stars. However, it was filling and delicious. Plus, the space has a good vibe and the folks are nice. They only accept cards (no cash) which is the other reason for 4 stars. 

For a plate or bowl you can choose 2 veg + 1 protein OR 3 veg. 

I had the Goldman: sweet potatoes, broccoli, chicken breast, turmeric honey Dijon and crunch over organic spinach.

The person working behind the counter did their best to find the smallest piece of chicken possible!
Why would I pay full price for chicken scraps. Disappointed, won't eat here again
This is the best healthy food ever  the best and clean kitchen in the area
Friendly staff! Open late and Cozy seating! I would recommend going to Mulberry & Vine

Very unprofessional staff. I went there to pick up an order and I’ve waited more than 20 minutes to pick up the food. Also the front staff are just socializing on their phones and also handling food? This is a food establishment we’re talking about. Sorry, I just won’t eat here regardless on how good the food looks.

name: Los Tacos Al Pastor
reviews: Best tacos Al Pastor in the city! Corn hand made tortilla! Meat is super juicy and plenty of it! I go there twice a weekend it never disappoints. I do like chicken better then pork but either one is great! It's not sit down to eat - it is to take it to go place.
My friend tried tacos for the first time in his life and liked them. We got cactus tacos and chicken tacos.

Taste good. Ordered Burrito Bowl, usually that means with the tortilla bread, no bread here unfortunately. Very misleading should just say Bowl! 
But flavor and serving were good (for Dumbo) had pork and chicken burrito bowls. I asked if pork was spicy was told no, ended up having giant pieces of jalapenos in it, which I dislike, so I was left unsatisfied picking at my friend's chicken bowl. Doubt I'd personally go here again, but wasnt horrible.
Best Tacos in Brooklyn, and it's not even close. They make the corn tortillas by hand right in front of you, and the meat is delicious. Always worth swinging by when in Dumbo!

I didn't like the rice, but the meat was cooked well. The place was very hot and had very limited seating. Tacos were a bit over prices in my option. I did not like the style of tortilla, but it was flavorful.

name: Love & Dough
reviews: Controversial I'm sure- but this is the best pizza in Brooklyn.  And it literally takes 2 min to cook your pie in the fire...adorable spot under the Manhattan bridge
I loved the food here. A little pricey but worthy. Great tasting noodles and the dumplings had a really good taste.
1st time visiting here.  Great service and the best food...appetizers and pizza.  Get there early as it filled up pretty quick the day we were there
Enjoyable fare, portions were okay sized. The online profile said Debit Cards were acceptable but turns out they were cash only. Had to go to ATM at the smoke shop a few doors down.

I haven't been here in four years or so, so I hope you'll pardon the stale review. However, up until recently, this was the best pizza I've had on my life. I got sausage, pepperoni, and olive, and all the toppings were applied perfectly in the correct amounts. The pizza was hot, the crust was chewy, the cheese was gooey, and the sauce was flavorful. The pizza was a tad greasy, but nothing a quick dabbing with a napkin couldn't fix. I'll absolutely order from here any time I'm in Berkeley: it's worth the odd ordering process and hoop jumping.Love & Dough

name: RICE & MISO -Dumbo-
reviews: Wonderfully designed little space with some exceptional food. Highly recommend!

name: JSY Teriyaki Platter
reviews: This is one of those places that keeps the same chicken on the griddle all day. The result is dried out, stringy chicken. The sauce is flavorful, but that just because it's loaded with salt and sugar. Portions are huge, but only because the quality of meat is very low.

Cheap food and there usually isn’t much of a line. 

Go to order: Steak Teriyaki with white rice

name: Jimi's Market
reviews: Little hole in the wall kinda place but it has the best prices in Dumbo. Great portion size too.

Brilliant and honest place with no pretension. If you are looking for lunch, go towards the back and ask Janet what she’s made that day. She is a Thai lady that used to have her own restaurant and now cooks some of her specialties there. You can't get better, fresher Thai anywhere in Dumbo. And it’s only $7.
Food/service is good and cheap.  Decor is lacking. Edit 2/18/2020:  Jimis is permanently closed.  A "Thai" restaurant/Bubble Tea nook took over.

cash only 
breakfast is yummy 
lunch food is ok lacking a wow factor 
best bang for your buck in the area
A place to get cheap lunch in the area. The food is okay.

name: Pedro's Mexican Bar & Restaurant
reviews: Great place in Brooklyn to eat Mexican food! Nice decoration and environment. Really close to the river. I would definitely go back!

My friend rented out the backroom for her birthday party and it was fantastic. So awesome to have the place to ourselves. While there is no access to the actual restaurant with this option, we had our own bathroom and could play our own music. Brian took care of us and he was amazing! He made sure the birthday girl was happy and brought out some festive necklaces and hats for everyone. The food was pretty spectacular too. Favorite was the loaded nachos. Drinks were strong. Absolutely no complaints!!

Food is good. But horrible service. The staff serve you with an attitude. The bartender even worse. Very disappointing since the location has great potential and even more with York and front coming. Hope they improve. Sometimes even if the food is great it’s not worth an unfavorable meal.
Only place with decent prices for food. Drinks are strong!! Do not order chicken mofongo. Very hard and the chicken doesnt come mixed in with the mofongo.
I enjoyed the drinks, food and customer service.  They even changed the music to something they felt that my party and I  would enjoy.  I appreciated that. Will visit more often.

name: One Girl Cookies
reviews: Nice place to enjoy cup of joe with a cake or cookie. In love with their chocolate pecan pie 🥧

REALLY unhappy with today's morning staff. Definitely won't be returning though I work across the street. Diva behind the counter thinks she's Naomi Campbell or something. If you're too good to WORK, then don't.

A fairly standard coffee shop offering the usual caffeinated drinks and a selection of treats. The prices for drinks are typical of Manhattan/DUMBO, so don't expect to pay less than $5 for a cup of coffee. The service was courteous, and there was plenty of seating to work or have a conversation. Overall, a solid choice for a treat or a cup of coffee.
Nice place to get a good selection of pastries, cookies and other desserts.  Lot's of space to relax with a cup of coffee .  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.
Great and dependable selection of cookies, cakes and pastries that always hit the spot. Good coffee and tea complement the pastries for a great mid afternoon snack.

name: Burrow
reviews: Exquisite presentation. Everything is delicious and because it's small, leaves you wanting more! Love the "far Breton" and the cream puffs. VERY kind owners and staff. I'm a fan of their hot chocolate (only available in the winter). Treat yourself!

Everything at Burrow is special, charming, and delicious. This little cafe is hidden from the sidewalk, but is more worth the stop than a lot of other cafes in the area. Personally, I tried a pistachio mousse cake that was light, and full of delicate pistachio flavor. A delightful experience.

The Gateau Breton is EVERYTHING! A cookie like cake baked around a cherry filling. OMG! Somehow I  didn't know about the Burrow even though it's only a mile from my house. So much time wasted, but I'll make up for it now. We tried about ten things and they were all really beautifully made. I love that the pastries are not overly sweet. They are delicate, flavor filled and buttery. The women who waited on us were very sweet. We say in the lobby of the building. They set up extra chairs for us. Pure pleasure.
A small bakery, but the staff are warm and kind. The canelé was extraordinary.
The place is very overrated.  The Opera and Burrow Cheesecake are just alright.  The presentations are good.

name: La Bagel Delight
reviews: Amazing Brooklyn bagels. Place not as nice, but bagel was amazing!!! 😋 Take out, no dine in...

I never leave Brooklyn without grabbing a bag of bagels to go.  Best breakfast in Dumbo.  Always a line out the door so be ready with your order and don’t expect a conversation with the staff.  They are busy!!  Let them do their job.  They do it well!!

Popped in to get a quick breakfast sandwich and was not disappointed. I chose the pastrami, egg, and cheese on a sesame bagel, and it hit the spot! The staff were friendly, and I was in and out quickly. Would definitely return next time I'm in the area!

This place rocks. Even when it’s packed the wait is never too long. The bagels are really something else - so soft and chewy *chefs kiss* truly to die for. I’m so glad to work around the corner so stopping in is easy before work. The team is friendly and there’s a huge array of cream cheeses including several tofu cream cheese options! I wish I could place orders for my office online but that’s the only thing I can find to be critical of. Thanks for all you do La Bagel Delight!!
Delicious bagels! Long wait times but definitely worth it. Try a few different varieties of the bagels and cheese.

name: Cranberry's
reviews: Their scones are out of this world the best ever.  I used to volunteer in Brooklyn. Moved to central/southern  jersey and there are no comparison when it comes to their scones. Unfortunately I live too far away but their scones are the best ever. And of course their employees and the owner are amazing. Great service and been serving for many many years. Keep up the good work.
The best eggplant sandwich I’ve ever had! I occasionally stop here when in the neighborhood. Friendly and accommodating staffs.
This was the only place open on an early morning photo trip. We had decent coffee and empanadas. It's handy for the High Street subway station and has a fairly extensive menu.

I was disappointed in my sandwich from Cranberry's. I had a Holy Cow and It was really dry. There was a severe lack of sauce and flavor, that made the sandwich sub par.  Keep walking... There's better opportunities on the horizon.
Excellent choice of desserts, baked goods, empanadas, and sandwiches. Blueberry crumb cake was also really good. A most stop whenever in the neighborhood!

name: Made in NY Media Center by IFP
reviews: Attended a Legal Hackers International Summit here and the facilities were perfect! Speedy wifi, water refill stations, and more!
Awesome place their event on june 26th was resourceful . .
Went to the bar area for the NYC Tech Breakfast.  Great venue and a modern, cozy area in the posh yet kind DUMBO.
Covers all the bases (workstations, conference rooms, cafe, restrooms, Internet, screening room, etc.) and reasonably priced.

State of the art and modern facility with interesting spaces. I was there for IFP Film Week and it was the perfect hub for the conference, including places for exhibits, lounges, and the main theater for panels.

name: Brooklyn Roasting Company
reviews:
It was my first time at Brooklyn Roasting Company, Washington st location.
The place is nice with free wifi.
I always enjoy their waffle and oat hot-choc.
I love the location on Jay street!
Coffee place in the perfect spot in DUMBO. Nice place, really strong coffee...
Relaxed atmosphere and upbeat music at an iconic spot in Brooklyn. What's not to like? Throw in some fantastic coffee and you have a great place.

Amazing place for grabbing a coffee or escaping for he cold at Brooklyn bridge and also for a place to use the toilet. Coffee shop has great options for organic drinks and coffee. It's also great to read a book or work on your laptop. Good choice of coffee mugs and t-shirt of the Brooklyn roasting company. Quality and price of the drink is good too.

I can't drink coffee because I'll freak out-- plus there was no place to sit. I was buying a box of coffee to impress and curry favor for some folks and it did not work. Most of this is not the fault of the establishment--

name: Bluestone Lane DUMBO Café
reviews:
Thank you for the love and care in preparing my food! Everything was delicious. ✨You guys are awesome. Please stay safe. 
For those who are reading this, we will get through this together.  I💙NY

Cozy place in Dumbo. With so awesome people, working there. And so tasty coffee and sweets. Very popular between locals. And really good place for a breakfast. 
While visiting Brooklyn, and want to see a sunrise lights on bridge or Manhattan - it is good place to take some hot coffee ToGo. And enjoy all atmosphere around

Wish I could give this a zero. My friend and I tried to get delivery through Seamless. We keep on getting notices of it being more and ore delayed. Then we contacted Seamless and they told us they delivered it but NOPE, NO FOOD! Either way we finally got a refund but not one word from the restaurant about why our food wasn't delivered even though we tried to reach out multiple times.

Great coffee. Great service. Great vibes.

Worth dropping by for a sit down or stand up coffee... go on one leg if you like

Fantastic place! Came in early for breakfast, the place was empty but started filling up quickly. The staff is friendly and the food looks and tastes amazing! We got some avocado toast, bacon sandwich, a cookie, matcha and beet latte. Everything was super delicious. They have gluten-free options as well. 

There's another location in Manhattan but it's not as cool. This one rocks!

name: Vinegar Hill House
reviews: Very disappointing espresso - tasted like either a very unclean machine, or re-run grounds, or the wrong kind of bean. There are so many coffee shops in the area - I'd recommend venturing elsewhere to get your coffee fix.

name: BOBA DUMBO TEA, COFFEE, ICECREAM & MILK BAR
reviews:
Stumbled upon this place on our walk through DUMBO. The barista guy greeted us immediately. SUPER DUPER FRIENDLY, PLEASANT, and attentive. The guy seems to be unable to stop smiling! He's awesome and adorable!

Anyway, our drinks came out pretty quick and were delicious. The strawberry lava milk tea is a flavor explosion. Def recommend!
Very nice spot! Super cozy. The boba was yummy. Also tried the tarp egg pudding which was delicious

Super friendly service and the ice cream flavors are fabulous!! Unique flavors like Jasmine and Palm seed and perfectly balance in sweetness and natural flavor. So refreshing to taste ice cream that is not loaded with sugar.

Super friendly baristas. We were met at the door and walked to the coffee bar. The lavender latte was delicious and I sampled the strawberry lava milk tea, which was punch-you-in-the-face good. I'm not a big fan of matcha but the sip I tried was still pretty good.

I'm glad we stopped here on a whim!
Helpful staff, cozy venue and delicious drinks. I got the Taro milk tea and added egg pudding topping per the recommendation of the staff. Would come again.

name: Brooklyn Bridge Park Dog Run
address: Adams St & Plymouth St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: Great dog run with a fun hill in the middle!
Nice doggie playground to bring your dog out to play. My Bulldog Max loves to play with this large ball and doesn't want to share it with anyone or any dog. I can't even try to touch it. lol
Awsome views
Nice place with good view

First & foremost, I'm not a fan of 'dog runs'.  Would much rather take my dog to a real park such as Fort Greene park or hiking to New Jersey.  I do agree with one of the previous posters that the hill is a weird fixture.  However, the real reason behind my three stars which I am surprised nobody has mentioned is that the run is right underneath the trains.  The noise is simply intolerable to me, it raises my stress levels as I am sure it does my dog's.  Do yourself a favor and drive your dog out hiking once a week, and for the rest of the time, just walk them on the streets.

name: Pearl Street Triangle (Dumbo Improvement District)
address: Water Street between Pearl Street and Anchorage Place, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews:
Great view when your in Dumbo.
Always festive and busy , must see. 
Al Pacino shot driving his Ferrari with Chris Odonald, movie Scent of a Woman in this triangle via Front street . Has a piece of 90s Hollywood fame. 
When you are here, check out Emerald Gem Exchange for all your gems, crystals and Feng Shui needs.

Triangles are the best shape, and they're also a really great park in DUMBO. Don't worry about the lack of grass, we got tables there, we got pizza there, and hey is it the holiday season (OH YES IT IS NOV, DEC, AND THE FIRST WEEK OF JAN) we got a MF'in Christmas Tree with lights on it that even light up. 5/5. strong park. sit there and enjoy it.
Really Great spot Too Chill !!
Nice area to just chill and eat lunch
Had a random good time here

name: Bar and Grill Park
address: York St. Between Adams Street and, Pearl St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: Nice park
Nice place
Good food joint

name: Main Street Park
reviews: Great little park directly across from New York City under the Brooklyn bridge. Best to go when it’s warm. I included a picture of the map of Dumbo for reference.

Nice park/area in Brooklyn where you got a beautiful view of the skyline of Mahatten and the Brooklyn Bridge.
You can go there via the Brooklyn Bridge or by the subway.
There is a beautiful riverside you can walk or sit and enjoy the view.
Great views of lower manhattan and brooklyn bridge. A must locations to visit for iconic pictures for residents and tourists, alike.

I wasn't aware at the time I have been walking by there and took this blurry picture, but tourists love this place to take a picture with the Brooklyn bridge background ! I think it's a great spot to hangout! There is also many places around where you can enjoy a drink
Best place to see the nyc’s nightlight. I want to say it’s more worthy to visit than DUMBO

name: John Street Park
reviews: Beautiful little park in DUMBO area with spectacular views of Manhattan skyline and the Manhattan and Brooklyn Bridges.

Beautiful little park nestled Right next to the Manhattan bridge. Very nice place to take your significant other to sit back on the bench and chat.  There are no food vendors in this park so if you plan on staying bring a sandwich or snack. Also note that since there is no food vendors there are no restrooms that I found in the area.  But I may be wrong on this...
NYC did a great job setting up this park.
Little park next to Brooklyn bridge park here you can easily see the manhattan bridge very close. Clean, fresh, calm location, few seats availability.
Great views and filming location. Very, very, very loud from the trains though.

name: Clumber Corner
address: Prospect St &, Adams St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA

name: Environmental Education Center
reviews: Wonderful place to visit to see the aquaria with many species of fish pulled right from the East River, as well as Sea Horses & Pipefish.  I enjoyed the baby Tautogs & 3" long Stripers, both of which I've caught while fishing nearby LI Sound.  The staff is helpful and informed.  Great for children, too with books and games.
Great place for kids. Bathrooms are helpful as well.

name: Bridge Park
reviews: It's such a great feeling to be able to walk to the water in my neighborhood and have this park you're so many things to do in it.
Very nice view over the Manhattan bridge

Small corner park to just sit at. It's a bit noisy with traffic from the Brookly Queens Expressway aka BQE. You also have noise from the B or D train that crossesover the Manhattan Bridge. Not the best park to un-whine at due to the noise but it's ok to just take in a breather and move on. There's another small park across the street with basketball courts.

Cool place. Check it out, has great food options around dumbo. has the york street stop (F and G trains both stop there) and even the high street stop (A train and the C train) near by too. There's shops. There's views. There's art. There's dumbo. Get out there and enjoy in the spring, summer, and fall. 3/5. great place.
I come here by ferry from the peer in bayrdige to play volleyball.  It doesn't get any better than a cool ferry ride to the park. :)

name: Vinegar Hill House
reviews: Love this little restaurant in the quite Vinegar Hill! I came here for brunch and got the eggs and tomatoes (which is a similar version to a dish called Shakshukah), and their absolute amazing pear sourdough pancakes.. this pancake is out of the world! It’s more like a very well fried donut type of pancake, it’s thick and made perfect on the inside, topped with butter and maple syrup, you really done need more than that. We also got the grits which were pretty good. Highly recommend to check their brunch menu, however it is a small food menu.
Lovely atmosphere, great food and fast service. What else do you need?! Great experience dining on Brooklyn. Highly recommended.

Despite being in the middle of nowhere and having a small-ish dinner menu, Vinegar Hill House left a lasting impression on me. Everything we ordered was wonderfully prepared, presented, and flavored. The atmosphere is beautiful, rustic, and perfectly dim. It was bustling at the height of dinner, but never felt crowded or rushed. Highly recommended if you find yourself near DUMBO/Vinegar Hill.
This place has a great feeling, like dropping into a dining room in a small town upstate. The staff is really warm and helpful. Really enjoy this spot.

Staff was very accommodating for showing up much earlier than my reservation. Very warm environment... actually it was the perfect temperature. Had chicken liver mousse and salad to start, nothing remarkable. However, the pork main and eggplant side were incredibly delicious. Took off one star for my subjective opinion about the starters. Would have taken off only 1/2 star but Google Reviews won't allow that.

name: Annie's First Wok
reviews:
-Inexpensive being located in dumbo
--decent portion for the price
---kitchen is clean n easy to see the chef preparing n cooking your food; the wait area could be cleaner n could use a coat of fresh paint😁👍
-Quality is consistent as i ordered few times due to having a construction project in the area.
Love Linda, and the food is great... From the Twinnss..💙❤
Subpar Chinese takeout joint.  Everything was too salty.  Don't recommend it.
I like this takeout place. Good Chinese food and good prices.
Definitely good Chinese rite near York F station

name: Los Papi's
reviews: When this place leaves Dumbo will have lost another great little pop eatery. Serving factory workers since the 1960s till now, and hopefully into the future.  Breakfast, lunch and early dinner. Hot soup on a cold day from this place would warm the bones and heat the soul. Try it.

There's no love in their cooking food have no flavor price went up because of construction going on across the street, so they forgot about the people in the community who will still be here to support them when the construction workers leave after the work is finish. They need to bring back the Spanish lady who cooked with love and made it enjoyable to visit. It's not always about the the all mighty $$$. Lot of people stop going. Papi's get it together, the breakfast price went up which is not cool. Don't forget about the people in the community that you're serving.
The place is a dive but the food is fantastic and one of the best lunch values in the area. Absolutely love it.

Midway between hipster Dumbo, forgotten Vinegar Hill, and the Farragut Houses, Los Papi's turns out seriously tasty 'Spanish' eats. Think juicy roast pork and veg over rice with fried plaintains and that addictive salsa verde. The Cuban sando is awesome: ham, carmelized pork, nice roll to hold the juices, pickles and mustard to cut the heaviness. Humble digs, very friendly staff. No surprise that diverse patrons were streaming through. It rivals Margon and Sophie's.
Good food...great service.

name: Bridge Front
reviews: This place is sooo good. Everything from breakfast to lunch. The coffee is awesome. What I like most it is in the neighborhood. Another is that everyone from every profession come here to eat. If you like great traditional Dominican food. It's the go to spot!

Delicious Dominican food.  Restaurant has been a mainstay in the community for years, serving blue collar workers including the throngs of construction workers erecting the high rises which loom large over the restaurant.  A breakfast here will keep you going for the entire day.
The food here is excellent customer service is excellent the work is an excellent what more can I say but make your way they are when they're open are you won't be dissatisfied
Warm place in a cool old building between Dumbo and Vinegar Hill.  Open early, with a delicious breakfast spread.  Don't miss the little chorizo+ sausages.
Sneaky hole-in-the-wall spot with incredible dominican food. Pork and beans over rice is really good. Make sure you get the green hot sauce!

name: Brooklyn Roasting Company
reviews:
A spacious coffee/breakfast joint in DUMBO. The offerings here are pretty typical for a coffee spot, but the drinks are great and the service is prompt. This particular location (on Jay Street) is very spacious, with plenty of seating for doing work or having a conversation. 

The prices here are the standard for Manhattan/Downtown Brooklyn, so don't expect to pay less than $5 for a cup of coffee. That being said, if you are willing to spend that much for coffee, I would recommend the Brooklyn Roasting Company.

I love this spot. Good coffee, nice atmosphere to come and hangout, work on projects, or just a weekend out at the water front. Place does have loud music, I wish it was a little less noise. 

Big places, super high ceilings, and generous natural light... Couches, coffee tables, window counter, you name it.

They sell a good assortment of coffee gadgets, brewers, and merchandise.

A big, open space coffee shop that provides welcoming vibes upon entrance. Extremely kind people and very good coffee. Pour over is probably the best I’ve ever had.  The living room vibes make the place so comfortable!

Unique spot in Brooklyn with a very cozy vibe. I had a maple latte that was tasty but slightly sweet for my taste. Overall the staff was very friendly and I was digging the atmosphere. Great spot to read or play cards with friends - or grab a coffee and walk under/near the Brooklyn bridge.
Airy, contemporary/industrial themed decor. friendly service that makes you feel at home. Maybe the best cup of cafe latte that I have had in a long time- creamy and well balanced flavor.

name: HVRMINN
