Had pulled chicken sandwich (slightly spicy) and pesto pasta. $2 beer 👍👍👍 aprox $10  per plate (worth it). Smells a bit like vintage rug..Love the patio option. Friendly staff and if you get bored, board games available.

name: Bushniwa
reviews: I stumbled upon this restaurant on a Monday night to find excellent service and tasty food. The restaurant was really quiet and the football game was on the screen and with just a few patrons in the restaurant the ambience was cozy. The eggplant was bursting with flavor and the black cod was beautifully cooked. I would definitely come back to try other dishes since I didn’t explore their sushi menu.

From the first moment  you step in that place  the stuff gives you an excellent feeling. Very hospitable hosts, it is a happy restaurant to hang out with friends and colleagues or with your date. tasty  meals, talented  chief cook and stuff, decent  pay and attentive  service. Highly recommended.
My son and I really enjoyed this place. The food was great!!  The staff was nice and made sure we had everything we needed. Will definitely visit this place again.

Bushniwa is a very nice restaurant with very fresh fish. I have to admit, the scallop and cod was done very nicely. The scallop was just perfectly crispy on the outside and not dry and inside was super moist and buttery. Same can be said about their cod.

Their decor is beautiful. However, if you plan to come and eat, bring your wallet, it is not for the faint of heart. That being said, you wont be disappointed with the food.
Love love love this place! Service, food, literally amazing. Must go to in Brooklyn

name: OZI Dumplings
address: 19 Bogart St unit 1, Brooklyn, NY 11206, USA
reviews: Spring rolls were pretty good and reasonably priced (considering this is NYC), I got the buffalo chicken dumplings which just seemed like regular dumplings with buffalo sauce poured over them, which tasted pretty good but nothing exceptional. Overall still a good, quiet, comfortable place to spend an afternoon
We had a pleasant experience with this establishment.  The waitress was friendly and helpful.  The Dumplings are unique and tasty.  5 stars status 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

I don't really leave bad reviews but something is really wrong here with the glowing reviews. These dumplings taste like they're from the frozen section of a convenience store and thawed in the microwave. The Ramen broth tasted like milky water, the pork was tough and flavorless. Big yikes all around.

Great spot in a fun area of Brooklyn. Lots of great shops and restaurants are in this area and OZI Dumplings is a top spot for delicious food. The dumplings are not what you'd typically expect. You get to choose things like the cheeseburger dumpling, or soft shell crab. The tonkatsu ramen was quite good. The broth was very creamy and full of pork flavor. Looking forward to going back.

Postmate here. I've heard good and bad things about this place... So when I got an order for a pick up from here, I decided to place an additional order for me so I can try it. I don't know what they were, but they are NOT dumplings we are used to.. The outer part tasted more like fried wontons to me.. And the meat inside didn't have the flavor or texture of dumplings I've had in the past. They must think the flavored sauce they put on top is suppose to help. Over priced also. And W. T. H. was that brown / black liquid stuff poured in the middle of my white rice??? Wasn't soy sauce!

name: Amituofo Vegan Cuisine
reviews: Great restaurant with lots of choices . Highly recommend the KIMCHI DUMPLINGS SEARED!!! The food was cooked perfectly, the portions are great for anyone looking to fuel up, and the sauces/ spices really enhanced all the flavors. The prices are a bit high considering the food you’re eating, but that’s the fee we pay for convenience. I also liked how you are able to pay for your food via a QR Code provided on the receipt! Average price per person here is about $24 (entree, appetizer, tax and tip).
This is my go to spot to accommodate my vegan friends. Love the decor. Service is friendly. Will keep going back

Some of the best asian food I've ever had and... it was all vegan! Hands down the best meat substitutes out there, you'll have a hard time going back to basic, stir-fried tofu after these delicacies. Getting to return to some old favorites since dropping meat was a dream come true, the General Tso's chicken and roasted 'duck' were phenomenal!

Amituofo comes from Buddhism and can mean pretty much whatever you want it to mean. For me and this visit it meant good food in a nice setting. The atmosphere was laid back and casual as soon as you walk in. The tables look like they're made from reclaimed wood and it has a very nice repurposed feel to it. The service was hospitable and warm. The food was fresh, vibrant, and full of flavours. It had many levels of textures in each meal that we had and each dish was well executed. I'd definitely like to come back to see what else they can offer.

Picture this; you’re hungry on a real hard days of work at the studio with the boys. You decide to order some delectable vegan dishes and bam you got this flavor explosion of a meal. I ate every last bit and even scrapped the sides of my dish! That’s right, I’m coming out as a sidescrapper! So good!

name: Forrest Point
reviews:
Highly Recommend! 
Great sunlight coming into this place, great vibe. Walls are covered in old vinyl record cases. Food is amazing. Creative drink selection. The Snow Leopard will knock you off of your feet!

Coming from Albuquerque New Mexico, 
I know something about Guacamole and Fish Tacos. These guys are on point. Fish tacos are creamy and delicious. The Guac and Chips needed a little more lime and salt for my taste, otherwise perfect.

Go to Forrest Point!

They confirmed a reservation for us but then seated us way later than promised despite the fact that there were numerous empty tables. They played awful pop music from a decade ago; terrible beer selection. The waiters were quick and diligent though, once we finally started dining, and the food menu and food quality was unremarkable but decent.

This place was super convenient to our Airbnb during our stay in Brooklyn. The burger was delicious and the doughnuts are amazing! Great ambiance. Only complaint would be that it got a bit chilly in the evening, most likely due to the plastic windows.

I love this place hands down one of the best vibed out places in BK. You must go Thursday through Saturday because this one bartender really makes this place special. Her name is Gee it's short for a really long cool french name but she's very down to earth and certainly makes the experience great and welcoming.
Absolutely amazing. The Bloody Mary's are delicious and spicy. Great atmosphere as well.

name: Roberta's Pizza & Bakery
reviews: Making a list of places in NYC to get pizza. Put this one pretty close to the top. In fact, take the train over for this alone if you need to. Great pizza and great service. We didn’t have to wait, but we waited on the dinner menu print just to make sure we had all the options, but I imagine there isn’t a single thing on the menu that isn’t good.

Sat at the bar and had the Cowabunga Dude. It was delicious and an upscale take on the pies my parents would order when we were kids. I polished the pizza off myself! Generous with the toppings too. The rest of the menu looked great so I can't wait to try other dishes besides their pizza next time. Good vibes at the bar and a casual atmosphere. Will be returning for more!

My all time favorite pizza spot in Brooklyn! From the vibes to their delicious pizza! They change their pizza menu often so you get to try all their amazing choices. They have a nice open patio that they open during the warm season which is a great hangout spot for friends and family!

One of the top pizza spots! Thin crust, great sauce and interesting toppings if you want them. Like the vibe but on weekends be prepared to wait (or order take out and have it at the tiki bar next door).

The place is really aesthetically pleasing and the pizza feels extremely authentic with their giant pizza oven. The crust is the right amount of crunch and chewy dough so it’s not paper thin but has the crisp texture. We were seated pretty easily. Food didn’t take long for a wait and the drinks were very good as well. Would definitely go back. (Sorry for my picture quality. It was a late Saturday night)

name: Tacostio1
reviews: ALWAYS GREAT FOOD, FRESH INGREDIENTS AND DELICIOUS! THE SERVICE IS ALSO EXCELLENT! THE TRUCK IS ALWAYS CLEAN AND THEY ALWAYS HAVE GREAT SPECIALS! THEY ARE THE CLEANEST AND BEST FOOD TRUCK AROUND!

Nothing more to say than: just really awesome food! We tried Chicken, Samon, Vegan tacos and a vegetarian Burrito and can truly say that we had damn good food for really (!!!) fair price. Really, if you want some good street food, go there! It’s worth every dollar!
This food was delicious! Clean environment and service was unique. Taking in consideration was a food truxk.

name: Tina's Place
reviews:
A great place for an American breakfast. A little family run business which has been in Bushwick for the last 50 years. The place is quite busy but service is very fast and efficient. Prices are very cheap, they have great breakfast Menus.
They have a very big variety of omelets, pancakes, waffles and awesome fresh orange juice. The place is simple but has a great vibe, the perfect place to fill up your batteries before you head out.
Will definitely come back when I am in the neighborhood!

A small town diner in a bustling metropolis. This is the kind of place that my grandfather would go to everyday. Good food, GREAT prices, and helpful staff. Definitely where you should go if you are looking for a cheap meal without being surrounded by the pressures of the city.

Classic diner that’s been there more than 40 years! Food is really good and the service is quick! Everyone is nice and you feel like you’re part of the family. I would go here again for breakfast all the time. Make sure you bring cash as its cash only.

This place is absolutely fantastic. It opens around 3am and closes at about 4pm. The only diner-style breakfast place in the neighborhood. Tina herself is pretty much there every day and she keeps the coffee coming. A standard breakfast plate (egg, meat, potato, toast, coffee) is like $6. They also have waffles. If you don't know, now you know.
A great neighborhood gem with cheap prices! Be warned weekends are PACKED. Otherwise the people are nice plus free coffee/tea/juice with your meal before 11AM

name: Swallow Cafe
reviews:
Stopped in to grab coffee and it was a nice shop. Light frills, in the cut style coffee place with delicious lates and reclaimed style wood furniture.

The day we went the fans were going and it had a warm airy vibe to it. I could see it being a nice out of the sun place for people to get work done or chill with some friends. It's cool, but not so cool that you feel uncomfortable.

Definitely enjoyed the designs that engulfed the building - it added to the experience of the place. Stop in and enjoy.

Very cozy place, great to study or work - lots of seating. Cash only (which just screams tax-evasion!) and they clearly know how inconvenient that is for their customers because, almost as an act of pity, they have an ATM next to the register. Staff is not unfriendly, maybe just indifferent - like cats whose kindness feels more rewarding because of its scarcity. I've only been here twice. Food was good for the price, and I can't say anything bad about the coffee - it's certainly caffeinated (which is probably what gave me the energy to write such an unnecessarily long review).

Went to Swallow Cafe for a latte with almond milk and spent about $6. The atmosphere was quiet, the tables were nice and clean and it was very cool ( temperature ) inside. I enjoyed the latte although it was pricey. The music was good, and the environment was really pretty. The metal seats were a bit uncomfortable though but maybe it's just me. Also, its cash only. Outside was interesting, it almost doesn't look like a cafe at all, just a wall with some art and that was pretty cool. I'd visit again!
Good coffee in large comfortable kitch space with reclaimed wood furnishings. The pastries were fresh. I enjoyed my spinach, kale and ricotta croissant.
Cool, comfortable rustic spot with good coffee. Just a bit on the pricier side, and it's cash only. If not for those two things I would give it 5 stars.

name: FINE & RAW Chocolate
reviews:
Great store and cafe which offers high quality, raw, vegan/plant-based, no processed sugar chocolate. 

A few blocks from a subway station but a little difficult to find as it blends in with the surroundings. Be sure to check hours of open before you head over as the store and cafe are at times closed on the weekend.

I love this place so much and stop every  time I come to NYC.  It's a little out of the way but so worth it.  You can just hang out for an hour eating samples and deciding on what you want to get. It's really fun to look around. They have the BEST chocolate drinks anywhere.  That hot and cold chocolate are just amazing.  I love the vibe of the neighborhood. Check our Roberta's afterward, life is uncertain so get that chocolate first :)

Hi everyone, 
This place is a like a pharmacy of chocolate , if you are a chocolate lover , that is the perfect place for you.
Everything is really high quality , made out of pure Coco in all sizes and shapes.
Perfect for gives .
You can also see how they are making the chocolate, they are making it at the back of the store, really interesting and you can appreciate the product even more .
The prices is a bit high, but after you see how they are making it , it's understandable.
So have fun!!!

One of the best chocolates I’ve had. The chocolate is made with coconut sugar (so no processed sugar) and is vegan, gluten and soy-free. The company is also eco-friendly, abiding my sustainability rules. I highly recommend this chocolate!
Amazing place! You enter and smell chocolate and its amazingly good!

name: Novo Arts, Inc
reviews: The managers and the people there are amazing and wonderful to work with. The owner however,  is terrible! She treats the employees like dirt, bad mouths them in front of them and cares for no one but herself. Will not listen to reason or logic. She is the only things that is terrible about the place. It would be an amazing/dream place to work at if she was not in the picture.

Really happy for their excellent services,there serves is also awesome.It is very good place. I like this business for its excellent quality and experience.  I wish in future they would present such kind of services.i suggest my all friends. so many thanks..

If you haven't seen the lobby and restaurant at the JW Marriott in Chicago, go check it out! I recently stayed there and the place is BEAUTIFUL. Novo did an amazing job on the interiors and even the art on the walls in my room!" that are readily available. We picked 4 paintings and picked them up in Brooklyn the next day!

My wife and I wanted a painting for the living room in our new apartment in Manhattan. Novo arts presented us with quite a few samples and then we were able to pick a piece to be handmade in their studio. The turnaround time was fast, and now we have a great statement piece!

I was looking for great arts and I contacted them. They given exceptional service.They are talented and provided with outstanding arts.The organization is the best and they are through professional people.
I highly recommend this organization for everyone.

name: HHH
address: Buzzer #11, 114 Forrest St Apt 3A, Brooklyn, NY 11206, USA
reviews: Awesome people, movies, food and hangouts. Bbq on the roof if you can.
shame about Google Reader, though.
Delicious tea!

This place smelled like orange juice and vomit and every exposed surface was sticky. The air was filled with toner dust that turned the cat black and killed all the computers. And who chose that red color for the walls, seriously.

name: Beaver Noll Park
address: Beaver St &, Bushwick Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11206, USA

name: Tomo Japanese Fusion
reviews: From the first moment  you arrive in this place  the stuff gives you a nice feeling. Very warm waiters, it is a friendly restaurant to go out with buddies or with your date. enjoyable  food, creative  chef, good  cost and excellent  service. Highly recommended.
Everything was delicious. Even the Boba Tea was better than my favorite Bubble Tea place CoCo's

For the past few years this is always been my go to sushi place for takeout but recently I have started to come here as they have a great lunch special fresh sushi good service and always nice to enjoy with a beer and hot sake. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for affordable and consistent sushi
The first time I visited this place, I was hooked! Seems that I am here once a week now. By far the best hand rolls I’ve had, and the sushi has always been fresh. Friendly staff and great atmosphere

This restaurant is my favorite. I eat in plenty of restaurants but to this restaurant I  constantly return again and again. The stuff is very attentive and the food they cook is so fresh and tasty. I am always happy to have a decent dinner in this place. I recommend this place with pleasure.

name: Taqueria El Fogon
reviews:
Phenomenal n fantastically delicious. I had a fried whole porgy n it it was perfect!!!!! 

As u can see from the pictures, I didn’t leave much left over. It was all great too, not just the fish! I’ve ordered from this n the other Fogon n they’re both delicious. 

I’d recommend this place if ur in the area n like legit, real deal Mexican food.

This family run Mexican  restaurant is by far the best one i've been to ,in comparison to the ones I have visited in Tijuana the food takes  my family and I on a virtual trip to one of many lsmall eateries south of the border while still being close to home
 that's why I give this place a 5 out of 5 star rating,although the parking can be tough to find,......but then again,it's just like Tijuana.    The grajales family.
Delicious food! Great service! Can't wait to go back.  Tacos, chalupas, coffee, homemade chips-- all so tasty!
Best mexican spot i know, love their burritos. 10 stars if i could 😁
Amazing food and such a cozy atmosphere

name: Bunna Cafe
reviews: Very welcoming environment. Very pleased to see the use of no utensils . Great variety of Ethiopian beer. Price for 2 was $16 and got to sample all 8 dishes. 4 warm and 4 cold. Lots of flavors come out in the food. The bread is a little bit more on the sour side. CASH ONLY . I don’t really carry any cash, so make sure you bring some to avoid the ATM fee. The coffee ceremony looks pretty cool. Bathroom is large , but looks like it hasn’t been renovated in ages . Food was solid. Service was quick.

SO DELICIOUS. beautiful little place with beautiful food. I think I ate so much but feel so amazing. I'm no expert in Ethiopian food but I thought it was great. Fingers still smelling like curry. The espris is also a delicious drink with mango, papaya and avocado. Came with a large party and we got a few feast for 3s and feast for 2. Got to try everything and it's amazing. Can't wait to go back with an old friend to catch up!

Incredibly tasty, healthy, whole foods menu. Probably takes a few visits to master the eating method without silverware and only the bread. It was a bit weird sharing this style of eating with others, next time I'd prefer to get my own plate. Watch a quick video on how to eat Ethiopian food before you go. You will probably get a bit messy, but there is a faucet in the back for cleaning your hands, which is useful. All vegan!

I struggle with this, the restaurant has been my go-to for visitors over the years. The food is absolutely incredible, second to none in terms of Ethiopian food in the city. 

The last time I visited there was a DJ playing and our table was directly in front of the speaker. We couldn't really hear and requested if the volume could be decreased slightly or could we be seated elsewhere. She said she would check with the host and when she returned asked to take our order. She had forgotten to speak with host and offered to alternatively turn down the volume. Not sure if the volume was actually turned down. It made dinner tough. Nonetheless food was great! 

Will return, and this was probably a one off.

Tastiest vegan restaurant in the neighborhood. Brunch on weekends from 12 to 4. The nan bread is amazing. All the appetizers on the dinner menu are great. Complementary coffee is great. Family friendly. Good music. Unisex bathrooms. Cash only. Staff is friendly. Lighting is nice.

name: Popeyes Louisiana Kitchen
reviews: my first time ever at Popeyes in New York and the customer service was marvelous. A cashier named Latasha helped me with my order and got me my food very fast. I definitely recommend this place

Recently i i have been seeing some new cashiers and the customer service seem to improve a little.. not with the managers, they're still rude and unprofessional. Last time i ordered online it was all messed up i had to go right back to the store with my TWO KIDs  and  i have to say the cashier with her name tatted on her hand (can't remember her name exactly) but she handled the situation very professional with a bright smile on her face i went home with some fresh chicken and a complete order. Thats by far the best customer service experience i  have ever experienced there. All i could have said that night was "im happy"
I like this popeyes food is always good staff are nice and quick as well. No complaints here.

Put on order with  Postmates I said it will take about 30 minutes received a notification for Postmates on my orders taking longer than usual call the restaurant seven times until someone finally answered and all they did was put the phone down and all I heard was noise in the background trying to figure out what's going on with my order the delivery person from Postmates was waiting there for a long time and I cannot even get anyone to talk I will be taking this up with corporate of Popeyes
Great tasting affordable food

name: Dunkin'
reviews: Great decor.. Menu could use a few more vegan options, though.. Food and service usually excellent!
Good place for something fast and cold and delicious ...

Probably my all time favorite Dunkins. I just love the folks here who make this place very welcoming. If you visit, please don't try to turn this place into Starbucks and hog the outlets after only buying one small coffee.
Sometimes the product is too sweet. Specially the pumps of sweet flavors. But meh, you might like it that way, they also dont have nasty attitudes like in other places.
Time to make the donuts good coffee clean place

name: Archie's Bar & Pizza
reviews: Deep dish pizza and awful delivery service. I’m born and raised in Manhattan and yet I’ve been ordering for 5 years from here hoping it’d get better - if your pizza gets to you in less than 2 hours, you’re lucky. I just now waited nearly 3 hours to be told the driver *might* have it - completely unapologetic. My options were to get a refund (after waiting for food all this time) or to receive now hours old pizza. This ain’t it.
I’ve only had this pizza twice (once after a long drunk night, once sober as can be) and it’s still a banger. The delivery was so quick too! 10/10, would recommend for any occasion :’)

Why pay twice as much for doughy, soft, thick crusted pan pizza? For the vibe. It’s social, local & homey. And if this style pizza is your jam then give it 5 stars. I’ll go back some time but probably just for the fruity IPA, which is excellent. But it’s not the NYC style pizza I crave when I’m away for a while.
Not NY style but I think NE style pizza. However it was pretty darn tasty. The restaurant bar is small but clean. The bartender was very nice and attentive. Go get yourself a pie!

A pleasant surprise.  We were underwhelmed by another nearby highly touted  pizza place and decided To walk 5 min  give Archie's a try.  Cool little place with airy yeasty pizza.  Sort of in between a Sicilian and neopolitan in style.  Light, sweet and airy.  The clam pie was a hit.  Nice staff too.   Balance was achieved, we had great expectations for the previous place that weren't met and we had no expectations here and found a hit.

name: Mama Mecho
reviews: Classic Dominican home style dishes. Great service, fresh food. It is always a pleasure to have a lunch there. Keep it up!
Best PorkChops in Brooklyn!
Awesome breakfast.  Definitely stop by for an awesome, home cooked, inexpensive bite.
Great prices for lunch special

Amazing Caribbean Food! 

My favorite place around for comfort food. 

I work in the neighborhood, and always come here for lunch, never fails to hit the spot. 

I hope they’ll always be around ♥️

name: Not for Profit Pictures
reviews: I love this place a lot. there is a friendly air. The food is wonderful. the service is dynamic and the team is professional. The price is satisfactory. greatly recommend.

name: Mally's Deli
reviews: One of my stand bys for solid food and great service. 6 years for me and they keep making great food!
One of my favorite Bushwick Mexican spots. They make their taco shells fresh for each order and they're fantastic. I come here at least once a week.
Delicious tacos - they understand the importance of nicely charring the meat! The salsas are also great :D
Really really really solid. Have been searching for a spot like this since I’ve been in Brooklyn 6+ years.

This is my everyday favorite!!! I always call from work to deliver and they are fast. I even have them on my speed dial. They really care about clients getting food on time and warm. Thank you Mally's!! You guys are the best!!! I've tried their tacos (deluxe), flautas, posole, tortas, gorditas and I always come back to them. They never disappoint. The green sauce is the best!! Keep up the good job !! 
No tengo mucho que decir, es uno de mis lugares favoritos. Son muy amables y rápidos. La sazón me encanta y la salsa verde es de mis favoritas. Y las tortillas. simplemente mis favoritas.

name: L.A. Burrito
reviews:
I'm honestly shocked at what was just delivered considering all the good reviews...
I just found a hair in my chili (pic included) & they sent me a steak burrito instead of the chicken burrito I ordered.
Yep...
Huge menu, and a wider assortment of flavors than most spots around the neighborhood. Sometimes you just want that chili burrito!

New favorite neighborhood spot for tacos!! 🌮 Fresh, tasty, speedy and cheap!!! They have several vegetarian options, like soy cheese quesadillas and tofu sour cream. Their veggie taco can be made with pinto or black beans with grilled vegetables, spinach or broccoli. Finally, they sell fresh guacamole, to go!! Fast service and all the guys are super friendly!

Loved this place, the burritos we're definitely on par with the popular franchise. Size was actually huge. There was a lot of variety for most of their products. Tables and floors were clean. Nice cashier

I ordered tacos and my friend ordered a burrito to go. There was not anything in particular about the food that made it ascend from any other average Mexican food place but for the price point it was decent. For a quick stop it was suffice but to dine in and eat I would vote against it.

name: La Perla Del Ulua
reviews: It was my first time trying Honduran food,and they definitely didn't disappoint. Can't remember what's the name but it was fried chicken on top of cabbage and green plantatains.
This is a place my uncle created. The food is really good, the place is a bit small. The only problem is the bathroom it's too small!
QUE RICO LA COMIDA!! This food is so good and reminded me of home by the water. I loved being here and I'm so glad there's an authentic houndran place so close to home.  GRACIAS.
I had the beef steak with marinated onions and delicious salad along with tamarind juice to live for. The chef knows how to throw it down. Pleasure of food at least to meeeee

I just didn't like the restaurant. Is clean but missing some charm. 
I request from the menu a red beans soup and i was told didn't have it. So i got upset. The waiter when to the kitchen and came back and say to me the cook will make it for you. That i gave the cook 100 stars, it was so but so delicious. Highly recommend the restaurant because the cook when out of the way to pleased me. I NEVER had this type of service in a Honduras restaurant.

name: The Little Whiskey
reviews: The bartenders are great! Colin and Alan both make it entertaining. I first learned of spicy pickle backs here. $6 dollar beer/shot specials. This is a fantastic family venue ;)
Little Whiskey is the best. The bartenders are all awesome. Great grilled cheeseses 😎
I really liked the feel of this bar, and the Whiskey Flights had cheeky names. It was a wonderful experience, and I'll gladly go back whenever I'm in Brooklyn again.
Great bar. Great bartender. Nice people. Amazing music. Would recommend.
Great place great bar tender !

name: La Loncheria
reviews: Nice surprise in the neighborhood. Good happy hour specials and wonderful food.
Nice atmosphere. However, we ordered the chips with Guacamole. The chips was so old and the bartender noticed, agreed and still charge that dish. They def need to work om their customer service.
$6 margaritas for happy hour can't be beaten.
Great food service and drinks.
Absolutely excellent. Every bit of food was delicious and prepared in a way I hadn’t had before. and the owner is a really great guy and obviously cares deeply about his place. Ten stars.

name: Tabaré Restaurant Bushwick
reviews: The food was amazing I tried the skirt steak . Environment was calm lights where very dim was an intimate setting. My food came out in a timely manner which was big plus. This resturant is cash only that was an inconvenience for me. But other than that everything was great.
Loved this new place! Really great food and good drinks.. there's some vegeterian options too!
The food is the best part but the ambience and decorations are out of this world. You can spend years enjoying the view and the food and you will always find something new and exciting.

The location is good, the ambiance and vibe of the restaurant is better, however.. The service and experience was not worth the wait or cost. We Waited for our reserved seats, ( during that time we attempted to get a glass of wine  at the bar to kill time, but the bartender did not once acknowledge us or anyone at the bar for that matter.)  once seated we then waited about 15 minutes ( no exxageration)  for anyone to approach us and even ask if we wanted water.  The next issue is we couldn't even tell who was a hostess , waiter, server or the manager. ( we had different people attend our table the entire time ) Waited another10 minutes for bread and to be asked if we were ready to order.  Then they  ran out of the octopus which was a bummer, but later in the evening when a waiter was taking orders from the couple next to us they had even less to offer them as we overheard " we ran out of that also" a few times ( felt bad for that couple) . The soup was terrible, the oysters were a bit greasy but decent, the lamb shank was very good, however the Lobster ...someone should be put in jail for how little meat and unsettling taste it came with..not to mention no proper utensils to properly break open claws just a big steak knife. My partner couldn't  even finish with the mess and smell. We had to ask for it to be taken away. It was obvious the restaurant had issues .. an employee (who seemed to possibly be a manager or owner) knew to voluntarily  come over and say " I do apologize for everything this evening. We didn't expect everyone to show up at the same time." I simply said thanks and smiled  ..however what kind of excuse is "We didnt expect everyone to show up at the same time to a couple who had a reservation"??

unfortunate and bad experience I do not recommend for the price of dinner we could have gone and had way better quality, service , portions.
I DO NOT RECOMMEND.
The food was very.  The bartender was amazing.  Very attentive and on point.  The atmosphere is great in there.  Love it.

name: Yia Yia's Taverna
reviews:
I found this gem of a restaurant on Google and was very intrigued by the high rating and great reviews. After my first visit, I can say from personal experience that those reviews were ON POINT!

If I could give Yia Yia's more stars, I would.

The place is casual but beautiful. The staff were super friendly and attentive. The food tastes fresh and delicious. My Sangria was satisfying and served in a cute way. 

I was visiting with a friend and we both loved the experience and plan to bring our spouse's and family here. 

Can't wait to go back!

The food was excellent. We ordered fried calamari as an appetizer and I opted for the gyro plate as my entree. Both were delicious. The staff is very kind and accommodating. The atmosphere is great, with Greek music playing and a nice cozy vibe. Will definitely be returning.

The hidden gem in NYC Brooklyn/ Best VALUE FOOD IN NYC!!!
Been there now three times and as a somebody who loves Traditional Greek food and lives in Greece, I can guarantee authentic Greek Cuisine! As soon as you arrive, they serve water and being delicious grilled pita bread with olives. This place is GREECE in a nutshell...simple, tasty and incredible value for money! You have Greek radio playing in the back ground, service is fast and very friendly. The google ratings are really well deserved!
Have tried most of the Greek restaurants in NYC over the years including the “top-rated-overly expensive ones” but nothing compares to Yia Yia’s Tarverna (Grand Mother’s Tavern) ad the food is cooked with passion!
Even if I never take a mixed grill, for 27$ we ate so much and still had to take the rest home!  The area where the place is located is very vibrant with loads of little resto’s and bars in the hood.

Excellent authentic Greek food. Lots of small hot and cold appetizers and dips. There are so many vegan and vegetarian options on the menu. They are clearly labeled on the regular menu which I love. The owner and wait staff is incredible kind and sweet and attentive. This is a must check out in the neighborhood!

Yia Yia’s is a special place. Not only is there food delicious but everyone is so nice and friendly there. Everything is so fresh, and the space is inviting and has an understated classiness. When I lived nearby I’d order takeout from them on a regular basis, and now when I’m in the area and want Greek this is the obvious choice. There’s an outdoor area in back too that I’m very interested in during the warmer seasons.

name: Sweet Chili: Cuisine - Thai, Vietnamese, Asian, Southeast Asian
reviews:
Went here at the opening night.

Best pork belly I've ever had in my life. Was so soft and flavorful, and it really worked well with the crispness of the side vegetables. 

Really awesome restaurant and I can't wait for an opportunity for me to commute back and see the changes and try out the bar!

A lot of tasty stuff here.  The "Spicy Bacon & Peanut Bites" were something special, really intense amount of flavor packed into one spoon.  The cocktails were fun too, a Pho cocktail and a Pad Thai cocktail, both quite creative and intriguing.  The ambience is alright, would like to hear some different dance music (was a bit too festival EDM for my taste), but the spot is definitely a welcomed addition to the area and I'm excited to see how it evolves.  Fantastic service too, our server was bringing the good energy!

Great food. Can’t go wrong with anything on the menu. Highlights are the happy hour scallion pancakes, the dumplings, pad Thai, red curry shrimp and pork belly!  Also really inventive and delicious cocktails. Awesome service with very friendly staff!

Cozy, vibrant, and, most importantly, delicious. My wife and I couldn't get enough. If you have room for it, definitely grab a side of the maple bacon or bok choy. Interesting flavors in a place you feel cool hanging out in. Highly recommended!

This place is simply amazing! I tried both menus (brunch & dinner) and the fact of having a mix of sweet, sour, spicy and crunchy in EACH dish is just clever and deliciously good. To me, it’s like Mission Chinese but way cheaper ! Excited to become a regular of this neighbourhood spot.

name: Norwind's
reviews: Awesome service. Nice atmosphere.  Nice office type casual bar as well.  Food is good. They definitely made a new person there like me feel at home.  I would definitely go there again.

This spot is really nice, I was invited by some friends in the area and it was a great suggestion. I was introduced to "Henny Sangria" which I now make at home. The food was great, I had the chicken & waffles which I recommend (this was brunch by the way). I'm looking forward to coming back in the summer as I'm told the back outside area is open, I shall return.
Food is delicious. Ive tried a few things,never disappoint. area in the back is great for parties or big group dinners. henny sangria is good too
The Plantain with the steak was good not out standing the price a little to high but it was good.
Amazing sangria! Chill atmosphere! Great food! Great music!

name: EL SANTO TAQUERIA BROOKLYN
reviews: Great food but a fun vibe as well. Especially nice in summer when the windows are fully open. Always a good place to catch sport too. Beer selection is great and always served in chilled glasses which is a nice touch.

An awesome spot to come and enjoy a Mexican dish and their amazing variety of cocktails definitely will get the job done with just one of their drinks. Environment is very welcoming and great selection of music. Will be coming again here.
This place is incredible! The menu is well-priced; the food and the drinks are amazing. The staff was super friendly, fun, and upbeat. I loved the atmosphere and the music as well.
I absolutely love this place. Burritos are so good you forget you’re in NY and think you’re in Mexico for a second. Let’s also not forget the $2 Pacifico DRAUGHTS!!!
Had wonderful time here with friends. The bartender katherine was incredibly attentive to us. Food was spot on a very reasonably priced. Definitely going there again....

name: Dublin’ Donuts
reviews: Great place

name: Omakase Ajihei
reviews: Mellow atmosphere with a cool vibe. The owner seems to be doing it all alone so it’s nice to see a hands on owner but also can be a down fall for when it gets busy. Seating is nice but not a lot of places for big groups. The ramen was super good! Lots of flavor with a perfectly cooked egg. I would definitely recommend this place for people to try.
The most authentic sushi in the neighborhood. If you want REAL, traditional, Japanese-level sushi, this is the only place to go. It's worth the price! The man knows what he is doing.

Not really tasty. Very homey food. The ramen was below average. Salty but no depth of flavor. Sake was alright, but not the best I’ve had by far. I was amazed that the owner was doing everything himself. He should definitely hire at least someone to help himself out.

If you’re picking this place instead of Ichiran, the taste isn’t comparable, but it is much cheaper here.

Love the sign outside stating “slow food, slow service” because it is operated by one man that knows what he is doing. The menu is right sized and so are the prices. A great bowl of ramen will run you $14 and it’s loaded with flavor and noodles. The service is simple and humble. Would recommend for a first date or a couples “date spot.” Will 100% be back.

Everyone knows it's slow and only one person does EVERYTHING!  So go when it's dead. Sushi was disappointing as pieces were small. Ramen was great tho. The guy who runs it didn't say a single word to us, so don't expect good service.

name: Abracadabra Magic Deli
reviews: The pastries are fresh and exquisite.  The coffee is great and there are a ton of vegan food options.  My main reason for writing this review is to tell everyone about their hot sauce.  It’s $10 and it comes in a small mason jar and it’s INCREDIBLE.  I found myself in my underwear in my kitchen at 11pm dipping triscuits directly into the sauce and just munching.  Great place!

Love this little treasure. Beautifully decorated with their personality shining through. Great menu offerings and handmade treats in the display window. Friendly owner + service. Excited to come back and support this local business!

What a lovely place! New favorite restaurant/cafe. Staff is very friendly, great vibes all over, smells amazing. Everything was delicious- the lentil balls and the golden milk were top. Gluten free and vegan options abound and impress. Awesome coffee! Can’t wait to come back and try something else.

I don't come to Brooklyn often but this spot was super great. The swings caught my attention but I loved the staff the most. I accidentally spilled my coffee and they rushed to clean it and got me a new one free of charge. Great people, great vibe.

On of the best spot in the neighborhood.  
The interior design is so amazing, that it made me forget for a moment, that my troubles. The sits in the bar are swings, how sweet it is. 
The food is super nice and well priced. On the  of a reach menu, you can amazing Turkish desserts, like Baklava, Turkish Delight and more. 
The owner is super friendly and the music is fun.

name: Carmenta’s
reviews: Great Italian spot in the hood. Sandwich was great my bf is 100% Italian and he loved it! The rice balls is crunchy outside and soft inside. I love the pasta and the Raku sauce. 5 stars from us! Definitely come back!

Terrific entree and sandwich cuisine.  Carmenta's is a small cafe-type eatery that reminds you of going into grandma's kitchen and dining with family. The pastas/sauces are to die for, soups, sandwiches and homemade orange-fennel pollen cake  WOW ☆☆☆☆☆
Outstanding. Very small seating but pay a visit and take home a great meal. Dominick and his staff treat you like Uncle Tony and your cousins would. You will not be disappointed

My girlfriend and I came from New Mexico to the big apple to experience 5 days of good food and sites.  We had some very good meals, some at places with lines waiting for them to open, at places raved about in books and TV shows, at places that cost over $200 for the two of us.  It didn't take long into our meal at Carmenta's to both agree that this was our favorite meal of our trip.  No joke.  Excellent pasta and bread.  Friendly guys.
I dare say some of the best rigatoni vodka I’ve ever had. The cacio e Pepe was also delicious, as well as the rice balls. So yummy and very quick service.
Very solid homemade pasta place. Not much room to sit, but the food is amazing. Very fresh pasta made right in front of you. Great flavors. The Mafalde and Meatball sandwich are the winners.

name: Leslie's Kitchen
reviews: Ordered online, went to pickup inside. Nice little place, comfortable and spacious. Service was quick and friendly. Ordered the wings and seasoned fries. The fries were great, but the wings, not so much. Not the best I've ever had, and not the worst either, but pretty mediocre. Maybe it's not their specialty. The other patrons seemed to be enjoying their meals, so I'll have to switch up my order next time probably.

Nice spot with great food. The chorizo mac & cheese was super cheesy but needed salt (& the chorizo flavor is almost nonexistent), & the French onion soup is too much on the sweeter side for my taste (but having a thick layer of cheese on the side of bread instead of putting those things in the soup was interesting), but the salmon was absolutely perfect. Definitely worth it. Great portions and presentation. I hope this place is around for awhile.

We ended up here because our first choice was too busy.  I’m so glad we did!  The food was delicious with piping hot, crispy french fries.  We had burgers, pulled pork and shrimp tacos.  Everything was excellent.  And service was great too!
Secretly don't want more people to know this place so it doesn't become more crowded. Brunch bowl is delicious; pulled pork sandwich, brunch burger are all great. Fast and courteous service.

People it is important that you understand that you simply cannot go wrong with anything on this menu. My personal favorite is the burrito and I can honestly say that I've never had a better one anywhere.

name: 191 Knickerbocker
reviews: I really like this place. I really like the vibe, the food and the service. The mac and cheese was great, and so was the sangria. My first time was for dinner, hoping the next visit will be for lunch or brunch, and the atmosphere stays the same.
The best,  absolute best. Jesse and Rona the owners are Gems plus the help in this rough time. Lets all celebrate here after. Thanks 191

191 has my favorite things. A delicious burger that I can barely finish. Crispy Sweet Potato fries! A Beet salad with goat cheese and walnuts! Housemade crafted cocktails.  A relaxed environment filled with locals. Welcoming staff. Owners who care about the community and its development of business, art, and culture! All wonderful things to support. So, go for the food and stay for the experience!

This place is AMAZING! The burger was one of the best I’ve had, delicious and massive! The prices are perfect for the big amount of food you get. Fun playlist and bar seating with an atmosphere filled with local artists’ work. The owners are very friendly and EVERYTHING on the menu is awesome, can’t go wrong! 🤤

The place has a friendly environment with good vibes. The music selection was very chill. Their syrup was very unique, a good formula. The waiter was super friendly and attentive to our needs and accommodating. Food is a bit overpriced, but you won't regret the investment after you had meal.

name: King Gourmet Deli
reviews: Good the best philly cheesesteak the best cheeseburgers five stars oh I love it every day I'm here
Very good store 24 /7
Cheap good coffee, cheap good pastries. Made my morning search for nutrition that much easier.
Tasteful Spot to grub rea quick #chopChz
Went down badly old managers/bosses where better

name: No. 1 Chinese Restaurant
reviews: I had sesame chicken that was sooo good here before. I really like the crab rangoon as well. Very fast and friendly service for pick up.
Bad Customer service,  Great Wonton Soup

Just pass by this neighborhood, first time here. Food price is decent, and it's more tasty than the similar Chinese restaurant. Shrimp lo mein has a little bit of smoked flavor, rather than the plain flavor like in some other Chinese restaurants. Except the area looks like a bit concerned to me, other than that are all good.

This place doesn't care what the special instructions say, I told the 6 soy sauce and 6 duck sauce,  they send one of each.  I couldn't even eat my food.  WILL NEVER ORDER FROM THEM AGAIN!  I MEAN WAS THAT SUCH A HARD INSTRUCTION!!!!!!
I like the food and i would like to give this a 5/5

name: Leos restaurant
reviews: Went here on a spur of the moment but was pleasantly surprised. The food is fresh and made to order. The guy was nice and pretty chill. The place is pretty quiet and not much to look at but that for me doesn’t mean anything as long as the food is good. We got a Torta milanesa and it was really tasty. The bread was fresh and the chicken was good quality. We also got two tacos the al pastor was so good with their green salsa but the chorizo was a busy just not flavor. But definitely will go again and try the rest of their food. They had so much variety.

Very rude and unprofessional. Called to order food and they pretended like I didn’t speak English. When I tried to order in Spanish the person on the phone pretended to not understand and started speaking in English. Then when I spoke in English the person who answered the phone started screaming quien es? Multiple times as the men in the back laughed. Disgusting.
Ordered delivery. Fast, accurate, fresh. Taco Placero was delicious. I’m hooked.
This place has the BEST tacos

I came here for the first time on a Saturday night at around 1:30AM with a sober hankering for Mexican food. Growing up Mexican in Southern California, I have to vouch for the good food. It’s one of the better Mexican joints I’ve had in NYC thus far.

However, the guy ringing everyone up kept eyeballing and overcharging everyone. He pulled the same with me and I just wrote it off as his tip but it rubbed me the wrong way to continue watching it happen and use a poor excuse whenever he’d get called out on it. Be aware.

name: Bushwick Bakery
reviews: It’s a nice little spot to grab and go. I had one of their chocolate croissants.  Staff was friendly enough.
4.50 croissant, egg, and cheese? Great selection, atmosphere, location, and the only bakery of its kind in Bushwick.

The tardiness of placing an order and receiving is the biggest critique. Staff has a  
laissez faire attitude to serving you something as simple as a BLT. 15 mins and I’m the only customer. It takes that time plus some before I mention it. And when I do then my order get attended too. I’m tall enough to look into the kitchen. Poor customer service just not worth your time. Food great but service is piss poor.
Friendly staff, cozy and great coffee. I love that this feels like my neighborhood spot. I get an americano every time and I tried the croissant yesterday. Fresh and tasty !
Authentic goods and quick coffee.... a delightful neighborhood gem

name: Kávé Espresso Bar
reviews: The lighting is dim, good for talking or.. meditation. Coffee is okay
Super chill vibes. Way bigger inside and there is an outdoor space. The maple tofu sandwich is fire!

Looks like a storage closet from the outside but when you walk inside it’s a cafe miracle. Love the chill vibes inside with the plants. Lots of space to sit down and get work done or read. Had the oat milk latte and this was delicious.

I work down at Kave all the time, and it's marvelous. Huge outdoor area with plants and dogs wandering about, really good coffee, as well as a big artisanal kombucha selection and a bunch of vegan lunch options. Get the green tea and lemon cookie for sure. And if you're passing through and want to work and already have your beverage of choice, there are comfy chairs and tables outside the coffee shop for all comers!
Great coffee place, pay attention because entrance is very small and it’s just a green door!!

name: Central Cafe Brooklyn
reviews:
The place is super friendly and cozy, I had the bagel with the scramble eggs and pepper - so good. 
The coffee is nice, not as good as some other places, but definitely good enough for me. 
I really recommend the place is super chill and friendly, try one if there bagels, it is good.

A cozy and welcoming cafe I appreciate the staff speaks Spanish and English. The atmosphere is cozy the breakfast sandwich was good and coffee pretty tasty. I feel the prices are a little high but then again I understand what they are doing when it comes to the market they are targeting.

Cute place, good coffee , awesome sandwiches , but they take forever to make the sandwiches. If you are in a rush or need to keep it moving this is not the place to grab something and go. I hope it gets better because it takes away from the wonderful experience that one can have.
Lovely little French bakery. Good croissants. Cute benches outside to sit in the sunlight.
Great place to relax, have a cup of tea and study or spend some time with friends. Super comfy seating.

name: SEY COFFEE
reviews: The lattes were DELICIOUS! Very smooth, and came with some sparkling water on a cute tray. We hung around for a while; on a Saturday around 1, it was packed the whole time we were there. Also, it’s dog friendly, so we got to smile at all the cute dogs walking in. It’s a bit out of the way, but if I’m in the area again will definitely go back.

My coffee experience here was top notch! The location is good, it's in a trendy part of town. the presentation is absolutely beautiful, and they put a lot of care into the craft of making really delicious coffee. Lots of single-origin beans, and a transparent model so that you know that the cost of your drinking is quality and ethically sourced. this is a place for people who actually enjoy drinking coffee, and not just drinking a bunch of flavorings. Also a great place to sit and read or get work done.

cute place. friendly people. oat milk latte was just average. well made, but the coffee just wasn’t flavorful. great natural light but the seats weren’t comfortable enough to want to stay long. nice for a 30 min work sesh though.

THIS IS THE REAL DEAL. No doubt the best specialty coffee shop in NYC. It's far away from the buzz, but so worth it. I've worked in the specialty coffee industry and know all the big names and Sey made it on to my all time favorites. Staff was lovely. The interior is stunning and the coffee fantastic (filter, Ecuador).

Sey coffee is quite the minimal cute coffee shop with plants that you have been looking for. Rock your snazziest look and sip their yummy lattes and you will feel like you are in a short film. Staff seems nice. Mostly a lot of room for seating. Prices are a little higher than the average coffee shop, but it’s pretty good and the space is awesome.

name: Your Way Cafe
reviews: I love their coffee and breakfast all day. They have a lot of options. Customer service is always great. I enjoy their music playlist and tranquil environment during my lunch hour.
Excellent lattes and coffee in general. Fresh pressed OJ, good eggs and breakfast burrito. Cute, spacious cafe. Generous with their WiFi.

"Your Way"? Maybe if your way is below mediocre. I just wanted something simple, ordered a bagel and coffee. They only had two bagel options, cinnamon and pumpernickel(and they're a breakfast spot?). I asked for it to be toasted. It took almost an hour and it wasn't even toasted. Hardly had an onion or capers on it. I paid $18 for this!!! What a waste. 
3 stars because I know the difficulties of working in a cafe and I'm sure they aren't always this bad and the food delivery person was sweet. I'm still mad though. And, as a Jew, I'm not coming here for bagels. But the coffee is really good.

Cosy and super friendly place with very affordable and tasty bagels, sandwiches, wraps and breakfast options. Selection of coffee/tea and juices. Definitely a go-to for studying,  relaxing or just treat yourself to some amazing food and/or coffee.

They've made it my way each time, so far. I usually get a roll with egg and bacon. Today I tried an everything bagel with egg and bacon. It sounds like a simple meal but you'd be surprised how many places screw this up. Also, with my meal I get a small cappuccino and it's made perfectly. The frothing is to die for. Find your way to Your Way Cafe for some delicious food and smoothies. Vegan treats can be found here as well.

name: Club de Nutrición Pruebalo que es Bueno
reviews: They attend you very well

name: Foster Sundry
reviews:
I can't express just how indispensable this wonderful little place has become to my daily life—Foster Sundry was literally one of the reasons why I wanted to move here! Seriously!!

The cheese selection is one of the best in New York that I've encountered. The meats, including sausages, poultry, beef (that's what I've tried so far) are sourced locally, carefully, and just excellent. The staff are great, the vibe and decor charming and wonderful. Sure, it's perhaps a little pricey to go here everyday (I do anyway!) but boy is it worth it if you care about what you eat and drink as much as I do. I LOVE this place, and totally subscribe to all the values & ethics that underpin it. Please open a wine shop too!
Wonderful spot with artisan foods, amazing meats, cheeses and coffee. The sausage, egg and cheese biscuit was superb. Brooklyn is lucky to have this place!

BEST store!!! There were so many amazing specialty items to choose from. Their bread and meat selection is great. Cheese selection was impressive. Everything is so fresh. Friendly and helpful staff. Cinnamon Roll....game changer.

For a pretty small shop, there’s so much cool stuff. It’s like a grocery store, but they only stock it with the best of the best. No filler. What really caught my eye was the to-go craft beer selection. Also, I tried their breakfast burrito and it was crazy good. I even found some fun gift ideas for friends. It’s hard to describe this place, you just need to go check it out for yourself.

If you like steak and cheese sandwiches, look no further because ‘The Marv’ is the best of the best. Delicious bread, generous helping of juicy meat, just the right amount of condiments, and the staff let me choose another cheese. 

The drip coffee tasted off, or maybe it was the oat milk I added.

Claim your seating before you order - the dining area is limited and people tend to linger.

name: OfficeOps
reviews: I lived in these lofts for 6 months and had a great experience.  Only reason I moved out is because I prefer to be back in the city.  Hannah and Kevin (landlords) were extremely accommodating and easy going--which made a huge impact on my time there.  The loft/apartment itself was great--tons of light (plant lovers!) and tons of space.  My unit was north facing, so had a great view of the city and LIC from the living room and from my bedroom.  Neighbors were all friendly.  Rooftop absolutely huge and is a great bonus.
I attended a Rooftop Cinema Club event. Great organization, beautiful sunset, headphones and amazing movie. It was everything I could wish for. Thanks!
I visited here to see rooftop movie, and I could see beautiful sunset and nightview, watching the movie.
I’m living in Duncan Ford’s apartment (see review below) and can confirm it is a great space.

I've been a tenant here for over a year now and I would say I really enjoy living here. Well, it suits my taste, my life and close to the subways and simply a fun area to be in. If you like eccentric loft spaces with vast open areas and huge windows, tall ceilings then this building offers some of the most unique opportunities. It seems to me that management genuinely care about the property and try their best to keep it safe and clean. There is a sense of community which is cool and refreshing in NYC. I'm also one of those New Yorkers that bounced around all over the city..and I would say this is one of the more authentic and unique NYC living spaces I have come across. YMMV.

name: Gallery Petite Bushwick Contemporary Underground Artists
La Finca Garden
reviews: kool Spot

name: El Garden
reviews: El Garden is an inviting and relaxing place to spend an afternoon, especially when the plants are in full bloom.
Sabe carne truda

name: Arepera Guacuco
reviews: Food was AMAZING!!!!! Cannot complain about the service, the atmosphere was very clean and the server was super friendly. I was just a bit disappointed in the portions to price ratio. For that reason I have to give them 4 stars. Of the portions were bigger or if the price was a bit cheaper, I would have given them 5 stars. Trust and believe this food is beyond AMAZING!!! Highly recommend the shredded chicken or the beef with sweet plantains + beans.
Place was very cozy. Food portions was plenty and delicious. Friendly atmosphere. Not too expensive. Service was excellent. Would highly recommend this place

This place just became my number ONE venezuelan place. My spirit came out when i was eating this food. The arepa touched my heart and soul. The service was great, the waitress was very very very friendly. The smell pf the food makes you think you are in another country. Absolutely loved it
Really good pernil arepas and cocanada! Fast and good service

I LOVE this restaurant. The arepitas fritas are my favorite. I also enjoy the carne mechada empanadas and cocada. Delivery is prompt and the customer service has been excellent on several different occasions.

name: El Burro Mexican Grill
reviews: Best place to eat in Brooklyn so authentic. Takes sometimes longer then expected  but the food is prepared as orders go in so it’s fresh. The price is definitely worth it! If I could tell everyone to eat here I would because they would be missing on the best authentic Mexican food, I would recommend this place to everyone and the soups are good too and fresh too. I’ve been ordering from some time now
I love the FOOD HERE 100% autenthic mexican platters best in bushwick a little bit pricy but worth it , to make it better they been here for years so they know what there cutomers like ,

I took one bite and couldn’t eat anymore. My quesadilla looked and tasted like a tortilla with a mayonnaise spread, shredded lettuce served on a moist paper plate. Might I add cold. The soup looked like tap water and chicken. The cabbage in the soup, don’t know who puts cabbage in soup, was raw and cold. The other veggies were just as undercooked. So from the transparent soup water to the early 2000’s public school worthy quesadilla I deserve my money back.

This place  burro Mexican Grill is really a nice place.
You need to come here and eat with your friend's and family. 
I like this place it was really nice I'm coming back.
Best place ever park close varias MTA busses and trains. Plus great food overall recommend to everyone

name: Mominette Bistro
reviews: I meet with friends this lovely place from time to time! This is my favorite place to have a bite.  I go there frequently. The meals are of high quality, the staff is welcoming and the price is good. I like meeting in this restaurant over a nice supper.

Cute, cozy brunch spot. Waited 20 minutes for a table but it was worth it! Food is well-made, portions aren’t too big or small. Wait staff is very polite, nice, courteous. Great place to chill with friends

I adore this spot! They serve decent food, their menu is decent, The chef in that restaurant is an expert, I enjoy very much eating all their food. The food is consistently of high class, the attitude towards the visitors  is nice. I  go often to this place and I not even once was unhappy.  I highly recommend it.

I meet friends in this nice place often! This is the best place to grab a bite.  I visit this place many times. The meals are just great, the crew is polite and the payment is decent. I like going in this spot over a tasty supper.

This is the best spot in Bushwick. I've never had Norwegian eggs Benedict before and it was DELICIOUS. They had mimosa's by the pitcher and a good set of options. The wife had french toast that was covered in fruit and amazing.

They're cash forward and pass the cc fees onto the customer but whatever.

name: GreenStreets Salads
reviews: Love this place! Can’t go wrong with a “make your own salad”. More options and cheaper/tastier than sweetgreen!
Party Pat gave this place majic still good tho
A great place to eat fresh salad with a side of soup
Slightly expensive but good quality and fast service

Love this place. Our go to here is the Buffalo chicken salad. Hands down our favorite. You can also call in advance and pick it up if you have a kid in tow or if you wanna dine at Maria Hernandez park ;)

name: Wok 2 Bar
reviews: Great service , everything looks clean and delicious food .
Really good food , super friendly dude, chef/owner/bartender? I'm not sure , all the same definitely worth a visit. Got a full bar in the back too !
I miss this ppace great service and the owner is amazingly king food is awesome
The food is amazing! deff try the coconut curry sauce.
Delicious food, great options and very quick. And the staff are so welcoming!

name: New City
reviews:
Especially high quality Chinese delivery food. The menu is about what you'd expect for Chinese delivery in the USA, but the food is much more flavorful and more carefully prepared than what you tend to find, especially at midnight.

Will this food rock your world with its exquisite flavor and preparation? Probably not. Will it make you happy at a very reasonable price? Absolutely.
This place is an unexpected treasure. The food is delicious & high quality. The staff are incredibly friendly. Try the pulled noodles with seafood soup.
Excellent food. Open late. Head and shoulders above similar local options/competition. Fast delivery. Courteous staff.
Cheap delicious Chinese food. Please tip.
Quick and delicious fast food restaurant that delivers.

name: El Kucho Mexican Restaurant
reviews: The food was very tasty, fresh, offered many options and the vegetarian options were very good. I am a bit sensitive to spice. I can handle and enjoy a little, however many of the foods tested my threshold more than I was prepared for. The lighting could be a little softer in evening time. Overall a very cute spot to visit and would recommend to anyone.
Really good and visually beautiful Mexican food and friendly service. Fully recommend!
I love this place. Me and boyfriend come here once a week to eat there yummy Mexican food and drink. The environment is nice and relaxing.
I eat here a lot since I work close by. I love how the service is always awesome and they keep the place clean constantly. Pricing is fair and they serve generous portions.
So far, the best Mexican Food place in Brooklyn. The space is not that big, but usually it isnt that crowded. Love their Tacos, Fajitas, Enchiladas and more! Definitely going back

name: Itzel's Taqueria Deli
reviews: After waiting one and a half hours for a delivery, I was brought the wrong order, called and complained, an hour and fifteen minutes later still waiting for the right order to be delivered. Never ordering from here again.
Best nachos in Bushwick! Affordable and delicious! Also very nice people working there!
I ordered from here about 5 times in the past with no issues. Today no one ever came. Called the number and they said they would call me back. Still waiting. I won't be ordering here again.
Ordered through grubhub and the order was never delivered. Called grubhub and the lady said she will call me back. Still waiting.
Never delivered

name: Taqueri sofia Mexican restaurant
reviews:
This are the best nachos I have ever eaten in my life. Order the nachos al pastor and you wont regret it, trust. Also, they’re huge so you could easily share them with another person and both of you would be satisfied. 

Also the people working there were super nice so I really recommend. Just keep in mins the place is tiny so it can get crowded easily.

Hands down our favorite spot in bushwick. Seriously good authentic Mexican food. We love it, feels like we are right back in DF, Mexico City. The staff is always friendly, the food is always spot on and the al pastor tacos with their homemade avocado salsa is insanely delicious. Gracias por todo taqueria Sofía. 🔥 🌮

If you're looking for authentic Mexican this spot is legit HOWEVER they have horrible customer service. They're customer service is lacking so poorly it's not worth the time or money. First strike was trying to order food when the person taking my order didn't speak English, don't get me wrong I support legal immigrants but if you're hiring people who can't actually do the job it's a reflection of your business. Second strike was ordering delivery and AGAIN the employee on the phone didn't speak English, I tried placing my order they acted like they understood what I was saying and before getting off the phone I asked don't you need my apartment number? They hung up on me and I knew I was getting that delivery. Final strike, ordering a burrito for one, they have a card minimum, but they have let me use my card MULTIPLE TIMES below the minimum fee and I would tip them so it would reach that minimum fee. So I ordered the same item again and they wouldn't take my card although they've done it before. Instead of making a sale they lost that sale along with the money they used to make that item. Most importantly they lost a reoccurring customer. I've worked in hospitality for thirteen years, it's safe to say Taqueria Sofia ya'll chupar (suck in Spanish).
Best chilaquiles in New York; hands down—got mine al pastor. Great service as well
LOVE coming here when i have a big appetite and craving💛

name: Amaranto
reviews: Very cute place, lovely service. Delicious steak and short ribs. A real neighborhood find. So good! Recommended 💯

Delicious food. We tried steak and chicken tacos and steak burrito. It was super tasty. I would suggest putting two pieces of bread for the tacos because it melts easily. 
I took one star because the service is so slow other than that the place is worth trying.

I love this place. Fantastic service, very friendly, very reasonably priced, and some of the best food I've had in NYC. I've never had Mexican food like this anywhere else (and I eat out and travel a lot).

I've had 7 of their dishes and every single one was amazing. Their meat is cooked perfectly - pork chop, steak, chicken, seafood. And each dish is complimented by a bed of different vegetables cut to delicately sized pieces so you get a melange of each flavour in each bite.
Amazing food, big portions, super friendly staff. All the ingredients are extremely fresh and every part of the dish is home-cooked. Looking forward to be back soon.

I had the fish taco and half a chicken burrito.

The fish taco was light with a crisp taste that once bitten into gives you a satisfying crunch full of flavor. I only ordered 1 but I definitely could have easily eaten 12.

As delicious as the fish taco was the chicken burrito was absolutely scrumptious. Once I bit into it I immediately tasted the robust flavor created by the blend of fresh ingredients. It made me immediately want another bite, and much to my pleasant surprise I tasted  guacamole in my next bite. The only downside is that I was sharing with another person.

The atmosphere is nice for a crowd or a date although I imagine it's busier during the dinner hours as I was there for lunch.

name: China Garden
reviews: Workers are very respectful. I’ve actually become friends with one of the workers because I’ve gone there so much lol. The food is great, great selection of food and drinks. The food is amazing, prices are great too. In my opinion, best Chinese Restaurant in NYC.
Roast pork with mix veg. They use fresh ingredients. Taste better than most Chinese places like this.
Exceptional food, super nice employees, consistently excellent mood. They charge affordable prices and the food quality is awesome. Great work.
Spicy shrimp meal was tasty
roast pork garlic sauce $6 fine and filling

name: Pitanga
reviews: This place is heaven. I tried for the first time a bowl like this, and it was p e r f e c t (delicious, and affordable price, around $11). The environment was great, peaceful and pleasant to be there). Then I tried the "pan de queijo" (cheese bread) and I almost cried: just exquisite!!!!!!! Looking forward to go back.

Great place! I had two vegan friends, one vegetarian and one regular ahaha, and everyone have found delicious food to eat. Atmosphere is amazing, I’m in love with sharing tables, where you could sit with different people and make new friends. Food is fresh and beautiful, personnel is very helpful and friendly, this place is simple and made with taste. And also their orange juice was good. Thank you guys.
Good coffee! The menu seems really healthy and delicious but I do not have time to try them. Will come by next time!

Incredibly unwelcoming experience in this cafe. Upon arrival, the server at the counter proceeded to talk to a friend (who had actually entered after us) rather than welcome us, and we seated ourselves. When we went up to the counter to order, the same server excused himself, saying ‘give me a minute’ — it turned out the pressing duty he was attending to was examining that same friend’s ring! When he did finally come back to take my order (after five minutes of me standing idle at the counter), his whole demeanour smacked of me being an imposition on his time. 

It then turned out that the cafe had run out of certain menu items we wanted to order; while this in and of itself is fine, no apology was given — not fine.

All of this may have been balanced out if the food had been of a superlative quality. It was not. We ordered the Brazilian breakfast (which, by the way, was served to us while the server was on the phone...) and it was little more than reheated black bean soup. Such little care had been taken in its preparation that I found eggshell fragments in my meal (see attached picture). 

Overall, unless you A) know the waitstaff personally; and/or B) have a penchant for underwhelming and overpriced food, I would suggest that you avoid this place.
Great food and coffee. Definitely worth revisiting again and again.

name: Tony's Pizza
reviews:
Amazing slices.
Yes slices are $3+ (including tax)
But definitely worth it at least once. I loveeee their sauce. They also sell slices of cake, cookies and sorbet.
Everything looks delicious.
They don't have any physical menus. Look online, it will show their prices too.

It was my first time here and I took pepper-mozzarella pizza slice. Not impressed at all. Doesn’t worth its price (which is not cheap at all for pizza. And prepare cash). Didn’t try other food and will not come back for sure.
Is proud from 1969 same taste and same great service at there, small place but gigant in taste service.

Don’t ever go in here hungry lol you’ll want to buy everything in there. The pizza is so delicious. That’s the only thing I’ve had so far. I told myself you will not eat a pastry or any gelato no matter how decadent it looks. I am saving that for a special occasion. The cashiers are friendly and move quick. There’s a young Italian gentleman who’s cute and flirty . Overall it’s a cute clean establishment. I did see a bathroom. They have seating and is usually packed.
Amazing pizza amazing staff cozy environment I would definitely come here again

name: Mi Bella Dama
reviews: Great place to eat. Staff is friendly and helpful. They play Spanish hit music so if that's not your scene then this isn't for you. However, if you are into that scene, you will love this place. There is no cover at the door as well. Also, Friday, Sat, & Sun are the best days. Saturday is the most crowded, however the flavor of Sunday's karaoke adds alot of fun to you're weekend mix. ✊👊✌👌

We met with friends at this place for dinner. we heard about this spot from many people.  Well, it was a winning. The staff members welcomed us with a smile and we had an excellent feeling. The meal was great. We enjoyed every moment and we will definitely return to this restaurant. We recommend this place to all.
Excellent and delightful food, I like the vibes the place has, and the staff members were friendly. I will definitely visit here again.
Great place. Security was very polite.
prices fluctuate depending on ethnicity, combos are a good deal for delivery! Food is always good.

name: hills kitchen
reviews: The best Nigerian restaurant in Brooklyn. If you’re ever in the area you have to stop by and indulge. Server was very nice and prompt. Food came out great.

Was in the Bushwick area when I discovered this place and was pleasantly surprised to find an African restaurant in the area. Naturally I had to stop in for a bite. The service was wonderful, I didn’t have to wait too long for my food and the food itself was exquisite. Will definitely be coming back for more.

This is the newest Nigerian Restaurant in the NYC area.
I must say they are off to a great start!
The restaurant was very clean nice and cozy (very good for dine in).
They offer take home options also.
The staff were very friendly, attentive and swift. (For a Nigerian restaurant the service was super quick).

NOW THE FOOD: AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
they offer a vast variety of Nigerian cuisines especially the exotic soups and stews. 
I was very impressed with the food and the size portions were very decent (I couldn't finish my meal).

Overall, I'll highly recommend anyone looking for good Nigerian food in the NYC area to visit!

Great kitchen....Made me to be at home while am visiting new York. Now I don't need to worry about my African delicacies since Hills kitchen is around.  You need to have the experience of the real jollof rice. Still smiling.
Neat environment.  Their food are so delicious, good consumers service.

name: La Tapatia Deli Grocery
reviews: Great food and with a small cheap menu , but the reason why I’m not giving it a 5 is because of the cleanliness environment. It’s not The cleanest Mexican restaurant, and they have a bunch of boxes around the tables which kinda is a bummer. But other than that, and if you don’t mind that, Highly recommend this place!

A real gem in gentrifying Bushwick! The gentle couple running the place are great people who put care into their food, so the wait may be a bit longer than at other neighborhood joints. The huarache and picada are the most unique items on the menu, definitely must tries along with the pozole on weekends.
Love their food simply the best
Great authentic Mexican food. Looks a little sketchy.
Best tacos I ever had.

name: Bella Cholulita
reviews: small space but cozy, super friendly, good food, and the view of the park across the street is awesome.
Wow. I ordered some tacos today and was very impressed. Best in the neighborhood. Will be my go to Mexican delivery spot.
Small hole in the wall that has excellent tacos. Soft tortilla shells with really excellent meats. The beef cheek taco was extremely good, well balanced with flavors and textures

This is hands down my favorite Mexican restaurant in Brooklyn. The barbacoa and pancita on weekends are fantastic, and a great selection of aguas frescas. The pozole tastes hearty and the serving is large, great for a Sunday lunch just like home.
Their burrito are amazing the staff is on point clean peaceful environment.

name: Sushi & Noodles
reviews:
This is one of my favorite restaurants I have ever been to. The lady who works FOH is an actual angel, I literally miss her presence in my life if I don't go to Sushi Noodle every few weeks. I have a slight addiction to the white fish dinner box, it is delicious EVERY time. 
Super cute place to go on a date and it's BYOB! 
All the love for Sushi Noodle.
I love this place , the owners are amazing and the food is delicious 😋. Their sushi 🍣 is so yummy 😋 that I kept re ordering it anytime I went there not forgetting the fried rice 🍚

Decent food and decent service if you are a decent person. A classic and lovely mom and pop sushi spot with great prices and an overall fantastic cozy and classy hole in the wall vibe. 

Definitely a neighborhood jewel.

Saw the good reviews on yelp and google so I decided to try this place, I got a 2 roll takeout, when I bit into the 3rd roll there was a staple in it. I called and they apologized and offered to give me my money back and make me new rolls. My whole thing is that this shouldn't of happened in the first place.
Great sushi for a reasonable price! The sushi combo for 2 was a good choice for a date night.

name: Alegria Bar & Grill
reviews: One of the best pupusas I’ve ever had. Amazingly priced and personally made on the spot by Amanda herself. 10/10 recommend.
A friendly grandmother makes fresh papusas in the back, what else do you want?
The pupusas were delicious and authentic, the same lady who has been on the block for years now has this larger space to offer a sit down experience, give it a try!
